article-14-para-7.title: Article 14(7)
article-14-para-7.excerpt: (g) the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling, referred to in Article 22(1) and (4) and, at least in those cases, meaningful information about the logic involved, as well as the significance and the envisaged consequences of such processing for the data subject.

article-15-para-1.title: Article 15(1)
article-15-para-1.excerpt: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and the following information:

article-15-para-3.title: Article 15(3)
article-15-para-3.excerpt: The controller shall provide a copy of the personal data undergoing processing. For any further copies requested by the data subject, the controller may charge a reasonable fee based on administrative costs. Where the data subject makes the request by electronic means, and unless otherwise...

article-15-para-4.title: Article 15(4)
article-15-para-4.excerpt: The right to obtain a copy referred to in paragraph 3 shall not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others.

article-15-para-5.title: Article 15(5)

article-15-para-7.title: Article 15(7)

article-15-para-8.title: Article 15(8)

article-15-para-2.title: Article 15(2)
article-15-para-2.excerpt: Where personal data are transferred to a third country or to an international organisation, the data subject shall have the right to be informed of the appropriate safeguards pursuant to Article 46 relating to the transfer.

article-17-para-1.title: Article 17(1)
article-17-para-1.excerpt: (a) for exercising the right of freedom of expression and information;

article-17-para-2.title: Article 17(2)
article-17-para-2.excerpt: (b) for compliance with a legal obligation which requires processing by Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject or for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller;

article-17-para-3.title: Article 17(3)
article-17-para-3.excerpt: (c) for reasons of public interest in the area of public health in accordance with points (h) and (i) of Article 9(2) as well as Article 9(3);

article-17-para-5.title: Article 17(5)

article-17-para-6.title: Article 17(6)

article-18-para-1.title: Article 18(1)
article-18-para-1.excerpt: (a) the accuracy of the personal data is contested by the data subject, for a period enabling the controller to verify the accuracy of the personal data;

article-18-para-2.title: Article 18(2)
article-18-para-2.excerpt: Where processing has been restricted under paragraph 1, such personal data shall, with the exception of storage, only be processed with the data subject's consent or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or for the protection of the rights of another natural or legal person or...

article-18-para-3.title: Article 18(3)
article-18-para-3.excerpt: A data subject who has obtained restriction of processing pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be informed by the controller before the restriction of processing is lifted.

article-18-para-4.title: Article 18(4)

article-20-para-2.title: Article 20(2)
article-20-para-2.excerpt: In exercising his or her right to data portability pursuant to paragraph 1, the data subject shall have the right to have the personal data transmitted directly from one controller to another, where technically feasible.

article-20-para-3.title: Article 20(3)
article-20-para-3.excerpt: The exercise of the right referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article shall be without prejudice to Article 17. That right shall not apply to processing necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

article-20-para-4.title: Article 20(4)
article-20-para-4.excerpt: The right referred to in paragraph 1 shall not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others.

article-21-para-1.title: Article 21(1)
article-21-para-1.excerpt: The data subject shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including profiling based on those provisions. The controller shall no longer...

article-21-para-2.title: Article 21(2)
article-21-para-2.excerpt: Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing.

article-21-para-3.title: Article 21(3)
article-21-para-3.excerpt: Where the data subject objects to processing for direct marketing purposes, the personal data shall no longer be processed for such purposes.

article-21-para-4.title: Article 21(4)
article-21-para-4.excerpt: At the latest at the time of the first communication with the data subject, the right referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be explicitly brought to the attention of the data subject and shall be presented clearly and separately from any other information.

article-21-para-5.title: Article 21(5)
article-21-para-5.excerpt: In the context of the use of information society services, and notwithstanding Directive 2002/58/EC, the data subject may exercise his or her right to object by automated means using technical specifications.

article-21-para-6.title: Article 21(6)
article-21-para-6.excerpt: Where personal data are processed for scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes pursuant to Article 89(1), the data subject, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, shall have the right to object to processing of personal data concerning him or her, unless...

article-22-para-1.title: Article 22(1)
article-22-para-1.excerpt: (a) is necessary for entering into, or performance of, a contract between the data subject and a data controller;

article-22-para-2.title: Article 22(2)
article-22-para-2.excerpt: (b) is authorised by Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject and which also lays down suitable measures to safeguard the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests; or

article-22-para-3.title: Article 22(3)
article-22-para-3.excerpt: In the cases referred to in points (a) and (c) of paragraph 2, the data controller shall implement suitable measures to safeguard the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests, at least the right to obtain human intervention on the part of the controller, to express his or her...

article-22-para-4.title: Article 22(4)
article-22-para-4.excerpt: Decisions referred to in paragraph 2 shall not be based on special categories of personal data referred to in Article 9(1), unless point (a) or (g) of Article 9(2) applies and suitable measures to safeguard the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests are in place.

article-23-para-1.title: Article 23(1)
article-23-para-1.excerpt: (a) the purposes of the processing or categories of processing;

article-23-para-4.title: Article 23(4)
article-23-para-4.excerpt: (d) the safeguards to prevent abuse or unlawful access or transfer;

article-23-para-5.title: Article 23(5)
article-23-para-5.excerpt: (e) the specification of the controller or categories of controllers;

article-23-para-6.title: Article 23(6)
article-23-para-6.excerpt: (f) the storage periods and the applicable safeguards taking into account the nature, scope and purposes of the processing or categories of processing;

article-23-para-7.title: Article 23(7)
article-23-para-7.excerpt: (g) the risks to the rights and freedoms of data subjects; and

article-23-para-8.title: Article 23(8)
article-23-para-8.excerpt: (h) the right of data subjects to be informed about the restriction, unless that may be prejudicial to the purpose of the restriction.

article-23-para-9.title: Article 23(9)
article-23-para-9.excerpt: (i) the protection of the data subject or the rights and freedoms of others;

article-23-para-2.title: Article 23(2)
article-23-para-2.excerpt: In particular, any legislative measure referred to in paragraph 1 shall contain specific provisions at least, where relevant, as to:

article-24-para-1.title: Article 24(1)
article-24-para-1.excerpt: Taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risks of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure and to be able to demonstrate...

article-24-para-2.title: Article 24(2)
article-24-para-2.excerpt: Where proportionate in relation to processing activities, the measures referred to in paragraph 1 shall include the implementation of appropriate data protection policies by the controller.

article-24-para-3.title: Article 24(3)
article-24-para-3.excerpt: Adherence to approved codes of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or approved certification mechanisms as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the obligations of the controller.

article-25-para-1.title: Article 25(1)
article-25-para-1.excerpt: Taking into account the state of the art, the cost of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risks of varying likelihood and severity for rights and freedoms of natural persons posed by the processing, the controller shall, both at the time of the...

article-25-para-2.title: Article 25(2)
article-25-para-2.excerpt: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures for ensuring that, by default, only personal data which are necessary for each specific purpose of the processing are processed. That obligation applies to the amount of personal data collected, the extent of their...

article-25-para-3.title: Article 25(3)
article-25-para-3.excerpt: An approved certification mechanism pursuant to Article 42 may be used as an element to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Article.

article-26-para-1.title: Article 26(1)
article-26-para-1.excerpt: Where two or more controllers jointly determine the purposes and means of processing, they shall be joint controllers. They shall in a transparent manner determine their respective responsibilities for compliance with the obligations under this Regulation, in particular as regards the exercising of...

article-26-para-2.title: Article 26(2)
article-26-para-2.excerpt: The arrangement referred to in paragraph 1 shall duly reflect the respective roles and relationships of the joint controllers vis-à-vis the data subjects. The essence of the arrangement shall be made available to the data subject.

article-26-para-3.title: Article 26(3)
article-26-para-3.excerpt: Irrespective of the terms of the arrangement referred to in paragraph 1, the data subject may exercise his or her rights under this Regulation in respect of and against each of the controllers.

article-27-para-1.title: Article 27(1)
article-27-para-1.excerpt: (a) processing which is occasional, does not include, on a large scale, processing of special categories of data as referred to in Article 9(1) or processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences referred to in Article 10, and is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights...

article-27-para-2.title: Article 27(2)
article-27-para-2.excerpt: The obligation laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article shall not apply to:

article-27-para-3.title: Article 27(3)
article-27-para-3.excerpt: The representative shall be established in one of the Member States where the data subjects, whose personal data are processed in relation to the offering of goods or services to them, or whose behaviour is monitored, are.

article-27-para-4.title: Article 27(4)
article-27-para-4.excerpt: The representative shall be mandated by the controller or processor to be addressed in addition to or instead of the controller or the processor by, in particular, supervisory authorities and data subjects, on all issues related to processing, for the purposes of ensuring compliance with this...

article-27-para-5.title: Article 27(5)
article-27-para-5.excerpt: The designation of a representative by the controller or processor shall be without prejudice to legal actions which could be initiated against the controller or the processor themselves.

article-28-para-1.title: Article 28(1)
article-28-para-1.excerpt: (a) processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the...

article-28-para-2.title: Article 28(2)
article-28-para-2.excerpt: (b) ensures that persons authorised to process the personal data have committed themselves to confidentiality or are under an appropriate statutory obligation of confidentiality;

article-28-para-3.title: Article 28(3)
article-28-para-3.excerpt: (c) takes all measures required pursuant to Article 32;

article-28-para-4.title: Article 28(4)
article-28-para-4.excerpt: Where a processor engages another processor for carrying out specific processing activities on behalf of the controller, the same data protection obligations as set out in the contract or other legal act between the controller and the processor as referred to in paragraph 3 shall be imposed on that...

article-28-para-5.title: Article 28(5)
article-28-para-5.excerpt: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.

article-28-para-6.title: Article 28(6)
article-28-para-6.excerpt: Without prejudice to an individual contract between the controller and the processor, the contract or the other legal act referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 of this Article may be based, in whole or in part, on standard contractual clauses referred to in paragraphs 7 and 8 of this Article, including...

article-28-para-7.title: Article 28(7)
article-28-para-7.excerpt: The Commission may lay down standard contractual clauses for the matters referred to in paragraph 3 and 4 of this Article and in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 93(2).

article-28-para-8.title: Article 28(8)
article-28-para-8.excerpt: A supervisory authority may adopt standard contractual clauses for the matters referred to in paragraph 3 and 4 of this Article and in accordance with the consistency mechanism referred to in Article 63.

article-28-para-9.title: Article 28(9)
article-28-para-9.excerpt: The contract or the other legal act referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 shall be in writing, including in electronic form.

article-28-para-10.title: Article 28(10)
article-28-para-10.excerpt: Without prejudice to Articles 82, 83 and 84, if a processor infringes this Regulation by determining the purposes and means of processing, the processor shall be considered to be a controller in respect of that processing.

article-30-para-1.title: Article 30(1)
article-30-para-1.excerpt: (a) the name and contact details of the processor or processors and of each controller on behalf of which the processor is acting, and, where applicable, of the controller 's or the processor 's representative, and the data protection officer;

article-30-para-3.title: Article 30(3)
article-30-para-3.excerpt: The records referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be in writing, including in electronic form.

article-30-para-4.title: Article 30(4)
article-30-para-4.excerpt: The controller or the processor and, where applicable, the controller 's or the processor 's representative, shall make the record available to the supervisory authority on request.

article-30-para-5.title: Article 30(5)
article-30-para-5.excerpt: The obligations referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not apply to an enterprise or an organisation employing fewer than 250 persons unless the processing it carries out is likely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects, the processing is not occasional, or the processing...

article-30-para-6.title: Article 30(6)
article-30-para-6.excerpt: (f) where possible, the envisaged time limits for erasure of the different categories of data;

article-30-para-7.title: Article 30(7)
article-30-para-7.excerpt: (g) where possible, a general description of the technical and organisational security measures referred to in Article 32(1).

article-30-para-2.title: Article 30(2)
article-30-para-2.excerpt: (b) the categories of processing carried out on behalf of each controller;

article-32-para-1.title: Article 32(1)
article-32-para-1.excerpt: (a) the pseudonymisation and encryption of personal data;

article-32-para-2.title: Article 32(2)
article-32-para-2.excerpt: In assessing the appropriate level of security account shall be taken in particular of the risks that are presented by processing, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise...

article-32-para-3.title: Article 32(3)
article-32-para-3.excerpt: Adherence to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article.

article-32-para-4.title: Article 32(4)
article-32-para-4.excerpt: The controller and processor shall take steps to ensure that any natural person acting under the authority of the controller or the processor who has access to personal data does not process them except on instructions from the controller, unless he or she is required to do so by Union or Member...

article-33-para-1.title: Article 33(1)
article-33-para-1.excerpt: (a) describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned;

article-33-para-2.title: Article 33(2)
article-33-para-2.excerpt: (b) communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained;

article-33-para-3.title: Article 33(3)
article-33-para-3.excerpt: (c) describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach;

article-33-para-4.title: Article 33(4)
article-33-para-4.excerpt: Where, and in so far as, it is not possible to provide the information at the same time, the information may be provided in phases without undue further delay.

article-33-para-5.title: Article 33(5)
article-33-para-5.excerpt: The controller shall document any personal data breaches, comprising the facts relating to the personal data breach, its effects and the remedial action taken. That documentation shall enable the supervisory authority to verify compliance with this Article.

article-34-para-1.title: Article 34(1)
article-34-para-1.excerpt: (a) the controller has implemented appropriate technical and organisational protection measures, and those measures were applied to the personal data affected by the personal data breach, in particular those that render the personal data unintelligible to any person who is not authorised to access...

article-34-para-2.title: Article 34(2)
article-34-para-2.excerpt: (b) the controller has taken subsequent measures which ensure that the high risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects referred to in paragraph 1 is no longer likely to materialise;

article-34-para-3.title: Article 34(3)
article-34-para-3.excerpt: (c) it would involve disproportionate effort. In such a case, there shall instead be a public communication or similar measure whereby the data subjects are informed in an equally effective manner.

article-34-para-4.title: Article 34(4)
article-34-para-4.excerpt: If the controller has not already communicated the personal data breach to the data subject, the supervisory authority, having considered the likelihood of the personal data breach resulting in a high risk, may require it to do so or may decide that any of the conditions referred to in paragraph 3...

article-35-para-1.title: Article 35(1)
article-35-para-1.excerpt: (a) a systematic description of the envisaged processing operations and the purposes of the processing, including, where applicable, the legitimate interest pursued by the controller;

article-35-para-2.title: Article 35(2)
article-35-para-2.excerpt: (b) an assessment of the necessity and proportionality of the processing operations in relation to the purposes;

article-35-para-3.title: Article 35(3)
article-35-para-3.excerpt: (c) an assessment of the risks to the rights and freedoms of data subjects referred to in paragraph 1; and

article-35-para-4.title: Article 35(4)
article-35-para-4.excerpt: (d) the measures envisaged to address the risks, including safeguards, security measures and mechanisms to ensure the protection of personal data and to demonstrate compliance with this Regulation taking into account the rights and legitimate interests of data subjects and other persons concerned.

article-35-para-5.title: Article 35(5)
article-35-para-5.excerpt: The supervisory authority may also establish and make public a list of the kind of processing operations for which no data protection impact assessment is required. The supervisory authority shall communicate those lists to the Board.

article-35-para-6.title: Article 35(6)
article-35-para-6.excerpt: Prior to the adoption of the lists referred to in paragraphs 4 and 5, the competent supervisory authority shall apply the consistency mechanism referred to in Article 63 where such lists involve processing activities which are related to the offering of goods or services to data subjects or to the...

article-35-para-8.title: Article 35(8)
article-35-para-8.excerpt: Compliance with approved codes of conduct referred to in Article 40 by the relevant controllers or processors shall be taken into due account in assessing the impact of the processing operations performed by such controllers or processors, in particular for the purposes of a data protection impact...

article-35-para-9.title: Article 35(9)
article-35-para-9.excerpt: Where appropriate, the controller shall seek the views of data subjects or their representatives on the intended processing, without prejudice to the protection of commercial or public interests or the security of processing operations.

article-35-para-10.title: Article 35(10)
article-35-para-10.excerpt: Where processing pursuant to point (c) or (e) of Article 6(1) has a legal basis in Union law or in the law of the Member State to which the controller is subject, that law regulates the specific processing operation or set of operations in question, and a data protection impact assessment has...

article-35-para-11.title: Article 35(11)
article-35-para-11.excerpt: Where necessary, the controller shall carry out a review to assess if processing is performed in accordance with the data protection impact assessment at least when there is a change of the risk represented by processing operations.

article-36-para-1.title: Article 36(1)
article-36-para-1.excerpt: (a) where applicable, the respective responsibilities of the controller, joint controllers and processors involved in the processing, in particular for processing within a group of undertakings;

article-36-para-2.title: Article 36(2)
article-36-para-2.excerpt: (b) the purposes and means of the intended processing;

article-36-para-3.title: Article 36(3)
article-36-para-3.excerpt: (c) the measures and safeguards provided to protect the rights and freedoms of data subjects pursuant to this Regulation;

article-36-para-4.title: Article 36(4)
article-36-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall consult the supervisory authority during the preparation of a proposal for a legislative measure to be adopted by a national parliament, or of a regulatory measure based on such a legislative measure, which relates to processing.

article-36-para-5.title: Article 36(5)
article-36-para-5.excerpt: Notwithstanding paragraph 1, Member State law may require controllers to consult with, and obtain prior authorisation from, the supervisory authority in relation to processing by a controller for the performance of a task carried out by the controller in the public interest, including processing in...

article-36-para-6.title: Article 36(6)
article-36-para-6.excerpt: (f) any other information requested by the supervisory authority.

article-37-para-1.title: Article 37(1)
article-37-para-1.excerpt: (a) the processing is carried out by a public authority or body, except for courts acting in their judicial capacity;

article-37-para-2.title: Article 37(2)
article-37-para-2.excerpt: A group of undertakings may appoint a single data protection officer provided that a data protection officer is easily accessible from each establishment.

article-37-para-3.title: Article 37(3)
article-37-para-3.excerpt: Where the controller or the processor is a public authority or body, a single data protection officer may be designated for several such authorities or bodies, taking account of their organisational structure and size.

article-37-para-4.title: Article 37(4)
article-37-para-4.excerpt: In cases other than those referred to in paragraph 1, the controller or processor or associations and other bodies representing categories of controllers or processors may or, where required by Union or Member State law shall, designate a data protection officer. The data protection officer may act...

article-37-para-5.title: Article 37(5)
article-37-para-5.excerpt: The data protection officer shall be designated on the basis of professional qualities and, in particular, expert knowledge of data protection law and practices and the ability to fulfil the tasks referred to in Article 39.

article-37-para-6.title: Article 37(6)
article-37-para-6.excerpt: The data protection officer may be a staff member of the controller or processor, or fulfil the tasks on the basis of a service contract.

article-37-para-7.title: Article 37(7)
article-37-para-7.excerpt: The controller or the processor shall publish the contact details of the data protection officer and communicate them to the supervisory authority.

article-38-para-1.title: Article 38(1)
article-38-para-1.excerpt: The controller and the processor shall ensure that the data protection officer is involved, properly and in a timely manner, in all issues which relate to the protection of personal data.

article-38-para-2.title: Article 38(2)
article-38-para-2.excerpt: The controller and processor shall support the data protection officer in performing the tasks referred to in Article 39 by providing resources necessary to carry out those tasks and access to personal data and processing operations, and to maintain his or her expert knowledge.

article-38-para-3.title: Article 38(3)
article-38-para-3.excerpt: The controller and processor shall ensure that the data protection officer does not receive any instructions regarding the exercise of those tasks. He or she shall not be dismissed or penalised by the controller or the processor for performing his tasks. The data protection officer shall directly...

article-38-para-4.title: Article 38(4)
article-38-para-4.excerpt: Data subjects may contact the data protection officer with regard to all issues related to processing of their personal data and to the exercise of their rights under this Regulation.

article-38-para-5.title: Article 38(5)
article-38-para-5.excerpt: The data protection officer shall be bound by secrecy or confidentiality concerning the performance of his or her tasks, in accordance with Union or Member State law.

article-38-para-6.title: Article 38(6)
article-38-para-6.excerpt: The data protection officer may fulfil other tasks and duties. The controller or processor shall ensure that any such tasks and duties do not result in a conflict of interests.

article-39-para-1.title: Article 39(1)
article-39-para-1.excerpt: (a) to inform and advise the controller or the processor and the employees who carry out processing of their obligations pursuant to this Regulation and to other Union or Member State data protection provisions;

article-39-para-2.title: Article 39(2)
article-39-para-2.excerpt: The data protection officer shall in the performance of his or her tasks have due regard to the risk associated with processing operations, taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing.

article-39-para-3.title: Article 39(3)
article-39-para-3.excerpt: (c) to provide advice where requested as regards the data protection impact assessment and monitor its performance pursuant to Article 35;

article-39-para-5.title: Article 39(5)
article-39-para-5.excerpt: (e) to act as the contact point for the supervisory authority on issues relating to processing, including the prior consultation referred to in Article 36, and to consult, where appropriate, with regard to any other matter.

article-40-para-1.title: Article 40(1)
article-40-para-1.excerpt: The Member States, the supervisory authorities, the Board and the Commission shall encourage the drawing up of codes of conduct intended to contribute to the proper application of this Regulation, taking account of the specific features of the various processing sectors and the specific needs of...

article-40-para-2.title: Article 40(2)
article-40-para-2.excerpt: (b) the legitimate interests pursued by controllers in specific contexts;

article-40-para-5.title: Article 40(5)
article-40-para-5.excerpt: Associations and other bodies referred to in paragraph 2 of this Article which intend to prepare a code of conduct or to amend or extend an existing code shall submit the draft code, amendment or extension to the supervisory authority which is competent pursuant to Article 55. The supervisory...

article-40-para-7.title: Article 40(7)
article-40-para-7.excerpt: Where a draft code of conduct relates to processing activities in several Member States, the supervisory authority which is competent pursuant to Article 55 shall, before approving the draft code, amendment or extension, submit it in the procedure referred to in Article 63 to the Board which shall...

article-40-para-8.title: Article 40(8)
article-40-para-8.excerpt: Where the opinion referred to in paragraph 7 confirms that the draft code, amendment or extension complies with this Regulation, or, in the situation referred to in paragraph 3, provides appropriate safeguards, the Board shall submit its opinion to the Commission.

article-40-para-9.title: Article 40(9)
article-40-para-9.excerpt: The Commission may, by way of implementing acts, decide that the approved code of conduct, amendment or extension submitted to it pursuant to paragraph 8 of this Article have general validity within the Union. Those implementing acts shall be adopted in accordance with the examination procedure set...

article-40-para-10.title: Article 40(10)
article-40-para-10.excerpt: The Commission shall ensure appropriate publicity for the approved codes which have been decided as having general validity in accordance with paragraph 9.

article-40-para-11.title: Article 40(11)
article-40-para-11.excerpt: The Board shall collate all approved codes of conduct, amendments and extensions in a register and shall make them publicly available by way of appropriate means.

article-40-para-3.title: Article 40(3)
article-40-para-3.excerpt: In addition to adherence by controllers or processors subject to this Regulation, codes of conduct approved pursuant to paragraph 5 of this Article and having general validity pursuant to paragraph 9 of this Article may also be adhered to by controllers or processors that are not subject to this...

article-40-para-4.title: Article 40(4)
article-40-para-4.excerpt: A code of conduct referred to in paragraph 2 of this Article shall contain mechanisms which enable the body referred to in Article 41(1) to carry out the mandatory monitoring of compliance with its provisions by the controllers or processors which undertake to apply it, without prejudice to the...

article-40-para-6.title: Article 40(6)
article-40-para-6.excerpt: Where the draft code, or amendment or extension is approved in accordance with paragraph 5, and where the code of conduct concerned does not relate to processing activities in several Member States, the supervisory authority shall register and publish the code.

article-41-para-1.title: Article 41(1)
article-41-para-1.excerpt: (a) demonstrated its independence and expertise in relation to the subject-matter of the code to the satisfaction of the competent supervisory authority;

article-41-para-2.title: Article 41(2)
article-41-para-2.excerpt: (b) established procedures which allow it to assess the eligibility of controllers and processors concerned to apply the code, to monitor their compliance with its provisions and to periodically review its operation;

article-41-para-3.title: Article 41(3)
article-41-para-3.excerpt: The competent supervisory authority shall submit the draft requirements for accreditation of a body as referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article to the Board pursuant to the consistency mechanism referred to in Article 63.

article-41-para-4.title: Article 41(4)
article-41-para-4.excerpt: Without prejudice to the tasks and powers of the competent supervisory authority and the provisions of Chapter VIII, a body as referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article shall, subject to appropriate safeguards, take appropriate action in cases of infringement of the code by a controller or...

article-41-para-5.title: Article 41(5)
article-41-para-5.excerpt: The competent supervisory authority shall revoke the accreditation of a body as referred to in paragraph 1 if the conditions for accreditation are not, or are no longer, met or where actions taken by the body infringe this Regulation.

article-41-para-6.title: Article 41(6)
article-41-para-6.excerpt: This Article shall not apply to processing carried out by public authorities and bodies.

article-42-para-1.title: Article 42(1)
article-42-para-1.excerpt: The Member States, the supervisory authorities, the Board and the Commission shall encourage, in particular at Union level, the establishment of data protection certification mechanisms and of data protection seals and marks, for the purpose of demonstrating compliance with this Regulation of...

article-42-para-2.title: Article 42(2)
article-42-para-2.excerpt: In addition to adherence by controllers or processors subject to this Regulation, data protection certification mechanisms, seals or marks approved pursuant to paragraph 5 of this Article may be established for the purpose of demonstrating the existence of appropriate safeguards provided by...

article-42-para-3.title: Article 42(3)
article-42-para-3.excerpt: The certification shall be voluntary and available via a process that is transparent.

article-42-para-4.title: Article 42(4)
article-42-para-4.excerpt: A certification pursuant to this Article does not reduce the responsibility of the controller or the processor for compliance with this Regulation and is without prejudice to the tasks and powers of the supervisory authorities which are competent pursuant to Article 55 or 56.

article-42-para-5.title: Article 42(5)
article-42-para-5.excerpt: A certification pursuant to this Article shall be issued by the certification bodies referred to in Article 43 or by the competent supervisory authority, on the basis of criteria approved by that competent supervisory authority pursuant to Article 58(3) or by the Board pursuant to Article 63. Where...

article-42-para-6.title: Article 42(6)

article-45-para-5.title: Article 45(5)

article-45-para-7.excerpt: A decision pursuant to paragraph 5 of this Article is without prejudice to transfers of personal data to the third country, a territory or one or more specified sectors within that third country, or the international organisation in question pursuant to Articles 46 to 49.

article-45-para-8.title: Article 45(8)

article-47-para-8.excerpt: (h) the tasks of any data protection officer designated in accordance with Article 37 or any other person or entity in charge of the monitoring compliance with the binding corporate rules within the group of undertakings, or group of enterprises engaged in a joint economic activity, as well as...

article-47-para-10.excerpt: (j) the mechanisms within the group of undertakings, or group of enterprises engaged in a joint economic activity for ensuring the verification of compliance with the binding corporate rules. article-47-para-11.title: Article 47(11)
article-47-para-11.excerpt: (k) the mechanisms for reporting and recording changes to the rules and reporting those changes to the supervisory authority;

article-47-para-12.title: Article 47(12)

article-47-para-13.title: Article 47(13)

article-49-para-2.title: Article 49(2)

article-49-para-3.excerpt: Points (a), (b) and (c) of the first subparagraph of paragraph 1 and the second subparagraph thereof shall not apply to activities carried out by public authorities in the exercise of their public powers.

article-49-para-4.title: Article 49(4)
article-49-para-4.excerpt: The public interest referred to in point (d) of the first subparagraph of paragraph 1 shall be recognised in Union law or in the law of the Member State to which the controller is subject.

article-49-para-5.title: Article 49(5)
article-49-para-5.excerpt: In the absence of an adequacy decision, Union or Member State law may, for important reasons of public interest, expressly set limits to the transfer of specific categories of personal data to a third country or an international organisation. article-49-para-6.excerpt: The controller or processor shall document the assessment as well as the suitable safeguards referred to in the second subparagraph of paragraph 1 of this Article in the records referred to in Article 30.

article-49-para-7.title: Article 49(7)
article-49-para-7.excerpt: (g) the transfer is made from a register which according to Union or Member State law is intended to provide information to the public and which is open to consultation either by the public in general or by any person who can demonstrate a legitimate interest, but only to the extent that the...

article-50-para-1.title: Article 50(1)
article-50-para-1.excerpt: (a) develop international cooperation mechanisms to facilitate the effective enforcement of legislation for the protection of personal data;

article-50-para-2.title: Article 50(2)

article-50-para-3.title: Article 50(3)
article-50-para-3.excerpt: (c) engage relevant stakeholders in discussion and activities aimed at furthering international cooperation in the enforcement of legislation for the protection of personal data;

article-50-para-4.title: Article 50(4)
article-50-para-4.excerpt: (d) promote the exchange and documentation of personal data protection legislation and practice, including on jurisdictional conflicts with third countries.

article-51-para-1.title: Article 51(1)
article-51-para-1.excerpt: Each Member State shall provide for one or more independent public authorities to be responsible for monitoring the application of this Regulation, in order to protect the fundamental rights and freedoms of natural persons in relation to processing and to facilitate the free flow of personal data...

article-51-para-2.title: Article 51(2)
article-51-para-2.excerpt: Each supervisory authority shall contribute to the consistent application of this Regulation throughout the Union. For that purpose, the supervisory authorities shall cooperate with each other and the Commission in accordance with Chapter VII.

article-51-para-3.title: Article 51(3)

article-51-para-4.title: Article 51(4)
article-51-para-4.excerpt: Each Member State shall notify to the Commission the provisions of its law which it adopts pursuant to this Chapter, by 25 May 2018 and, without delay, any subsequent amendment affecting them.

article-52-para-1.title: Article 52(1)
article-52-para-1.excerpt: Each supervisory authority shall act with complete independence in performing its tasks and exercising its powers in accordance with this Regulation.

article-52-para-2.title: Article 52(2)
article-52-para-2.excerpt: The member or members of each supervisory authority shall, in the performance of their tasks and exercise of their powers in accordance with this Regulation, remain free from external influence, whether direct or indirect, and shall neither seek nor take instructions from anybody.

article-52-para-3.title: Article 52(3)
article-52-para-3.excerpt: Member or members of each supervisory authority shall refrain from any action incompatible with their duties and shall not, during their term of office, engage in any incompatible occupation, whether gainful or not.

article-52-para-4.title: Article 52(4)
article-52-para-4.excerpt: Each Member State shall ensure that each supervisory authority is provided with the human, technical and financial resources, premises and infrastructure necessary for the effective performance of its tasks and exercise of its powers, including those to be carried out in the context of mutual...

article-52-para-5.title: Article 52(5)
article-52-para-5.excerpt: Each Member State shall ensure that each supervisory authority chooses and has its own staff which shall be subject to the exclusive direction of the member or members of the supervisory authority concerned.

article-52-para-6.title: Article 52(6)
article-52-para-6.excerpt: Each Member State shall ensure that each supervisory authority is subject to financial control which does not affect its independence and that it has separate, public annual budgets, which may be part of the overall state or national budget.

article-53-para-1.title: Article 53(1)
article-53-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall provide for each member of their supervisory authorities to be appointed by means of a transparent procedure by:

article-53-para-2.title: Article 53(2)
article-53-para-2.excerpt: Each member shall have the qualifications, experience and skills, in particular in the area of the protection of personal data, required to perform its duties and exercise its powers.

article-53-para-3.title: Article 53(3)
article-53-para-3.excerpt: The duties of a member shall end in the event of the expiry of the term of office, resignation or compulsory retirement, in accordance with the law of the Member State concerned.

article-53-para-4.title: Article 53(4)
article-53-para-4.excerpt: A member shall be dismissed only in cases of serious misconduct or if the member no longer fulfils the conditions required for the performance of the duties.

article-54-para-1.title: Article 54(1)

article-54-para-2.title: Article 54(2)
article-54-para-2.excerpt: The member or members and the staff of each supervisory authority shall, in accordance with Union or Member State law, be subject to a duty of professional secrecy both during and after their term of office, with regard to any confidential information which has come to their knowledge in the course...

article-54-para-3.title: Article 54(3)
article-54-para-3.excerpt: (c) the rules and procedures for the appointment of the member or members of each supervisory authority;

article-54-para-4.title: Article 54(4)
article-54-para-4.excerpt: (d) the duration of the term of the member or members of each supervisory authority of no less than four years, except for the first appointment after 24 May 2016, part of which may take place for a shorter period where that is necessary to protect the independence of the supervisory authority by...

article-54-para-5.title: Article 54(5)

article-54-para-6.title: Article 54(6)
article-54-para-6.excerpt: (f) the conditions governing the obligations of the member or members and staff of each supervisory authority, prohibitions on actions, occupations and benefits incompatible therewith during and after the term of office and rules governing the cessation of employment.

article-55-para-1.title: Article 55(1)
article-55-para-1.excerpt: Each supervisory authority shall be competent for the performance of the tasks assigned to and the exercise of the powers conferred on it in accordance with this Regulation on the territory of its own Member State.

article-55-para-2.title: Article 55(2)
article-55-para-2.excerpt: Where processing is carried out by public authorities or private bodies acting on the basis of point (c) or (e) of Article 6(1), the supervisory authority of the Member State concerned shall be competent. In such cases Article 56 does not apply.

article-55-para-3.title: Article 55(3)
article-55-para-3.excerpt: Supervisory authorities shall not be competent to supervise processing operations of courts acting in their judicial capacity.

article-56-para-1.title: Article 56(1)

article-56-para-2.title: Article 56(2)
article-56-para-2.excerpt: By derogation from paragraph 1, each supervisory authority shall be competent to handle a complaint lodged with it or a possible infringement of this Regulation, if the subject matter relates only to an establishment in its Member State or substantially affects data subjects only in its Member...

article-56-para-3.excerpt: In the cases referred to in paragraph 2 of this Article, the supervisory authority shall inform the lead supervisory authority without delay on that matter. article-56-para-5.title: Article 56(5)
article-56-para-5.excerpt: Where the lead supervisory authority decides not to handle the case, the supervisory authority which informed the lead supervisory authority shall handle it according to Articles 61 and 62.

article-56-para-6.title: Article 56(6)
article-56-para-6.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority shall be the sole interlocutor of the controller or processor for the cross-border processing carried out by that controller or processor.

article-57-para-1.title: Article 57(1)
article-57-para-1.excerpt: (a) monitor and enforce the application of this Regulation;

article-57-para-2.title: Article 57(2)
article-57-para-2.excerpt: Each supervisory authority shall facilitate the submission of complaints referred to in point (f) of paragraph 1 by measures such as a complaint submission form which can also be completed electronically, without excluding other means of communication.

article-57-para-3.title: Article 57(3)
article-57-para-3.excerpt: The performance of the tasks of each supervisory authority shall be free of charge for the data subject and, where applicable, for the data protection officer.

article-57-para-4.title: Article 57(4)
article-57-para-4.excerpt: Where requests are manifestly unfounded or excessive, in particular because of their repetitive character, the supervisory authority may charge a reasonable fee based on administrative costs, or refuse to act on the request. article-57-para-5.title: Article 57(5)
article-57-para-5.excerpt: (e) upon request, provide information to any data subject concerning the exercise of their rights under this Regulation and, if appropriate, cooperate with the supervisory authorities in other Member States to that end;

article-57-para-6.title: Article 57(6)
article-57-para-6.excerpt: (f) handle complaints lodged by a data subject, or by a body, organisation or association in accordance with Article 80, and investigate, to the extent appropriate, the subject matter of the complaint and inform the complainant of the progress and the outcome of the investigation within a...

article-57-para-7.excerpt: (g) cooperate with, including sharing information and provide mutual assistance to, other supervisory authorities with a view to ensuring the consistency of application and enforcement of this Regulation;

article-57-para-8.title: Article 57(8)
article-57-para-8.excerpt: (h) conduct investigations on the application of this Regulation, including on the basis of information received from another supervisory authority or other public authority;

article-57-para-9.title: Article 57(9)
article-57-para-9.excerpt: (i) monitor relevant developments, insofar as they have an impact on the protection of personal data, in particular the development of information and communication technologies and commercial practices;

article-57-para-10.title: Article 57(10)
article-57-para-10.excerpt: (j) adopt standard contractual clauses referred to in Article 28(8) and in point (d) of Article 46(2);

article-57-para-11.title: Article 57(11)
article-57-para-11.excerpt: (k) establish and maintain a list in relation to the requirement for data protection impact assessment pursuant to Article 35(4);

article-57-para-12.title: Article 57(12)
article-57-para-12.excerpt: (l) give advice on the processing operations referred to in Article 36(2);

article-57-para-13.title: Article 57(13)
article-57-para-13.excerpt: (m) encourage the drawing up of codes of conduct pursuant to Article 40(1) and provide an opinion and approve such codes of conduct which provide sufficient safeguards, pursuant to Article 40(5);

article-57-para-15.title: Article 57(15)
article-57-para-15.excerpt: (o) where applicable, carry out a periodic review of certifications issued in accordance with Article 42(7);

article-57-para-17.title: Article 57(17)

article-58-para-1.excerpt: (a) to advise the controller in accordance with the prior consultation procedure referred to in Article 36;

article-58-para-2.title: Article 58(2)
article-58-para-2.excerpt: (b) to issue, on its own initiative or on request, opinions to the national parliament, the Member State government or, in accordance with Member State law, to other institutions and bodies as well as to the public on any issue related to the protection of personal data;

article-58-para-3.title: Article 58(3)
article-58-para-3.excerpt: (c) to authorise processing referred to in Article 36(5), if the law of the Member State requires such prior authorisation;

article-58-para-4.title: Article 58(4)
article-58-para-4.excerpt: The exercise of the powers conferred on the supervisory authority pursuant to this Article shall be subject to appropriate safeguards, including effective judicial remedy and due process, set out in Union and Member State law in accordance with the Charter.

article-58-para-5.title: Article 58(5)
article-58-para-5.excerpt: Each Member State shall provide by law that its supervisory authority shall have the power to bring infringements of this Regulation to the attention of the judicial authorities and where appropriate, to commence or engage otherwise in legal proceedings, in order to enforce the provisions of this...

article-58-para-6.excerpt: Each Member State may provide by law that its supervisory authority shall have additional powers to those referred to in paragraphs 1, 2 and 3. The exercise of those powers shall not impair the effective operation of Chapter VII.

article-58-para-7.title: Article 58(7)
article-58-para-7.excerpt: (g) to adopt standard data protection clauses referred to in Article 28(8) and in point (d) of Article 46(2);

article-58-para-8.title: Article 58(8)
article-58-para-8.excerpt: (h) to authorise contractual clauses referred to in point (a) of Article 46(3);

article-58-para-9.title: Article 58(9)
article-58-para-9.excerpt: (i) to authorise administrative arrangements referred to in point (b) of Article 46(3);

article-58-para-10.title: Article 58(10)
article-58-para-10.excerpt: (j) to approve binding corporate rules pursuant to Article 47.

article-60-para-1.title: Article 60(1)
article-60-para-1.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority shall cooperate with the other supervisory authorities concerned in accordance with this Article in an endeavour to reach consensus. The lead supervisory authority and the supervisory authorities concerned shall exchange all relevant information with each other.

article-60-para-2.title: Article 60(2)
article-60-para-2.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority may request at any time other supervisory authorities concerned to provide mutual assistance pursuant to Article 61 and may conduct joint operations pursuant to Article 62, in particular for carrying out investigations or for monitoring the implementation of a measure...

article-60-para-3.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority shall, without delay, communicate the relevant information on the matter to the other supervisory authorities concerned. It shall without delay submit a draft decision to the other supervisory authorities concerned for their opinion and take due account of their views.

article-60-para-4.title: Article 60(4)
article-60-para-4.excerpt: Where any of the other supervisory authorities concerned within a period of four weeks after having been consulted in accordance with paragraph 3 of this Article, expresses a relevant and reasoned objection to the draft decision, the lead supervisory authority shall, if it does not follow the...

article-60-para-5.excerpt: Where the lead supervisory authority intends to follow the relevant and reasoned objection made, it shall submit to the other supervisory authorities concerned a revised draft decision for their opinion.
