article-60-para-6.title: Article 60(6)
article-60-para-6.excerpt: Where none of the other supervisory authorities concerned has objected to the draft decision submitted by the lead supervisory authority within the period referred to in paragraphs 4 and 5, the lead supervisory authority and the supervisory authorities concerned shall be deemed to be in agreement...

article-60-para-7.title: Article 60(7)
article-60-para-7.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority shall adopt and notify the decision to the main establishment or single establishment of the controller or processor, as the case may be and inform the other supervisory authorities concerned and the Board of the decision in question, including a summary of the...

article-60-para-8.title: Article 60(8)
article-60-para-8.excerpt: By derogation from paragraph 7, where a complaint is dismissed or rejected, the supervisory authority with which the complaint was lodged shall adopt the decision and notify it to the complainant and shall inform the controller thereof.

article-60-para-9.title: Article 60(9)
article-60-para-9.excerpt: Where the lead supervisory authority and the supervisory authorities concerned agree to dismiss or reject parts of a complaint and to act on other parts of that complaint, a separate decision shall be adopted for each of those parts of the matter. The lead supervisory authority shall adopt the...

article-60-para-10.title: Article 60(10)
article-60-para-10.excerpt: After being notified of the decision of the lead supervisory authority pursuant to paragraphs 7 and 9, the controller or processor shall take the necessary measures to ensure compliance with the decision as regards processing activities in the context of all its establishments in the Union. The...

article-60-para-11.title: Article 60(11)
article-60-para-11.excerpt: Where, in exceptional circumstances, a supervisory authority concerned has reasons to consider that there is an urgent need to act in order to protect the interests of data subjects, the urgency procedure referred to in Article 66 shall apply.

article-60-para-12.title: Article 60(12)
article-60-para-12.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority and the other supervisory authorities concerned shall supply the information required under this Article to each other by electronic means, using a standardised format.

article-61-para-1.title: Article 61(1)
article-61-para-1.excerpt: (a) it is not competent for the subject-matter of the request or for the measures it is requested to execute; or

article-61-para-2.title: Article 61(2)
article-61-para-2.excerpt: (b) compliance with the request would infringe this Regulation or Union or Member State law to which the supervisory authority receiving the request is subject.

article-61-para-3.title: Article 61(3)
article-61-para-3.excerpt: Requests for assistance shall contain all the necessary information, including the purpose of and reasons for the request. Information exchanged shall be used only for the purpose for which it was requested.

article-61-para-4.title: Article 61(4)
article-61-para-4.excerpt: The requested supervisory authority shall not refuse to comply with the request unless:

article-61-para-5.title: Article 61(5)
article-61-para-5.excerpt: The requested supervisory authority shall inform the requesting supervisory authority of the results or, as the case may be, of the progress of the measures taken in order to respond to the request. The requested supervisory authority shall provide reasons for any refusal to comply with a request...

article-61-para-6.title: Article 61(6)
article-61-para-6.excerpt: Requested supervisory authorities shall, as a rule, supply the information requested by other supervisory authorities by electronic means, using a standardised format.

article-61-para-7.title: Article 61(7)
article-61-para-7.excerpt: Requested supervisory authorities shall not charge a fee for any action taken by them pursuant to a request for mutual assistance. Supervisory authorities may agree on rules to indemnify each other for specific expenditure arising from the provision of mutual assistance in exceptional circumstances.

article-61-para-8.title: Article 61(8)
article-61-para-8.excerpt: Where a supervisory authority does not provide the information referred to in paragraph 5 of this Article within one month of receiving the request of another supervisory authority, the requesting supervisory authority may adopt a provisional measure on the territory of its Member State in...

article-61-para-9.title: Article 61(9)
article-61-para-9.excerpt: The Commission may, by means of implementing acts, specify the format and procedures for mutual assistance referred to in this Article and the arrangements for the exchange of information by electronic means between supervisory authorities, and between supervisory authorities and the Board, in...

article-62-para-1.title: Article 62(1)
article-62-para-1.excerpt: The supervisory authorities shall, where appropriate, conduct joint operations including joint investigations and joint enforcement measures in which members or staff of the supervisory authorities of other Member States are involved.

article-62-para-2.title: Article 62(2)
article-62-para-2.excerpt: Where the controller or processor has establishments in several Member States or where a significant number of data subjects in more than one Member State are likely to be substantially affected by processing operations, a supervisory authority of each of those Member States shall have the right to...

article-62-para-3.title: Article 62(3)
article-62-para-3.excerpt: A supervisory authority may, in accordance with Member State law, and with the seconding supervisory authority 's authorisation, confer powers, including investigative powers on the seconding supervisory authority 's members or staff involved in joint operations or, in so far as the law of the...

article-62-para-4.title: Article 62(4)
article-62-para-4.excerpt: Where, in accordance with paragraph 1, staff of a seconding supervisory authority operate in another Member State, the Member State of the host supervisory authority shall assume responsibility for their actions, including liability, for any damage caused by them during their operations, in...

article-62-para-5.title: Article 62(5)
article-62-para-5.excerpt: The Member State in whose territory the damage was caused shall make good such damage under the conditions applicable to damage caused by its own staff. The Member State of the seconding supervisory authority whose staff has caused damage to any person in the territory of another Member State shall...

article-62-para-6.title: Article 62(6)
article-62-para-6.excerpt: Without prejudice to the exercise of its rights vis-à-vis third parties and with the exception of paragraph 5, each Member State shall refrain, in the case provided for in paragraph 1, from requesting reimbursement from another Member State in relation to damage referred to in paragraph 4.

article-62-para-7.title: Article 62(7)
article-62-para-7.excerpt: Where a joint operation is intended and a supervisory authority does not, within one month, comply with the obligation laid down in the second sentence of paragraph 2 of this Article, the other supervisory authorities may adopt a provisional measure on the territory of its Member State in...

article-64-para-1.title: Article 64(1)
article-64-para-1.excerpt: (a) the members of the Board and the Commission of any relevant information which has been communicated to it using a standardised format. The secretariat of the Board shall, where necessary, provide translations of relevant information; and

article-64-para-2.title: Article 64(2)
article-64-para-2.excerpt: (b) the supervisory authority referred to, as the case may be, in paragraphs 1 and 2, and the Commission of the opinion and make it public.

article-64-para-3.title: Article 64(3)
article-64-para-3.excerpt: In the cases referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2, the Board shall issue an opinion on the matter submitted to it provided that it has not already issued an opinion on the same matter. That opinion shall be adopted within eight weeks by simple majority of the members of the Board. That period may be...

article-64-para-4.title: Article 64(4)
article-64-para-4.excerpt: Supervisory authorities and the Commission shall, without undue delay, communicate by electronic means to the Board, using a standardised format any relevant information, including as the case may be a summary of the facts, the draft decision, the grounds which make the enactment of such measure...

article-64-para-5.title: Article 64(5)
article-64-para-5.excerpt: The Chair of the Board shall, without undue, delay inform by electronic means:

article-64-para-6.title: Article 64(6)
article-64-para-6.excerpt: The competent supervisory authority shall not adopt its draft decision referred to in paragraph 1 within the period referred to in paragraph 3.

article-64-para-7.title: Article 64(7)
article-64-para-7.excerpt: The supervisory authority referred to in paragraph 1 shall take utmost account of the opinion of the Board and shall, within two weeks after receiving the opinion, communicate to the Chair of the Board by electronic means whether it will maintain or amend its draft decision and, if any, the amended...

article-64-para-8.title: Article 64(8)
article-64-para-8.excerpt: Where the supervisory authority concerned informs the Chair of the Board within the period referred to in paragraph 7 of this Article that it does not intend to follow the opinion of the Board, in whole or in part, providing the relevant grounds, Article 65(1) shall apply.

article-65-para-1.title: Article 65(1)
article-65-para-1.excerpt: (a) where, in a case referred to in Article 60(4), a supervisory authority concerned has raised a relevant and reasoned objection to a draft decision of the lead authority or the lead authority has rejected such an objection as being not relevant or reasoned. The binding decision shall concern all...

article-65-para-2.title: Article 65(2)
article-65-para-2.excerpt: The decision referred to in paragraph 1 shall be adopted within one month from the referral of the subject-matter by a two-thirds majority of the members of the Board. That period may be extended by a further month on account of the complexity of the subject-matter. The decision referred to in...

article-65-para-3.title: Article 65(3)
article-65-para-3.excerpt: Where the Board has been unable to adopt a decision within the periods referred to in paragraph 2, it shall adopt its decision within two weeks following the expiration of the second month referred to in paragraph 2 by a simple majority of the members of the Board. Where the members of the Board...

article-65-para-4.title: Article 65(4)
article-65-para-4.excerpt: The supervisory authorities concerned shall not adopt a decision on the subject matter submitted to the Board under paragraph 1 during the periods referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3.

article-65-para-5.title: Article 65(5)
article-65-para-5.excerpt: The Chair of the Board shall notify, without undue delay, the decision referred to in paragraph 1 to the supervisory authorities concerned. It shall inform the Commission thereof. The decision shall be published on the website of the Board without delay after the supervisory authority has notified...

article-65-para-6.title: Article 65(6)
article-65-para-6.excerpt: The lead supervisory authority or, as the case may be, the supervisory authority with which the complaint has been lodged shall adopt its final decision on the basis of the decision referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, without undue delay and at the latest by one month after the Board has...

article-66-para-1.title: Article 66(1)
article-66-para-1.excerpt: In exceptional circumstances, where a supervisory authority concerned considers that there is an urgent need to act in order to protect the rights and freedoms of data subjects, it may, by way of derogation from the consistency mechanism referred to in Articles 63, 64 and 65 or the procedure...

article-66-para-2.title: Article 66(2)
article-66-para-2.excerpt: Where a supervisory authority has taken a measure pursuant to paragraph 1 and considers that final measures need urgently be adopted, it may request an urgent opinion or an urgent binding decision from the Board, giving reasons for requesting such opinion or decision.

article-66-para-3.title: Article 66(3)
article-66-para-3.excerpt: Any supervisory authority may request an urgent opinion or an urgent binding decision, as the case may be, from the Board where a competent supervisory authority has not taken an appropriate measure in a situation where there is an urgent need to act, in order to protect the rights and freedoms of...

article-66-para-4.title: Article 66(4)
article-66-para-4.excerpt: By derogation from Article 64(3) and Article 65(2), an urgent opinion or an urgent binding decision referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Article shall be adopted within two weeks by simple majority of the members of the Board.

article-68-para-1.title: Article 68(1)
article-68-para-1.excerpt: The European Data Protection Board (the ‘Board’) is hereby established as a body of the Union and shall have legal personality.

article-68-para-3.title: Article 68(3)
article-68-para-3.excerpt: The Board shall be composed of the head of one supervisory authority of each Member State and of the European Data Protection Supervisor, or their respective representatives.

article-68-para-4.title: Article 68(4)
article-68-para-4.excerpt: Where in a Member State more than one supervisory authority is responsible for monitoring the application of the provisions pursuant to this Regulation, a joint representative shall be appointed in accordance with that Member State 's law.

article-68-para-5.title: Article 68(5)
article-68-para-5.excerpt: The Commission shall have the right to participate in the activities and meetings of the Board without voting right. The Commission shall designate a representative. The Chair of the Board shall communicate to the Commission the activities of the Board.

article-68-para-6.title: Article 68(6)
article-68-para-6.excerpt: In the cases referred to in Article 65, the European Data Protection Supervisor shall have voting rights only on decisions which concern principles and rules applicable to the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies which correspond in substance to those of this Regulation.

article-69-para-1.title: Article 69(1)
article-69-para-1.excerpt: The Board shall act independently when performing its tasks or exercising its powers pursuant to Articles 70 and 71.

article-69-para-2.title: Article 69(2)
article-69-para-2.excerpt: Without prejudice to requests by the Commission referred to in point (b) of Article 70(1) and in Article 70(2), the Board shall, in the performance of its tasks or the exercise of its powers, neither seek nor take instructions from anybody.

article-70-para-1.title: Article 70(1)
article-70-para-1.excerpt: (a) monitor and ensure the correct application of this Regulation in the cases provided for in Articles 64 and 65 without prejudice to the tasks of national supervisory authorities;

article-70-para-2.title: Article 70(2)
article-70-para-2.excerpt: Where the Commission requests advice from the Board, it may indicate a time limit, taking into account the urgency of the matter.

article-70-para-3.title: Article 70(3)
article-70-para-3.excerpt: The Board shall forward its opinions, guidelines, recommendations, and best practices to the Commission and to the committee referred to in Article 93 and make them public.

article-70-para-4.title: Article 70(4)
article-70-para-4.excerpt: The Board shall, where appropriate, consult interested parties and give them the opportunity to comment within a reasonable period. The Board shall, without prejudice to Article 76, make the results of the consultation procedure publicly available.

article-70-para-5.title: Article 70(5)
article-70-para-5.excerpt: (e) examine, on its own initiative, on request of one of its members or on request of the Commission, any question covering the application of this Regulation and issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in order to encourage consistent application of this Regulation;

article-70-para-6.title: Article 70(6)
article-70-para-6.excerpt: (f) issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in accordance with point (e) of this paragraph for further specifying the criteria and conditions for decisions based on profiling pursuant to Article 22(2);

article-70-para-7.title: Article 70(7)
article-70-para-7.excerpt: (g) issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in accordance with point (e) of this paragraph for establishing the personal data breaches and determining the undue delay referred to in Article 33(1) and (2) and for the particular circumstances in which a controller or a processor is...

article-70-para-8.title: Article 70(8)
article-70-para-8.excerpt: (h) issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in accordance with point (e) of this paragraph as to the circumstances in which a personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of the natural persons referred to in Article 34(1).

article-70-para-9.title: Article 70(9)
article-70-para-9.excerpt: (i) issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in accordance with point (e) of this paragraph for the purpose of further specifying the criteria and requirements for personal data transfers based on binding corporate rules adhered to by controllers and binding corporate rules adhered to...

article-70-para-10.title: Article 70(10)
article-70-para-10.excerpt: (j) issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in accordance with point (e) of this paragraph for the purpose of further specifying the criteria and requirements for the personal data transfers on the basis of Article 49(1);

article-70-para-11.title: Article 70(11)
article-70-para-11.excerpt: (k) draw up guidelines for supervisory authorities concerning the application of measures referred to in Article 58(1), (2) and (3) and the setting of administrative fines pursuant to Article 83;

article-70-para-12.title: Article 70(12)
article-70-para-12.excerpt: (l) review the practical application of the guidelines, recommendations and best practices referred to in points (e) and (f);

article-70-para-13.title: Article 70(13)
article-70-para-13.excerpt: (m) issue guidelines, recommendations and best practices in accordance with point (e) of this paragraph for establishing common procedures for reporting by natural persons of infringements of this Regulation pursuant to Article 54(2);

article-70-para-14.title: Article 70(14)
article-70-para-14.excerpt: (n) encourage the drawing-up of codes of conduct and the establishment of data protection certification mechanisms and data protection seals and marks pursuant to Articles 40 and 42;

article-70-para-15.title: Article 70(15)
article-70-para-15.excerpt: (o) carry out the accreditation of certification bodies and its periodic review pursuant to Article 43 and maintain a public register of accredited bodies pursuant to Article 43(6) and of the accredited controllers or processors established in third countries pursuant to Article 42(7);

article-70-para-16.title: Article 70(16)
article-70-para-16.excerpt: (p) specify the requirements referred to in Article 43(3) with a view to the accreditation of certification bodies under Article 42;

article-70-para-17.title: Article 70(17)
article-70-para-17.excerpt: (q) provide the Commission with an opinion on the certification requirements referred to in Article 43(8);

article-70-para-18.title: Article 70(18)
article-70-para-18.excerpt: (r) provide the Commission with an opinion on the icons referred to in Article 12(7);

article-70-para-19.title: Article 70(19)
article-70-para-19.excerpt: (s) provide the Commission with an opinion for the assessment of the adequacy of the level of protection in a third country or international organisation, including for the assessment whether a third country, a territory or one or more specified sectors within that third country, or an...

article-70-para-20.title: Article 70(20)
article-70-para-20.excerpt: (t) issue opinions on draft decisions of supervisory authorities pursuant to the consistency mechanism referred to in Article 64(1), on matters submitted pursuant to Article 64(2) and to issue binding decisions pursuant to Article 65, including in cases referred to in Article 66;

article-70-para-21.title: Article 70(21)
article-70-para-21.excerpt: (u) promote the cooperation and the effective bilateral and multilateral exchange of information and best practices between the supervisory authorities;

article-70-para-22.title: Article 70(22)
article-70-para-22.excerpt: (v) promote common training programmes and facilitate personnel exchanges between the supervisory authorities and, where appropriate, with the supervisory authorities of third countries or with international organisations;

article-70-para-23.title: Article 70(23)
article-70-para-23.excerpt: (w) promote the exchange of knowledge and documentation on data protection legislation and practice with data protection supervisory authorities worldwide.

article-70-para-24.title: Article 70(24)
article-70-para-24.excerpt: (x) issue opinions on codes of conduct drawn up at Union level pursuant to Article 40(9); and

article-70-para-25.title: Article 70(25)
article-70-para-25.excerpt: (y) maintain a publicly accessible electronic register of decisions taken by supervisory authorities and courts on issues handled in the consistency mechanism.

article-71-para-1.title: Article 71(1)
article-71-para-1.excerpt: The Board shall draw up an annual report regarding the protection of natural persons with regard to processing in the Union and, where relevant, in third countries and international organisations. The report shall be made public and be transmitted to the European Parliament, to the Council and to...

article-71-para-2.title: Article 71(2)
article-71-para-2.excerpt: The annual report shall include a review of the practical application of the guidelines, recommendations and best practices referred to in point (l) of Article 70(1) as well as of the binding decisions referred to in Article 65.

article-72-para-1.title: Article 72(1)
article-72-para-1.excerpt: The Board shall take decisions by a simple majority of its members, unless otherwise provided for in this Regulation.

article-72-para-2.title: Article 72(2)
article-72-para-2.excerpt: The Board shall adopt its own rules of procedure by a two-thirds majority of its members and organise its own operational arrangements.

article-73-para-1.title: Article 73(1)
article-73-para-1.excerpt: The Board shall elect a chair and two deputy chairs from amongst its members by simple majority.

article-73-para-2.title: Article 73(2)
article-73-para-2.excerpt: The term of office of the Chair and of the deputy chairs shall be five years and be renewable once.

article-74-para-1.title: Article 74(1)
article-74-para-1.excerpt: (a) to convene the meetings of the Board and prepare its agenda;

article-74-para-2.title: Article 74(2)
article-74-para-2.excerpt: The Board shall lay down the allocation of tasks between the Chair and the deputy chairs in its rules of procedure.

article-74-para-3.title: Article 74(3)
article-74-para-3.excerpt: (c) to ensure the timely performance of the tasks of the Board, in particular in relation to the consistency mechanism referred to in Article 63.

article-75-para-1.title: Article 75(1)
article-75-para-1.excerpt: The Board shall have a secretariat, which shall be provided by the European Data Protection Supervisor.

article-75-para-2.title: Article 75(2)
article-75-para-2.excerpt: (b) communication between the members of the Board, its Chair and the Commission;

article-75-para-3.title: Article 75(3)
article-75-para-3.excerpt: (c) communication with other institutions and the public;

article-75-para-4.title: Article 75(4)
article-75-para-4.excerpt: (d) the use of electronic means for the internal and external communication;

article-75-para-5.title: Article 75(5)
article-75-para-5.excerpt: The secretariat shall provide analytical, administrative and logistical support to the Board.

article-75-para-6.title: Article 75(6)
article-75-para-6.excerpt: (f) the preparation and follow-up of the meetings of the Board;

article-75-para-7.title: Article 75(7)
article-75-para-7.excerpt: (g) the preparation, drafting and publication of opinions, decisions on the settlement of disputes between supervisory authorities and other texts adopted by the Board.

article-76-para-1.title: Article 76(1)
article-76-para-1.excerpt: The discussions of the Board shall be confidential where the Board deems it necessary, as provided for in its rules of procedure.

article-76-para-2.title: Article 76(2)
article-76-para-2.excerpt: Access to documents submitted to members of the Board, experts and representatives of third parties shall be governed by Regulation (EC) No 1049/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council (21).

article-77-para-1.title: Article 77(1)
article-77-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to any other administrative or judicial remedy, every data subject shall have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, in particular in the Member State of his or her habitual residence, place of work or place of the alleged infringement if the data subject...

article-77-para-2.title: Article 77(2)
article-77-para-2.excerpt: The supervisory authority with which the complaint has been lodged shall inform the complainant on the progress and the outcome of the complaint including the possibility of a judicial remedy pursuant to Article 78.

article-78-para-1.title: Article 78(1)
article-78-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to any other administrative or non-judicial remedy, each natural or legal person shall have the right to an effective judicial remedy against a legally binding decision of a supervisory authority concerning them.

article-78-para-2.title: Article 78(2)
article-78-para-2.excerpt: Without prejudice to any other administrative or non-judicial remedy, each data subject shall have the right to a an effective judicial remedy where the supervisory authority which is competent pursuant to Articles 55 and 56 does not handle a complaint or does not inform the data subject within...

article-78-para-3.title: Article 78(3)
article-78-para-3.excerpt: Proceedings against a supervisory authority shall be brought before the courts of the Member State where the supervisory authority is established.

article-78-para-4.title: Article 78(4)
article-78-para-4.excerpt: Where proceedings are brought against a decision of a supervisory authority which was preceded by an opinion or a decision of the Board in the consistency mechanism, the supervisory authority shall forward that opinion or decision to the court.

article-79-para-1.title: Article 79(1)
article-79-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to any available administrative or non-judicial remedy, including the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority pursuant to Article 77, each data subject shall have the right to an effective judicial remedy where he or she considers that his or her rights under this...

article-79-para-2.title: Article 79(2)
article-79-para-2.excerpt: Proceedings against a controller or a processor shall be brought before the courts of the Member State where the controller or processor has an establishment. Alternatively, such proceedings may be brought before the courts of the Member State where the data subject has his or her habitual...

article-80-para-1.title: Article 80(1)
article-80-para-1.excerpt: The data subject shall have the right to mandate a not-for-profit body, organisation or association which has been properly constituted in accordance with the law of a Member State, has statutory objectives which are in the public interest, and is active in the field of the protection of data...

article-80-para-2.title: Article 80(2)
article-80-para-2.excerpt: Member States may provide that any body, organisation or association referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, independently of a data subject's mandate, has the right to lodge, in that Member State, a complaint with the supervisory authority which is competent pursuant to Article 77 and to...

article-81-para-1.title: Article 81(1)
article-81-para-1.excerpt: Where a competent court of a Member State has information on proceedings, concerning the same subject matter as regards processing by the same controller or processor, that are pending in a court in another Member State, it shall contact that court in the other Member State to confirm the existence...

article-81-para-2.title: Article 81(2)
article-81-para-2.excerpt: Where proceedings concerning the same subject matter as regards processing of the same controller or processor are pending in a court in another Member State, any competent court other than the court first seized may suspend its proceedings.

article-81-para-3.title: Article 81(3)
article-81-para-3.excerpt: Where those proceedings are pending at first instance, any court other than the court first seized may also, on the application of one of the parties, decline jurisdiction if the court first seized has jurisdiction over the actions in question and its law permits the consolidation thereof.

article-82-para-1.title: Article 82(1)
article-82-para-1.excerpt: Any person who has suffered material or non-material damage as a result of an infringement of this Regulation shall have the right to receive compensation from the controller or processor for the damage suffered.

article-82-para-2.title: Article 82(2)
article-82-para-2.excerpt: Any controller involved in processing shall be liable for the damage caused by processing which infringes this Regulation. A processor shall be liable for the damage caused by processing only where it has not complied with obligations of this Regulation specifically directed to processors or where...

article-82-para-3.title: Article 82(3)
article-82-para-3.excerpt: A controller or processor shall be exempt from liability under paragraph 2 if it proves that it is not in any way responsible for the event giving rise to the damage.

article-82-para-4.title: Article 82(4)
article-82-para-4.excerpt: Where more than one controller or processor, or both a controller and a processor, are involved in the same processing and where they are, under paragraphs 2 and 3, responsible for any damage caused by processing, each controller or processor shall be held liable for the entire damage in order to...

article-82-para-5.title: Article 82(5)
article-82-para-5.excerpt: Where a controller or processor has, in accordance with paragraph 4, paid full compensation for the damage suffered, that controller or processor shall be entitled to claim back from the other controllers or processors involved in the same processing that part of the compensation corresponding to...

article-82-para-6.title: Article 82(6)
article-82-para-6.excerpt: Court proceedings for exercising the right to receive compensation shall be brought before the courts competent under the law of the Member State referred to in Article 79(2).

article-83-para-1.title: Article 83(1)
article-83-para-1.excerpt: (a) the basic principles for processing, including conditions for consent, pursuant to Articles 5, 6, 7 and 9;

article-83-para-2.title: Article 83(2)
article-83-para-2.excerpt: (b) the data subjects' rights pursuant to Articles 12 to 22;

article-83-para-3.title: Article 83(3)
article-83-para-3.excerpt: (c) the transfers of personal data to a recipient in a third country or an international organisation pursuant to Articles 44 to 49;

article-83-para-4.title: Article 83(4)
article-83-para-4.excerpt: (d) any obligations pursuant to Member State law adopted under Chapter IX;

article-83-para-5.title: Article 83(5)
article-83-para-5.excerpt: (e) non-compliance with an order or a temporary or definitive limitation on processing or the suspension of data flows by the supervisory authority pursuant to Article 58(2) or failure to provide access in violation of Article 58(1).

article-83-para-6.title: Article 83(6)
article-83-para-6.excerpt: Non-compliance with an order by the supervisory authority as referred to in Article 58(2) shall, in accordance with paragraph 2 of this Article, be subject to administrative fines up to 20 000 000 EUR, or in the case of an undertaking, up to 4 % of the total worldwide annual turnover of the...

recital-108.title: Recital 108
recital-108.excerpt: (108) ENISA’s operations should be subject to regular and independent evaluation. That evaluation should have regard to ENISA’s objectives, its working practices and the relevance of its tasks, in particular its tasks relating to the operational cooperation at Union level. That evaluation should...

recital-109.title: Recital 109
recital-109.excerpt: (109) Since the objectives of this Regulation cannot be sufficiently achieved by the Member States but can rather, by reason of its scale and effects, be better achieved at Union level, the Union may adopt measures, in accordance with the principle of subsidiarity as set out in Article 5 of the...

article-1-para-1.title: Article 1(1)
article-1-para-1.excerpt: With a view to ensuring the proper functioning of the internal market while aiming to achieve a high level of cybersecurity, cyber resilience and trust within the Union, this Regulation lays down: (a) objectives, tasks and organisational matters relating to ENISA (the European Union Agency for...

article-1-para-1-point-b.title: Article 1(1)(b)
article-1-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) a framework for the establishment of European cybersecurity certification schemes for the purpose of ensuring an adequate level of cybersecurity for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes in the Union, as well as for the purpose of avoiding the fragmentation of the internal market with...

article-1-para-2.title: Article 1(2)
article-1-para-2.excerpt: This Regulation is without prejudice to the competences of the Member States regarding activities concerning public security, defence, national security and the activities of the State in areas of criminal law.

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' cybersecurity ' means the activities necessary to protect network and information systems, the users of such systems, and other persons affected by cyber threats;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' network and information system ' means a network and information system as defined in point (1) of Article 4 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' national strategy on the security of network and information systems ' means a national strategy on the security of network and information systems as defined in point (3) of Article 4 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' operator of essential services ' means an operator of essential services as defined in point (4) of Article 4 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' digital service provider ' means a digital service provider as defined in point (6) of Article 4 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' incident ' means an incident as defined in point (7) of Article 4 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' incident handling ' means incident handling as defined in point (8) of Article 4 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' cyber threat ' means any potential circumstance, event or action that could damage, disrupt or otherwise adversely impact network and information systems, the users of such systems and other persons;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' European cybersecurity certification scheme ' means a comprehensive set of rules, technical requirements, standards and procedures that are established at Union level and that apply to the certification or conformity assessment of specific ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' national cybersecurity certification scheme ' means a comprehensive set of rules, technical requirements, standards and procedures developed and adopted by a national public authority and that apply to the certification or conformity assessment of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes...

article-2-para-11.title: Article 2(11)
article-2-para-11.excerpt: (11) ' European cybersecurity certificate ' means a document issued by a relevant body, attesting that a given ICT product, ICT service or ICT process has been evaluated for compliance with specific security requirements laid down in a European cybersecurity certification scheme;

article-2-para-12.title: Article 2(12)
article-2-para-12.excerpt: (12) ' ICT product ' means an element or a group of elements of a network or information system;

article-2-para-13.title: Article 2(13)
article-2-para-13.excerpt: (13) ' ICT service ' means a service consisting fully or mainly in the transmission, storing, retrieving or processing of information by means of network and information systems;

article-2-para-14.title: Article 2(14)
article-2-para-14.excerpt: (14) ' ICT process ' means a set of activities performed to design, develop, deliver or maintain an ICT product or ICT service;

article-2-para-15.title: Article 2(15)
article-2-para-15.excerpt: (15) ' accreditation ' means accreditation as defined in point (10) of Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 765/2008;

article-2-para-16.title: Article 2(16)
article-2-para-16.excerpt: (16) ' national accreditation body ' means a national accreditation body as defined in point (11) of Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 765/2008;

article-2-para-17.title: Article 2(17)
article-2-para-17.excerpt: (17) ' conformity assessment ' means a conformity assessment as defined in point (12) of Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 765/2008;

article-2-para-18.title: Article 2(18)
article-2-para-18.excerpt: (18) ' conformity assessment body ' means a conformity assessment body as defined in point (13) of Article 2 of Regulation (EC) No 765/2008;

article-2-para-19.title: Article 2(19)
article-2-para-19.excerpt: (19) ' standard ' means a standard as defined in point (1) of Article 2 of Regulation (EU) No 1025/2012;

article-2-para-20.title: Article 2(20)
article-2-para-20.excerpt: (20) ' technical specification ' means a document that prescribes the technical requirements to be met by, or conformity assessment procedures relating to, an ICT product, ICT service or ICT process;

article-2-para-21.title: Article 2(21)
article-2-para-21.excerpt: (21) ' assurance level ' means a basis for confidence that an ICT product, ICT service or ICT process meets the security requirements of a specific European cybersecurity certification scheme, indicates the level at which an ICT product, ICT service or ICT process has been evaluated but as such...

article-2-para-22.title: Article 2(22)
article-2-para-22.excerpt: (22) ' conformity self-assessment ' means an action carried out by a manufacturer or provider of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes, which evaluates whether those ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes meet the requirements of a specific European cybersecurity certification scheme.

article-46-para-1.title: Article 46(1)
article-46-para-1.excerpt: The European cybersecurity certification framework shall be established in order to improve the conditions for the functioning of the internal market by increasing the level of cybersecurity within the Union and enabling a harmonised approach at Union level to European cybersecurity certification...

article-46-para-2.title: Article 46(2)
article-46-para-2.excerpt: The European cybersecurity certification framework shall provide for a mechanism to establish European cybersecurity certification schemes and to attest that the ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes that have been evaluated in accordance with such schemes comply with specified security...

article-47-para-1.title: Article 47(1)
article-47-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall publish a Union rolling work programme for European cybersecurity certification (the 'Union rolling work programme') that shall identify strategic priorities for future European cybersecurity certification schemes.

article-47-para-2.title: Article 47(2)
article-47-para-2.excerpt: The Union rolling work programme shall in particular include a list of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes or categories thereof that are capable of benefiting from being included in the scope of a European cybersecurity certification scheme.

article-47-para-3.title: Article 47(3)
article-47-para-3.excerpt: Inclusion of specific ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes or categories thereof in the Union rolling work programme shall be justified on the basis of one or more of the following grounds: (a) the availability and the development of national cybersecurity certification schemes covering a...

article-47-para-3-point-e.title: Article 47(3)(e)
article-47-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) request for the preparation of a specific candidate scheme by the ECCG.

article-47-para-4.title: Article 47(4)
article-47-para-4.excerpt: The Commission shall take due account of the opinions issued by the ECCG and the Stakeholder Certification Group on the draft Union rolling work programme.

article-47-para-5.title: Article 47(5)
article-47-para-5.excerpt: The first Union rolling work programme shall be published by 28 June 2020. The Union rolling work programme shall be updated at least once every three years and more often if necessary.

article-48-para-1.title: Article 48(1)
article-48-para-1.excerpt: The Commission may request ENISA to prepare a candidate scheme or to review an existing European cybersecurity certification scheme on the basis of the Union rolling work programme.

article-48-para-2.title: Article 48(2)
article-48-para-2.excerpt: In duly justified cases, the Commission or the ECCG may request ENISA to prepare a candidate scheme or to review an existing European cybersecurity certification scheme which is not included in the Union rolling work programme. The Union rolling work programme shall be updated accordingly.

article-49-para-1.title: Article 49(1)
article-49-para-1.excerpt: Following a request from the Commission pursuant to Article 48, ENISA shall prepare a candidate scheme which meets the requirements set out in Articles 51, 52 and 54.

article-49-para-2.title: Article 49(2)
article-49-para-2.excerpt: Following a request from the ECCG pursuant to Article 48(2), ENISA may prepare a candidate scheme which meets the requirements set out in Articles 51, 52 and 54. If ENISA refuses such a request, it shall give reasons for its refusal. Any decision to refuse such a request shall be taken by the...

article-49-para-3.title: Article 49(3)
article-49-para-3.excerpt: When preparing a candidate scheme, ENISA shall consult all relevant stakeholders by means of a formal, open, transparent and inclusive consultation process.

article-49-para-4.title: Article 49(4)
article-49-para-4.excerpt: For each candidate scheme, ENISA shall establish an ad hoc working group in accordance with Article 20(4) for the purpose of providing ENISA with specific advice and expertise.

article-49-para-5.title: Article 49(5)
article-49-para-5.excerpt: ENISA shall closely cooperate with the ECCG. The ECCG shall provide ENISA with assistance and expert advice in relation to the preparation of the candidate scheme and shall adopt an opinion on the candidate scheme.

article-49-para-6.title: Article 49(6)
article-49-para-6.excerpt: ENISA shall take utmost account of the opinion of the ECCG before transmitting the candidate scheme prepared in accordance with paragraphs 3, 4 and 5 to the Commission. The opinion of the ECCG shall not bind ENISA, nor shall the absence of such an opinion prevent ENISA from transmitting the...

article-49-para-7.title: Article 49(7)
article-49-para-7.excerpt: The Commission, based on the candidate scheme prepared by ENISA, may adopt implementing acts providing for a European cybersecurity certification scheme for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes which meets the requirements set out in Articles 51, 52 and 54. Those implementing acts shall be...

article-49-para-8.title: Article 49(8)
article-49-para-8.excerpt: At least every five years, ENISA shall evaluate each adopted European cybersecurity certification scheme, taking into account the feedback received from interested parties. If necessary, the Commission or the ECCG may request ENISA to start the process of developing a revised candidate scheme in...

article-50-para-1.title: Article 50(1)
article-50-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall maintain a dedicated website providing information on, and publicising, European cybersecurity certification schemes, European cybersecurity certificates and EU statements of conformity, including information with regard to European cybersecurity certification schemes which are no...

article-50-para-2.title: Article 50(2)
article-50-para-2.excerpt: Where applicable, the website referred to in paragraph 1 shall also indicate the national cybersecurity certification schemes that have been replaced by a European cybersecurity certification scheme.

article-51-para-1.title: Article 51(1)
article-51-para-1.excerpt: (a) to protect stored, transmitted or otherwise processed data against accidental or unauthorised storage, processing, access or disclosure during the entire life cycle of the ICT product, ICT service or ICT process;

article-51-para-2.title: Article 51(2)
article-51-para-2.excerpt: (b) to protect stored, transmitted or otherwise processed data against accidental or unauthorised destruction, loss or alteration or lack of availability during the entire life cycle of the ICT product, ICT service or ICT process;

article-51-para-3.title: Article 51(3)
article-51-para-3.excerpt: (c) that authorised persons, programs or machines are able only to access the data, services or functions to which their access rights refer;

article-51-para-4.title: Article 51(4)
article-51-para-4.excerpt: (d) to identify and document known dependencies and vulnerabilities;

article-51-para-5.title: Article 51(5)
article-51-para-5.excerpt: (e) to record which data, services or functions have been accessed, used or otherwise processed, at what times and by whom;

article-51-para-6.title: Article 51(6)
article-51-para-6.excerpt: (f) to make it possible to check which data, services or functions have been accessed, used or otherwise processed, at what times and by whom;

article-51-para-7.title: Article 51(7)
article-51-para-7.excerpt: (g) to verify that ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes do not contain known vulnerabilities;

article-51-para-8.title: Article 51(8)
article-51-para-8.excerpt: (h) to restore the availability and access to data, services and functions in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident;

article-51-para-9.title: Article 51(9)
article-51-para-9.excerpt: (i) that ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes are secure by default and by design;

article-51-para-10.title: Article 51(10)
article-51-para-10.excerpt: (j) that ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes are provided with up-to-date software and hardware that do not contain publicly known vulnerabilities, and are provided with mechanisms for secure updates.

article-52-para-1.title: Article 52(1)
article-52-para-1.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certification scheme may specify one or more of the following assurance levels for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes: 'basic', 'substantial' or 'high'. The assurance level shall be commensurate with the level of the risk associated with the intended use of the...

article-52-para-2.title: Article 52(2)
article-52-para-2.excerpt: European cybersecurity certificates and EU statements of conformity shall refer to any assurance level specified in the European cybersecurity certification scheme under which the European cybersecurity certificate or EU statement of conformity is issued.

article-52-para-3.title: Article 52(3)
article-52-para-3.excerpt: The security requirements corresponding to each assurance level shall be provided in the relevant European cybersecurity certification scheme, including the corresponding security functionalities and the corresponding rigour and depth of the evaluation that the ICT product, ICT service or ICT...

article-52-para-4.title: Article 52(4)
article-52-para-4.excerpt: The certificate or the EU statement of conformity shall refer to technical specifications, standards and procedures related thereto, including technical controls, the purpose of which is to decrease the risk of, or to prevent cybersecurity incidents.

article-52-para-5.title: Article 52(5)
article-52-para-5.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certificate or EU statement of conformity that refers to assurance level 'basic' shall provide assurance that the ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes for which that certificate or that EU statement of conformity is issued meet the corresponding security...

article-52-para-6.title: Article 52(6)
article-52-para-6.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certificate that refers to assurance level 'substantial' shall provide assurance that the ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes for which that certificate is issued meet the corresponding security requirements, including security functionalities, and that they have...

article-52-para-7.title: Article 52(7)
article-52-para-7.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certificate that refers to assurance level 'high' shall provide assurance that the ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes for which that certificate is issued meet the corresponding security requirements, including security functionalities, and that they have been...

article-52-para-8.title: Article 52(8)
article-52-para-8.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certification scheme may specify several evaluation levels depending on the rigour and depth of the evaluation methodology used. Each of the evaluation levels shall correspond to one of the assurance levels and shall be defined by an appropriate combination of assurance...

article-53-para-1.title: Article 53(1)
article-53-para-1.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certification scheme may allow for the conformity self-assessment under the sole responsibility of the manufacturer or provider of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes. Conformity self-assessment shall be permitted only in relation to ICT products, ICT services and...

article-53-para-2.title: Article 53(2)
article-53-para-2.excerpt: The manufacturer or provider of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes may issue an EU statement of conformity stating that the fulfilment of the requirements set out in the scheme has been demonstrated. By issuing such a statement, the manufacturer or provider of ICT products, ICT services or...

article-53-para-3.title: Article 53(3)
article-53-para-3.excerpt: The manufacturer or provider of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes shall make the EU statement of conformity, technical documentation, and all other relevant information relating to the conformity of the ICT products or ICT services with the scheme available to the national cybersecurity...

article-53-para-4.title: Article 53(4)
article-53-para-4.excerpt: The issuing of an EU statement of conformity is voluntary, unless otherwise specified in Union law or Member State law.

article-53-para-5.title: Article 53(5)
article-53-para-5.excerpt: EU statements of conformity shall be recognised in all Member States.

article-54-para-1.title: Article 54(1)
article-54-para-1.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certification scheme shall include at least the following elements: (a) the subject matter and scope of the certification scheme, including the type or categories of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes covered;

article-54-para-1-point-b.title: Article 54(1)(b)
article-54-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) a clear description of the purpose of the scheme and of how the selected standards, evaluation methods and assurance levels correspond to the needs of the intended users of the scheme;

article-54-para-1-point-c.title: Article 54(1)(c)
article-54-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) references to the international, European or national standards applied in the evaluation or, where such standards are not available or appropriate, to technical specifications that meet the requirements set out in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 1025/2012 or, if such specifications are not...

article-54-para-1-point-d.title: Article 54(1)(d)
article-54-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) where applicable, one or more assurance levels;

article-54-para-1-point-e.title: Article 54(1)(e)
article-54-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) an indication of whether conformity self-assessment is permitted under the scheme;

article-54-para-1-point-f.title: Article 54(1)(f)
article-54-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) where applicable, specific or additional requirements to which conformity assessment bodies are subject in order to guarantee their technical competence to evaluate the cybersecurity requirements;

article-54-para-1-point-g.title: Article 54(1)(g)
article-54-para-1-point-g.excerpt: (g) the specific evaluation criteria and methods to be used, including types of evaluation, in order to demonstrate that the security objectives referred to in Article 51 are achieved;

article-54-para-1-point-h.title: Article 54(1)(h)
article-54-para-1-point-h.excerpt: (h) where applicable, the information which is necessary for certification and which is to be supplied or otherwise be made available to the conformity assessment bodies by an applicant;

article-54-para-1-point-i.title: Article 54(1)(i)
article-54-para-1-point-i.excerpt: (i) where the scheme provides for marks or labels, the conditions under which such marks or labels may be used;

article-54-para-1-point-j.title: Article 54(1)(j)
article-54-para-1-point-j.excerpt: (j) rules for monitoring compliance of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes with the requirements of the European cybersecurity certificates or the EU statements of conformity, including mechanisms to demonstrate continued compliance with the specified cybersecurity requirements;

article-54-para-1-point-k.title: Article 54(1)(k)
article-54-para-1-point-k.excerpt: (k) where applicable, the conditions for issuing, maintaining, continuing and renewing the European cybersecurity certificates, as well as the conditions for extending or reducing the scope of certification;

article-54-para-1-point-l.title: Article 54(1)(l)
article-54-para-1-point-l.excerpt: (l) rules concerning the consequences for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes that have been certified or for which an EU statement of conformity has been issued, but which do not comply with the requirements of the scheme;

article-54-para-1-point-m.title: Article 54(1)(m)
article-54-para-1-point-m.excerpt: (m) rules concerning how previously undetected cybersecurity vulnerabilities in ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes are to be reported and dealt with;

article-54-para-1-point-n.title: Article 54(1)(n)
article-54-para-1-point-n.excerpt: (n) where applicable, rules concerning the retention of records by conformity assessment bodies;

article-54-para-1-point-o.title: Article 54(1)(o)
article-54-para-1-point-o.excerpt: (o) the identification of national or international cybersecurity certification schemes covering the same type or categories of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes, security requirements, evaluation criteria and methods, and assurance levels;

article-54-para-1-point-p.title: Article 54(1)(p)
article-54-para-1-point-p.excerpt: (p) the content and the format of the European cybersecurity certificates and the EU statements of conformity to be issued;

article-54-para-1-point-q.title: Article 54(1)(q)
article-54-para-1-point-q.excerpt: (q) the period of the availability of the EU statement of conformity, technical documentation, and all other relevant information to be made available by the manufacturer or provider of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes;

article-54-para-1-point-r.title: Article 54(1)(r)
article-54-para-1-point-r.excerpt: (r) maximum period of validity of European cybersecurity certificates issued under the scheme;

article-54-para-1-point-s.title: Article 54(1)(s)
article-54-para-1-point-s.excerpt: (s) disclosure policy for European cybersecurity certificates issued, amended or withdrawn under the scheme;

article-54-para-1-point-t.title: Article 54(1)(t)
article-54-para-1-point-t.excerpt: (t) conditions for the mutual recognition of certification schemes with third countries;

article-54-para-1-point-u.title: Article 54(1)(u)
article-54-para-1-point-u.excerpt: (u) where applicable, rules concerning any peer assessment mechanism established by the scheme for the authorities or bodies issuing European cybersecurity certificates for assurance level 'high' pursuant to Article 56(6). Such mechanism shall be without prejudice to the peer review provided for in...

article-54-para-1-point-v.title: Article 54(1)(v)
article-54-para-1-point-v.excerpt: (v) format and procedures to be followed by manufacturers or providers of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes in supplying and updating the supplementary cybersecurity information in accordance with Article 55.

article-54-para-2.title: Article 54(2)
article-54-para-2.excerpt: The specified requirements of the European cybersecurity certification scheme shall be consistent with any applicable legal requirements, in particular requirements emanating from harmonised Union law.

article-54-para-3.title: Article 54(3)
article-54-para-3.excerpt: Where a specific Union legal act so provides, a certificate or an EU statement of conformity issued under a European cybersecurity certification scheme may be used to demonstrate the presumption of conformity with requirements of that legal act.

article-54-para-4.title: Article 54(4)
article-54-para-4.excerpt: In the absence of harmonised Union law, Member State law may also provide that a European cybersecurity certification scheme may be used for establishing the presumption of conformity with legal requirements.

article-55-para-1.title: Article 55(1)
article-55-para-1.excerpt: The manufacturer or provider of certified ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes or of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes for which an EU statement of conformity has been issued shall make publicly available the following supplementary cybersecurity information: (a) guidance and...

article-55-para-1-point-b.title: Article 55(1)(b)
article-55-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) the period during which security support will be offered to end users, in particular as regards the availability of cybersecurity related updates;

article-55-para-1-point-c.title: Article 55(1)(c)
article-55-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) contact information of the manufacturer or provider and accepted methods for receiving vulnerability information from end users and security researchers;

article-55-para-1-point-d.title: Article 55(1)(d)
article-55-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) a reference to online repositories listing publicly disclosed vulnerabilities related to the ICT product, ICT service or ICT process and to any relevant cybersecurity advisories.

article-55-para-2.title: Article 55(2)
article-55-para-2.excerpt: The information referred to in paragraph 1 shall be available in electronic form and shall remain available and be updated as necessary at least until the expiry of the corresponding European cybersecurity certificate or EU statement of conformity.

article-56-para-1.title: Article 56(1)
article-56-para-1.excerpt: (a) take into account the impact of the measures on the manufacturers or providers of such ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes and on the users in terms of the cost of those measures and the societal or economic benefits stemming from the anticipated enhanced level of security for the...

article-56-para-2.title: Article 56(2)
article-56-para-2.excerpt: (b) take into account the existence and implementation of relevant Member State and third country law;

article-56-para-3.title: Article 56(3)
article-56-para-3.excerpt: (c) carry out an open, transparent and inclusive consultation process with all relevant stakeholders and Member States;

article-56-para-4.title: Article 56(4)
article-56-para-4.excerpt: The conformity assessment bodies referred to in Article 60 shall issue European cybersecurity certificates pursuant to this Article referring to assurance level 'basic' or 'substantial' on the basis of criteria included in the European cybersecurity certification scheme adopted by the Commission...

article-56-para-5.title: Article 56(5)
article-56-para-5.excerpt: By way of derogation from paragraph 4, in duly justified cases a European cybersecurity certification scheme may provide that European cybersecurity certificates resulting from that scheme are to be issued only by a public body. Such body shall be one of the following: (a) a national cybersecurity...

article-56-para-5-point-b.title: Article 56(5)(b)
article-56-para-5-point-b.excerpt: (b) a public body that is accredited as a conformity assessment body pursuant to Article 60(1).

article-56-para-6.title: Article 56(6)
article-56-para-6.excerpt: Where a European cybersecurity certification scheme adopted pursuant to Article 49 requires an assurance level 'high', the European cybersecurity certificate under that scheme is to be issued only by a national cybersecurity certification authority or, in the following cases, by a conformity...

article-56-para-6-point-b.title: Article 56(6)(b)
article-56-para-6-point-b.excerpt: (b) on the basis of a general delegation of the task of issuing such European cybersecurity certificates to a conformity assessment body by the national cybersecurity certification authority.

article-56-para-7.title: Article 56(7)
article-56-para-7.excerpt: The natural or legal person who submits ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes for certification shall make available to the national cybersecurity certification authority referred to in Article 58, where that authority is the body issuing the European cybersecurity certificate, or to the...

article-56-para-8.title: Article 56(8)
article-56-para-8.excerpt: The holder of a European cybersecurity certificate shall inform the authority or body referred to in paragraph 7 of any subsequently detected vulnerabilities or irregularities concerning the security of the certified ICT product, ICT service or ICT process that may have an impact on its compliance...

article-56-para-9.title: Article 56(9)
article-56-para-9.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certificate shall be issued for the period provided for in the European cybersecurity certification scheme and may be renewed, provided that the relevant requirements continue to be met.

article-56-para-10.title: Article 56(10)
article-56-para-10.excerpt: A European cybersecurity certificate issued pursuant to this Article shall be recognised in all Member States.

article-57-para-1.title: Article 57(1)
article-57-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to paragraph 3 of this Article, national cybersecurity certification schemes, and the related procedures for the ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes that are covered by a European cybersecurity certification scheme shall cease to produce effects from the date established...

article-57-para-2.title: Article 57(2)
article-57-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall not introduce new national cybersecurity certification schemes for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes already covered by a European cybersecurity certification scheme that is in force.

article-57-para-3.title: Article 57(3)
article-57-para-3.excerpt: Existing certificates that were issued under national cybersecurity certification schemes and are covered by a European cybersecurity certification scheme shall remain valid until their expiry date.

article-57-para-4.title: Article 57(4)
article-57-para-4.excerpt: With a view to avoiding the fragmentation of the internal market, Member States shall inform the Commission and the ECCG of any intention to draw up new national cybersecurity certification schemes.

article-58-para-1.title: Article 58(1)
article-58-para-1.excerpt: Each Member State shall designate one or more national cybersecurity certification authorities in its territory or, with the agreement of another Member State, shall designate one or more national cybersecurity certification authorities established in that other Member State to be responsible for...

article-58-para-2.title: Article 58(2)
article-58-para-2.excerpt: Each Member State shall inform the Commission of the identity of the designated national cybersecurity certification authorities. Where a Member State designates more than one authority, it shall also inform the Commission about the tasks assigned to each of those authorities.

article-58-para-3.title: Article 58(3)
article-58-para-3.excerpt: Without prejudice to point (a) of Article 56(5) and Article 56(6), each national cybersecurity certification authority shall be independent of the entities it supervises in its organisation, funding decisions, legal structure and decision-making.

article-58-para-4.title: Article 58(4)
article-58-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the activities of the national cybersecurity certification authorities that relate to the issuance of European cybersecurity certificates referred to in point (a) of Article 56(5) and in Article 56(6) are strictly separated from their supervisory activities set out...

article-58-para-5.title: Article 58(5)
article-58-para-5.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that national cybersecurity certification authorities have adequate resources to exercise their powers and to carry out their tasks in an effective and efficient manner.

article-58-para-6.title: Article 58(6)
article-58-para-6.excerpt: For the effective implementation of this Regulation, it is appropriate that national cybersecurity certification authorities participate in the ECCG in an active, effective, efficient and secure manner.

article-58-para-7.title: Article 58(7)
article-58-para-7.excerpt: National cybersecurity certification authorities shall: (a) supervise and enforce rules included in European cybersecurity certification schemes pursuant to point (j) of Article 54(1) for the monitoring of the compliance of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes with the requirements of the...

article-58-para-7-point-b.title: Article 58(7)(b)
article-58-para-7-point-b.excerpt: (b) monitor compliance with and enforce the obligations of the manufacturers or providers of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes that are established in their respective territories and that carry out conformity self-assessment, and shall, in particular, monitor compliance with and enforce...

article-58-para-7-point-c.title: Article 58(7)(c)
article-58-para-7-point-c.excerpt: (c) without prejudice to Article 60(3), actively assist and support the national accreditation bodies in the monitoring and supervision of the activities of conformity assessment bodies, for the purposes of this Regulation;

article-58-para-7-point-d.title: Article 58(7)(d)
article-58-para-7-point-d.excerpt: (d) monitor and supervise the activities of the public bodies referred to in Article 56(5);

article-58-para-7-point-e.title: Article 58(7)(e)
article-58-para-7-point-e.excerpt: (e) where applicable, authorise conformity assessment bodies in accordance with Article 60(3) and restrict, suspend or withdraw existing authorisation where conformity assessment bodies infringe the requirements of this Regulation;

article-58-para-7-point-f.title: Article 58(7)(f)
article-58-para-7-point-f.excerpt: (f) handle complaints by natural or legal persons in relation to European cybersecurity certificates issued by national cybersecurity certification authorities or to European cybersecurity certificates issued by conformity assessment bodies in accordance with Article 56(6) or in relation to EU...

article-58-para-7-point-g.title: Article 58(7)(g)
article-58-para-7-point-g.excerpt: (g) provide an annual summary report on the activities conducted under points (b), (c) and (d) of this paragraph or under paragraph 8 to ENISA and the ECCG;

article-58-para-7-point-h.title: Article 58(7)(h)
article-58-para-7-point-h.excerpt: (h) cooperate with other national cybersecurity certification authorities or other public authorities, including by sharing information on the possible non-compliance of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes with the requirements of this Regulation or with the requirements of specific...

article-58-para-7-point-i.title: Article 58(7)(i)
article-58-para-7-point-i.excerpt: (i) monitor relevant developments in the field of cybersecurity certification.

article-58-para-8.title: Article 58(8)
article-58-para-8.excerpt: Each national cybersecurity certification authority shall have at least the following powers: (a) to request conformity assessment bodies, European cybersecurity certificates ’ holders and issuers of EU statements of conformity to provide any information it requires for the performance of its tasks;

article-58-para-8-point-b.title: Article 58(8)(b)
article-58-para-8-point-b.excerpt: (b) to carry out investigations, in the form of audits, of conformity assessment bodies, European cybersecurity certificates ’ holders and issuers of EU statements of conformity, for the purpose of verifying their compliance with this Title;

article-58-para-8-point-c.title: Article 58(8)(c)
article-58-para-8-point-c.excerpt: (c) to take appropriate measures, in accordance with national law, to ensure that conformity assessment bodies, European cybersecurity certificates ’ holders and issuers of EU statements of conformity comply with this Regulation or with a European cybersecurity certification scheme;

article-58-para-8-point-d.title: Article 58(8)(d)
article-58-para-8-point-d.excerpt: (d) to obtain access to the premises of any conformity assessment bodies or holders of European cybersecurity certificates, for the purpose of carrying out investigations in accordance with Union or Member State procedural law;

article-58-para-8-point-e.title: Article 58(8)(e)
article-58-para-8-point-e.excerpt: (e) to withdraw, in accordance with national law, European cybersecurity certificates issued by the national cybersecurity certification authorities or European cybersecurity certificates issued by conformity assessment bodies in accordance with Article 56(6), where such certificates do not comply...

article-58-para-8-point-f.title: Article 58(8)(f)
article-58-para-8-point-f.excerpt: (f) to impose penalties in accordance with national law, as provided for in Article 65, and to require the immediate cessation of infringements of the obligations set out in this Regulation.

article-58-para-9.title: Article 58(9)
article-58-para-9.excerpt: National cybersecurity certification authorities shall cooperate with each other and with the Commission, in particular, by exchanging information, experience and good practices as regards cybersecurity certification and technical issues concerning the cybersecurity of ICT products, ICT services...

article-59-para-1.title: Article 59(1)
article-59-para-1.excerpt: With a view to achieving equivalent standards throughout the Union in respect of European cybersecurity certificates and EU statements of conformity, national cybersecurity certification authorities shall be subject to peer review.

article-59-para-2.title: Article 59(2)
article-59-para-2.excerpt: Peer review shall be carried out on the basis of sound and transparent evaluation criteria and procedures, in particular concerning structural, human resource and process requirements, confidentiality and complaints.

article-59-para-3.title: Article 59(3)
article-59-para-3.excerpt: Peer review shall assess: (a) where applicable, whether the activities of the national cybersecurity certification authorities that relate to the issuance of European cybersecurity certificates referred to in point (a) of Article 56(5) and in Article 56(6) are strictly separated from their...

article-59-para-3-point-b.title: Article 59(3)(b)
article-59-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) the procedures for supervising and enforcing the rules for monitoring the compliance of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes with European cybersecurity certificates pursuant to point (a) of Article 58(7);

article-59-para-3-point-c.title: Article 59(3)(c)
article-59-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) the procedures for monitoring and enforcing the obligations of manufacturers or providers of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes pursuant to point (b) of Article 58(7);

article-59-para-3-point-d.title: Article 59(3)(d)
article-59-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) the procedures for monitoring, authorising and supervising the activities of the conformity assessment bodies;

article-59-para-3-point-e.title: Article 59(3)(e)
article-59-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) where applicable, whether the staff of authorities or bodies that issue certificates for assurance level 'high' pursuant to Article 56(6) have the appropriate expertise.

article-59-para-4.title: Article 59(4)
article-59-para-4.excerpt: Peer review shall be carried out by at least two national cybersecurity certification authorities of other Member States and the Commission and shall be carried out at least once every five years. ENISA may participate in the peer review.

article-59-para-5.title: Article 59(5)
article-59-para-5.excerpt: The Commission may adopt implementing acts establishing a plan for peer review which covers a period of at least five years, laying down the criteria concerning the composition of the peer review team, the methodology to be used in peer review, and the schedule, the frequency and other tasks...

article-59-para-6.title: Article 59(6)
article-59-para-6.excerpt: The outcomes of peer reviews shall be examined by the ECCG, which shall draw up summaries that may be made publicly available and which shall, where necessary, issue guidelines or recommendations on actions or measures to be taken by the entities concerned.

article-60-para-1.title: Article 60(1)
article-60-para-1.excerpt: The conformity assessment bodies shall be accredited by national accreditation bodies appointed pursuant to Regulation (EC) No 765/2008. Such accreditation shall be issued only where the conformity assessment body meets the requirements set out in the Annex to this Regulation.

article-60-para-2.title: Article 60(2)
article-60-para-2.excerpt: Where a European cybersecurity certificate is issued by a national cybersecurity certification authority pursuant to point (a) of Article 56(5) and Article 56(6), the certification body of the national cybersecurity certification authority shall be accredited as a conformity assessment body...

article-60-para-3.title: Article 60(3)
article-60-para-3.excerpt: Where European cybersecurity certification schemes set out specific or additional requirements pursuant to point (f) of Article 54(1), only conformity assessment bodies that meet those requirements shall be authorised by the national cybersecurity certification authority to carry out tasks under...

article-60-para-4.title: Article 60(4)
article-60-para-4.excerpt: The accreditation referred to in paragraph 1 shall be issued to the conformity assessment bodies for a maximum of five years and may be renewed on the same conditions, provided that the conformity assessment body still meets the requirements set out in this Article. National accreditation bodies...

article-61-para-1.title: Article 61(1)
article-61-para-1.excerpt: For each European cybersecurity certification scheme, the national cybersecurity certification authorities shall notify the Commission of the conformity assessment bodies that have been accredited and, where applicable, authorised pursuant to Article 60(3) to issue European cybersecurity...

article-61-para-2.title: Article 61(2)
article-61-para-2.excerpt: One year after the entry into force of a European cybersecurity certification scheme, the Commission shall publish a list of the conformity assessment bodies notified under that scheme in the Official Journal of the European Union.

article-61-para-3.title: Article 61(3)
article-61-para-3.excerpt: If the Commission receives a notification after the expiry of the period referred to in paragraph 2, it shall publish the amendments to the list of notified conformity assessment bodies in the Official Journal of the European Union within two months of the date of receipt of that notification.

article-61-para-4.title: Article 61(4)
article-61-para-4.excerpt: A national cybersecurity certification authority may submit to the Commission a request to remove a conformity assessment body notified by that authority from the list referred to in paragraph 2. The Commission shall publish the corresponding amendments to that list in the Official Journal of the...

article-61-para-5.title: Article 61(5)
article-61-para-5.excerpt: The Commission may adopt implementing acts to establish the circumstances, formats and procedures for notifications referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article. Those implementing acts shall be adopted in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 66(2).

article-62-para-1.title: Article 62(1)
article-62-para-1.excerpt: The European Cybersecurity Certification Group (the 'ECCG') shall be established.

article-62-para-2.title: Article 62(2)
article-62-para-2.excerpt: The ECCG shall be composed of representatives of national cybersecurity certification authorities or representatives of other relevant national authorities. A member of the ECCG shall not represent more than two Member States.

article-62-para-3.title: Article 62(3)
article-62-para-3.excerpt: Stakeholders and relevant third parties may be invited to attend meetings of the ECCG and to participate in its work.

article-62-para-4.title: Article 62(4)
article-62-para-4.excerpt: The ECCG shall have the following tasks: (a) to advise and assist the Commission in its work to ensure the consistent implementation and application of this Title, in particular regarding the Union rolling work programme, cybersecurity certification policy issues, the coordination of policy...

article-62-para-4-point-b.title: Article 62(4)(b)
article-62-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) to assist, advise and cooperate with ENISA in relation to the preparation of a candidate scheme pursuant to Article 49;

article-62-para-4-point-c.title: Article 62(4)(c)
article-62-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) to adopt an opinion on candidate schemes prepared by ENISA pursuant to Article 49;

article-62-para-4-point-d.title: Article 62(4)(d)
article-62-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) to request ENISA to prepare candidate schemes pursuant to Article 48(2);

article-62-para-4-point-e.title: Article 62(4)(e)
