article-62-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) to adopt opinions addressed to the Commission relating to the maintenance and review of existing European cybersecurity certifications schemes;

article-62-para-4-point-f.title: Article 62(4)(f)
article-62-para-4-point-f.excerpt: (f) to examine relevant developments in the field of cybersecurity certification and to exchange information and good practices on cybersecurity certification schemes;

article-62-para-4-point-g.title: Article 62(4)(g)
article-62-para-4-point-g.excerpt: (g) to facilitate the cooperation between national cybersecurity certification authorities under this Title through capacity-building and the exchange of information, in particular by establishing methods for the efficient exchange of information relating to issues concerning cybersecurity...

article-62-para-4-point-h.title: Article 62(4)(h)
article-62-para-4-point-h.excerpt: (h) to support the implementation of peer assessment mechanisms in accordance with the rules established in a European cybersecurity certification scheme pursuant to point (u) of Article 54(1);

article-62-para-4-point-i.title: Article 62(4)(i)
article-62-para-4-point-i.excerpt: (i) to facilitate the alignment of European cybersecurity certification schemes with internationally recognised standards, including by reviewing existing European cybersecurity certification schemes and, where appropriate, making recommendations to ENISA to engage with relevant international...

article-62-para-5.title: Article 62(5)
article-62-para-5.excerpt: With the assistance of ENISA, the Commission shall chair the ECCG, and the Commission shall provide the ECCG with a secretariat in accordance with point (e) of Article 8(1).

article-63-para-1.title: Article 63(1)
article-63-para-1.excerpt: Natural and legal persons shall have the right to lodge a complaint with the issuer of a European cybersecurity certificate or, where the complaint relates to a European cybersecurity certificate issued by a conformity assessment body when acting in accordance with Article 56(6), with the relevant...

article-63-para-2.title: Article 63(2)
article-63-para-2.excerpt: The authority or body with which the complaint has been lodged shall inform the complainant of the progress of the proceedings and of the decision taken, and shall inform the complainant of the right to an effective judicial remedy referred to in Article 64.

article-64-para-1.title: Article 64(1)
article-64-para-1.excerpt: Notwithstanding any administrative or other non-judicial remedies, natural and legal persons shall have the right to an effective judicial remedy with regard to: (a) decisions taken by the authority or body referred to in Article 63(1) including, where applicable, in relation to the improper...

article-64-para-1-point-b.title: Article 64(1)(b)
article-64-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) a failure to act on a complaint lodged with the authority or body referred to in Article 63(1).

article-64-para-2.title: Article 64(2)
article-64-para-2.excerpt: Proceedings pursuant to this Article shall be brought before the courts of the Member State in which the authority or body against which the judicial remedy is sought is located.

article-66-para-1.title: Article 66(1)
article-66-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall be assisted by a committee. That committee shall be a committee within the meaning of Regulation (EU) No 182/2011.

article-66-para-2.title: Article 66(2)
article-66-para-2.excerpt: Where reference is made to this paragraph, point (b) of Article 5(4) of Regulation (EU) No 182/2011 shall apply.

article-67-para-1.title: Article 67(1)
article-67-para-1.excerpt: By 28 June 2024, and every five years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate the impact, effectiveness and efficiency of ENISA and of its working practices, the possible need to modify ENISA’s mandate and the financial implications of any such modification. The evaluation shall take into account...

article-67-para-2.title: Article 67(2)
article-67-para-2.excerpt: The evaluation shall also assess the impact, effectiveness and efficiency of the provisions of Title III of this Regulation with regard to the objectives of ensuring an adequate level of cybersecurity of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes in the Union and improving the functioning of the...

article-67-para-3.title: Article 67(3)
article-67-para-3.excerpt: The evaluation shall assess whether essential cybersecurity requirements for access to the internal market are necessary in order to prevent ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes which do not meet basic cybersecurity requirements from entering the Union market.

article-67-para-4.title: Article 67(4)
article-67-para-4.excerpt: By 28 June 2024, and every five years thereafter, the Commission shall transmit a report on the evaluation together with its conclusions to the European Parliament, to the Council and to the Management Board. The findings of that report shall be made public.

article-68-para-1.title: Article 68(1)
article-68-para-1.excerpt: Regulation (EU) No 526/2013 is repealed with effect from 27 June 2019.

article-68-para-2.title: Article 68(2)
article-68-para-2.excerpt: References to Regulation (EU) No 526/2013 and to the ENISA as established by that Regulation shall be construed as references to this Regulation and to ENISA as established by this Regulation.

article-68-para-3.title: Article 68(3)
article-68-para-3.excerpt: ENISA as established by this Regulation shall succeed ENISA as established by Regulation (EU) No 526/2013 as regards all ownership, agreements, legal obligations, employment contracts, financial commitments and liabilities. All decisions of the Management Board and the Executive Board adopted in...

article-68-para-4.title: Article 68(4)
article-68-para-4.excerpt: ENISA shall be established for an indefinite period as of 27 June 2019.

article-68-para-5.title: Article 68(5)
article-68-para-5.excerpt: The Executive Director appointed pursuant to Article 24(4) of Regulation (EU) No 526/2013 shall remain in office and exercise the duties of the Executive Director as referred to in Article 20 of this Regulation for the remaining part of the Executive Director’s term of office. The other conditions...

article-68-para-6.title: Article 68(6)
article-68-para-6.excerpt: The members of the Management Board and their alternates appointed pursuant to Article 6 of Regulation (EU) No 526/2013 shall remain in office and exercise the functions of the Management Board as referred to in Article 15 of this Regulation for the remaining part of their term of office.

article-69-para-1.title: Article 69(1)
article-69-para-1.excerpt: This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.

article-69-para-2.title: Article 69(2)
article-69-para-2.excerpt: Articles 58, 60, 61, 63, 64 and 65 shall apply from 28 June 2021.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall carry out the tasks assigned to it under this Regulation for the purpose of achieving a high common level of cybersecurity across the Union, including by actively supporting Member States, Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies in improving cybersecurity. ENISA shall act as a...

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall carry out the tasks assigned to it by Union legal acts that set out measures for approximating Member State laws, regulations and administrative provisions which are related to cybersecurity.

article-3-para-3.title: Article 3(3)
article-3-para-3.excerpt: When carrying out its tasks, ENISA shall act independently while avoiding the duplication of Member State activities and taking into consideration existing Member State expertise.

article-3-para-4.title: Article 3(4)
article-3-para-4.excerpt: ENISA shall develop its own resources, including technical and human capabilities and skills, necessary to perform the tasks assigned to it under this Regulation.

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall be a centre of expertise on cybersecurity by virtue of its independence, the scientific and technical quality of the advice and assistance it delivers, the information it provides, the transparency of its operating procedures, the methods of operation, and its diligence in carrying out...

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall assist the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies, as well as Member States, in developing and implementing Union policies related to cybersecurity, including sectoral policies on cybersecurity.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: ENISA shall support capacity-building and preparedness across the Union by assisting the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies, as well as Member States and public and private stakeholders, to increase the protection of their network and information systems, to develop and improve cyber...

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: ENISA shall promote cooperation, including information sharing and coordination at Union level, among Member States, Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies, and relevant private and public stakeholders on matters related to cybersecurity.

article-4-para-5.title: Article 4(5)
article-4-para-5.excerpt: ENISA shall contribute to increasing cybersecurity capabilities at Union level in order to support the actions of Member States in preventing and responding to cyber threats, in particular in the event of cross-border incidents.

article-4-para-6.title: Article 4(6)
article-4-para-6.excerpt: ENISA shall promote the use of European cybersecurity certification, with a view to avoiding the fragmentation of the internal market. ENISA shall contribute to the establishment and maintenance of a European cybersecurity certification framework in accordance with Title III of this Regulation,...

article-4-para-7.title: Article 4(7)
article-4-para-7.excerpt: ENISA shall promote a high level of cybersecurity awareness, including cyber-hygiene and cyber-literacy among citizens, organisations and businesses.

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: (1) assisting and advising on the development and review of Union policy and law in the field of cybersecurity and on sector-specific policy and law initiatives where matters related to cybersecurity are involved, in particular by providing its independent opinion and analysis as well as carrying...

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: (2) assisting Member States to implement the Union policy and law regarding cybersecurity consistently, in particular in relation to Directive (EU) 2016/1148, including by means of issuing opinions, guidelines, providing advice and best practices on topics such as risk management, incident...

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: (3) assisting Member States and Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies in developing and promoting cybersecurity policies related to sustaining the general availability or integrity of the public core of the open internet;

article-5-para-4.title: Article 5(4)
article-5-para-4.excerpt: (4) contributing to the work of the Cooperation Group pursuant to Article 11 of Directive (EU) 2016/1148, by providing its expertise and assistance;

article-5-para-5.title: Article 5(5)
article-5-para-5.excerpt: (5) supporting: (a) the development and implementation of Union policy in the field of electronic identity and trust services, in particular by providing advice and issuing technical guidelines, as well as by facilitating the exchange of best practices between competent authorities;

article-5-para-5-point-b.title: Article 5(5)(b)
article-5-para-5-point-b.excerpt: (b) the promotion of an enhanced level of security of electronic communications, including by providing advice and expertise, as well as by facilitating the exchange of best practices between competent authorities;

article-5-para-5-point-c.title: Article 5(5)(c)
article-5-para-5-point-c.excerpt: (c) Member States in the implementation of specific cybersecurity aspects of Union policy and law relating to data protection and privacy, including by providing advice to the European Data Protection Board upon request;

article-5-para-6.title: Article 5(6)
article-5-para-6.excerpt: (6) supporting the regular review of Union policy activities by preparing an annual report on the state of the implementation of the respective legal framework regarding: (a) information on Member States ’ incident notifications provided by the single points of contact to the Cooperation Group...

article-5-para-6-point-b.title: Article 5(6)(b)
article-5-para-6-point-b.excerpt: (b) summaries of notifications of breach of security or loss of integrity received from trust service providers provided by the supervisory bodies to ENISA, pursuant to Article 19(3) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council [Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of the...

article-5-para-6-point-c.title: Article 5(6)(c)
article-5-para-6-point-c.excerpt: (c) notifications of security incidents transmitted by the providers of public electronic communications networks or of publicly available electronic communications services, provided by the competent authorities to ENISA, pursuant to Article 40 of Directive (EU) 2018/1972.

article-6-para-1.title: Article 6(1)
article-6-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall assist: (a) Member States in their efforts to improve the prevention, detection and analysis of, and the capability to respond to cyber threats and incidents by providing them with knowledge and expertise;

article-6-para-1-point-b.title: Article 6(1)(b)
article-6-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) Member States and Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies in establishing and implementing vulnerability disclosure policies on a voluntary basis;

article-6-para-1-point-c.title: Article 6(1)(c)
article-6-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies in their efforts to improve the prevention, detection and analysis of cyber threats and incidents and to improve their capabilities to respond to such cyber threats and incidents, in particular through appropriate support for the CERT-EU;

article-6-para-1-point-d.title: Article 6(1)(d)
article-6-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) Member States in developing national CSIRTs, where requested pursuant to Article 9(5) of Directive (EU) 2016/1148;

article-6-para-1-point-e.title: Article 6(1)(e)
article-6-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) Member States in developing national strategies on the security of network and information systems, where requested pursuant to Article 7(2) of Directive (EU) 2016/1148, and promote the dissemination of those strategies and note the progress in their implementation across the Union in order to...

article-6-para-1-point-f.title: Article 6(1)(f)
article-6-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) Union institutions in developing and reviewing Union strategies regarding cybersecurity, promoting their dissemination and tracking the progress in their implementation;

article-6-para-1-point-g.title: Article 6(1)(g)
article-6-para-1-point-g.excerpt: (g) national and Union CSIRTs in raising the level of their capabilities, including by promoting dialogue and exchanges of information, with a view to ensuring that, with regard to the state of the art, each CSIRT possesses a common set of minimum capabilities and operates according to best...

article-6-para-1-point-h.title: Article 6(1)(h)
article-6-para-1-point-h.excerpt: (h) Member States by regularly organising the cybersecurity exercises at Union level referred to in Article 7(5) on at least a biennial basis and by making policy recommendations based on the evaluation process of the exercises and lessons learned from them;

article-6-para-1-point-i.title: Article 6(1)(i)
article-6-para-1-point-i.excerpt: (i) relevant public bodies by offering trainings regarding cybersecurity, where appropriate in cooperation with stakeholders;

article-6-para-1-point-j.title: Article 6(1)(j)
article-6-para-1-point-j.excerpt: (j) the Cooperation Group, in the exchange of best practices, in particular with regard to the identification by Member States of operators of essential services, pursuant to point (l) of Article 11(3) of Directive (EU) 2016/1148, including in relation to cross-border dependencies, regarding risks...

article-6-para-2.title: Article 6(2)
article-6-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall support information sharing in and between sectors, in particular in the sectors listed in Annex II to Directive (EU) 2016/1148, by providing best practices and guidance on available tools, procedures, as well as on how to address regulatory issues related to information-sharing.

article-7-para-1.title: Article 7(1)
article-7-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall support operational cooperation among Member States, Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies, and between stakeholders.

article-7-para-2.title: Article 7(2)
article-7-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall cooperate at the operational level and establish synergies with Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies, including the CERT-EU, with the services dealing with cybercrime and with supervisory authorities dealing with the protection of privacy and personal data, with a view to...

article-7-para-2-point-b.title: Article 7(2)(b)
article-7-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the provision of advice and issuing of guidelines on relevant matters related to cybersecurity;

article-7-para-2-point-c.title: Article 7(2)(c)
article-7-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the establishment of practical arrangements for the execution of specific tasks, after consulting the Commission.

article-7-para-3.title: Article 7(3)
article-7-para-3.excerpt: ENISA shall provide the secretariat of the CSIRTs network pursuant to Article 12(2) of Directive (EU) 2016/1148, and in that capacity shall actively support the information sharing and the cooperation among its members.

article-7-para-4.title: Article 7(4)
article-7-para-4.excerpt: ENISA shall support Member States with respect to operational cooperation within the CSIRTs network by: (a) advising on how to improve their capabilities to prevent, detect and respond to incidents and, at the request of one or more Member States, providing advice in relation to a specific cyber...

article-7-para-4-point-b.title: Article 7(4)(b)
article-7-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) assisting, at the request of one or more Member States, in the assessment of incidents having a significant or substantial impact through the provision of expertise and facilitating the technical handling of such incidents including in particular by supporting the voluntary sharing of relevant...

article-7-para-4-point-c.title: Article 7(4)(c)
article-7-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) analysing vulnerabilities and incidents on the basis of publicly available information or information provided voluntarily by Member States for that purpose; and

article-7-para-4-point-d.title: Article 7(4)(d)
article-7-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) at the request of one or more Member States, providing support in relation to ex-post technical inquiries regarding incidents having a significant or substantial impact within the meaning of Directive (EU) 2016/1148.

article-7-para-5.title: Article 7(5)
article-7-para-5.excerpt: ENISA shall regularly organise cybersecurity exercises at Union level, and shall support Member States and Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies in organising cybersecurity exercises following their requests. Such cybersecurity exercises at Union level may include technical, operational...

article-7-para-6.title: Article 7(6)
article-7-para-6.excerpt: ENISA, in close cooperation with the Member States, shall prepare a regular in-depth EU Cybersecurity Technical Situation Report on incidents and cyber threats based on publicly available information, its own analysis, and reports shared by, among others, the Member States ’ CSIRTs or the single...

article-7-para-7.title: Article 7(7)
article-7-para-7.excerpt: ENISA shall contribute to developing a cooperative response at Union and Member States level to large-scale cross-border incidents or crises related to cybersecurity, mainly by: (a) aggregating and analysing reports from national sources that are in the public domain or shared on a voluntary basis...

article-7-para-7-point-b.title: Article 7(7)(b)
article-7-para-7-point-b.excerpt: (b) ensuring the efficient flow of information and the provision of escalation mechanisms between the CSIRTs network and the technical and political decision-makers at Union level;

article-7-para-7-point-c.title: Article 7(7)(c)
article-7-para-7-point-c.excerpt: (c) upon request, facilitating the technical handling of such incidents or crises, including, in particular, by supporting the voluntary sharing of technical solutions between Member States;

article-7-para-7-point-d.title: Article 7(7)(d)
article-7-para-7-point-d.excerpt: (d) supporting Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and, at their request, Member States, in the public communication relating to such incidents or crises;

article-7-para-7-point-e.title: Article 7(7)(e)
article-7-para-7-point-e.excerpt: (e) testing the cooperation plans for responding to such incidents or crises at Union level and, at their request, supporting Member States in testing such plans at national level.

article-8-para-1.title: Article 8(1)
article-8-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall support and promote the development and implementation of Union policy on cybersecurity certification of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes, as established in Title III of this Regulation, by: (a) monitoring developments, on an ongoing basis, in related areas of...

article-8-para-1-point-b.title: Article 8(1)(b)
article-8-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) preparing candidate European cybersecurity certification schemes ('candidate schemes') for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes in accordance with Article 49;

article-8-para-1-point-c.title: Article 8(1)(c)
article-8-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) evaluating adopted European cybersecurity certification schemes in accordance with Article 49(8);

article-8-para-1-point-d.title: Article 8(1)(d)
article-8-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) participating in peer reviews pursuant to Article 59(4);

article-8-para-1-point-e.title: Article 8(1)(e)
article-8-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) assisting the Commission in providing the secretariat of the ECCG pursuant to Article 62(5).

article-8-para-2.title: Article 8(2)
article-8-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall provide the secretariat of the Stakeholder Cybersecurity Certification Group pursuant to Article 22(4).

article-8-para-3.title: Article 8(3)
article-8-para-3.excerpt: ENISA shall compile and publish guidelines and develop good practices, concerning the cybersecurity requirements for ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes, in cooperation with national cybersecurity certification authorities and industry in a formal, structured and transparent way.

article-8-para-4.title: Article 8(4)
article-8-para-4.excerpt: ENISA shall contribute to capacity-building related to evaluation and certification processes by compiling and issuing guidelines as well as by providing support to Member States at their request.

article-8-para-5.title: Article 8(5)
article-8-para-5.excerpt: ENISA shall facilitate the establishment and take-up of European and international standards for risk management and for the security of ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes.

article-8-para-6.title: Article 8(6)
article-8-para-6.excerpt: ENISA shall draw up, in collaboration with Member States and industry, advice and guidelines regarding the technical areas related to the security requirements for operators of essential services and digital service providers, as well as regarding already existing standards, including Member States...

article-8-para-7.title: Article 8(7)
article-8-para-7.excerpt: ENISA shall perform and disseminate regular analyses of the main trends in the cybersecurity market on both the demand and supply sides, with a view to fostering the cybersecurity market in the Union.

article-9-para-1.title: Article 9(1)
article-9-para-1.excerpt: (a) perform analyses of emerging technologies and provide topic-specific assessments on the expected societal, legal, economic and regulatory impact of technological innovations on cybersecurity;

article-9-para-2.title: Article 9(2)
article-9-para-2.excerpt: (b) perform long-term strategic analyses of cyber threats and incidents in order to identify emerging trends and help prevent incidents;

article-9-para-3.title: Article 9(3)
article-9-para-3.excerpt: (c) in cooperation with experts from Member States authorities and relevant stakeholders, provide advice, guidance and best practices for the security of network and information systems, in particular for the security of the infrastructures supporting the sectors listed in Annex II to Directive...

article-9-para-4.title: Article 9(4)
article-9-para-4.excerpt: (d) through a dedicated portal, pool, organise and make available to the public information on cybersecurity provided by the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and information on cybersecurity provided on a voluntary basis by Member States and private and public stakeholders;

article-9-para-5.title: Article 9(5)
article-9-para-5.excerpt: (e) collect and analyse publicly available information regarding significant incidents and compile reports with a view to providing guidance to citizens, organisations and businesses across the Union.

article-10-para-1.title: Article 10(1)
article-10-para-1.excerpt: (a) raise public awareness of cybersecurity risks, and provide guidance on good practices for individual users aimed at citizens, organisations and businesses, including cyber-hygiene and cyber-literacy;

article-10-para-2.title: Article 10(2)
article-10-para-2.excerpt: (b) in cooperation with the Member States, Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and industry, organise regular outreach campaigns to increase cybersecurity and its visibility in the Union and encourage a broad public debate;

article-10-para-3.title: Article 10(3)
article-10-para-3.excerpt: (c) assist Member States in their efforts to raise cybersecurity awareness and promote cybersecurity education;

article-10-para-4.title: Article 10(4)
article-10-para-4.excerpt: (d) support closer coordination and exchange of best practices among Member States on cybersecurity awareness and education.

article-11-para-1.title: Article 11(1)
article-11-para-1.excerpt: (a) advise the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and the Member States on research needs and priorities in the field of cybersecurity, with a view to enabling effective responses to current and emerging risks and cyber threats, including with respect to new and emerging information...

article-11-para-2.title: Article 11(2)
article-11-para-2.excerpt: (b) where the Commission has conferred the relevant powers on it, participate in the implementation phase of research and innovation funding programmes or as a beneficiary;

article-11-para-3.title: Article 11(3)
article-11-para-3.excerpt: (c) contribute to the strategic research and innovation agenda at Union level in the field of cybersecurity.

article-12-para-1.title: Article 12(1)
article-12-para-1.excerpt: (a) where appropriate, engaging as an observer in the organisation of international exercises, and analysing and reporting to the Management Board on the outcome of such exercises;

article-12-para-2.title: Article 12(2)
article-12-para-2.excerpt: (b) at the request of the Commission, facilitating the exchange of best practices;

article-12-para-3.title: Article 12(3)
article-12-para-3.excerpt: (c) at the request of the Commission, providing it with expertise;

article-12-para-4.title: Article 12(4)
article-12-para-4.excerpt: (d) providing advice and support to the Commission on matters concerning agreements for the mutual recognition of cybersecurity certificates with third countries, in collaboration with the ECCG established under Article 62.

article-14-para-1.title: Article 14(1)
article-14-para-1.excerpt: The Management Board shall be composed of one member appointed by each Member State, and two members appointed by the Commission. All members shall have the right to vote.

article-14-para-2.title: Article 14(2)
article-14-para-2.excerpt: Each member of the Management Board shall have an alternate. That alternate shall represent the member in the member’s absence.

article-14-para-3.title: Article 14(3)
article-14-para-3.excerpt: Members of the Management Board and their alternates shall be appointed on the basis of their knowledge in the field of cybersecurity, taking into account their relevant managerial, administrative and budgetary skills. The Commission and the Member States shall make efforts to limit the turnover of...

article-14-para-4.title: Article 14(4)
article-14-para-4.excerpt: The term of office of the members of the Management Board and their alternates shall be four years. That term shall be renewable.

article-15-para-1.title: Article 15(1)
article-15-para-1.excerpt: The Management Board shall: (a) establish the general direction of the operation of ENISA and ensure that ENISA operates in accordance with the rules and principles laid down in this Regulation; it shall also ensure the consistency of ENISA’s work with activities conducted by the Member States as...

article-15-para-1-point-b.title: Article 15(1)(b)
article-15-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) adopt ENISA’s draft single programming document referred to in Article 24, before its submission to the Commission for an opinion;

article-15-para-1-point-c.title: Article 15(1)(c)
article-15-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) adopt ENISA’s single programming document, taking into account the Commission opinion;

article-15-para-1-point-d.title: Article 15(1)(d)
article-15-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) supervise the implementation of the multiannual and annual programming included in the single programming document;

article-15-para-1-point-e.title: Article 15(1)(e)
article-15-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) adopt the annual budget of ENISA and exercise other functions in respect of ENISA’s budget in accordance with Chapter IV;

article-15-para-1-point-f.title: Article 15(1)(f)
article-15-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) assess and adopt the consolidated annual report on ENISA’s activities, including the accounts and a description of how ENISA has met its performance indicators, submit both the annual report and the assessment thereof by 1 July of the following year, to the European Parliament, to the Council,...

article-15-para-1-point-g.title: Article 15(1)(g)
article-15-para-1-point-g.excerpt: (g) adopt the financial rules applicable to ENISA in accordance with Article 32;

article-15-para-1-point-h.title: Article 15(1)(h)
article-15-para-1-point-h.excerpt: (h) adopt an anti-fraud strategy that is proportionate to the fraud risks, having regard to a cost-benefit analysis of the measures to be implemented;

article-15-para-1-point-i.title: Article 15(1)(i)
article-15-para-1-point-i.excerpt: (i) adopt rules for the prevention and management of conflicts of interest in respect of its members;

article-15-para-1-point-j.title: Article 15(1)(j)
article-15-para-1-point-j.excerpt: (j) ensure adequate follow-up to the findings and recommendations resulting from investigations of the European Anti-Fraud Office (OLAF) and the various internal or external audit reports and evaluations;

article-15-para-1-point-k.title: Article 15(1)(k)
article-15-para-1-point-k.excerpt: (k) adopt its rules of procedure, including rules for provisional decisions on the delegation of specific tasks, pursuant to Article 19(7);

article-15-para-1-point-l.title: Article 15(1)(l)
article-15-para-1-point-l.excerpt: (l) with respect to the staff of ENISA, exercise the powers conferred by the Staff Regulations of Officials (the 'Staff Regulations of Officials') and the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants of the European Union (the 'Conditions of Employment of Other Servants'), laid down in Council...

article-15-para-1-point-m.title: Article 15(1)(m)
article-15-para-1-point-m.excerpt: (m) adopt rules implementing the Staff Regulations of Officials and the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants in accordance with the procedure provided for in Article 110 of the Staff Regulations of Officials;

article-15-para-1-point-n.title: Article 15(1)(n)
article-15-para-1-point-n.excerpt: (n) appoint the Executive Director and where relevant extend his or her term of office or remove him or her from office in accordance with Article 36;

article-15-para-1-point-o.title: Article 15(1)(o)
article-15-para-1-point-o.excerpt: (o) appoint an accounting officer, who may be the Commission’s accounting officer, who shall be wholly independent in the performance of his or her duties;

article-15-para-1-point-p.title: Article 15(1)(p)
article-15-para-1-point-p.excerpt: (p) take all decisions concerning the establishment of ENISA’s internal structures and, where necessary, the modification of those internal structures, taking into consideration ENISA’s activity needs and having regard to sound budgetary management;

article-15-para-1-point-q.title: Article 15(1)(q)
article-15-para-1-point-q.excerpt: (q) authorise the establishment of working arrangements with regard to Article 7;

article-15-para-1-point-r.title: Article 15(1)(r)
article-15-para-1-point-r.excerpt: (r) authorise the establishment or conclusion of working arrangements in accordance with Article 42.

article-15-para-2.title: Article 15(2)
article-15-para-2.excerpt: In accordance with Article 110 of the Staff Regulations of Officials, the Management Board shall adopt a decision based on Article 2(1) of the Staff Regulations of Officials and Article 6 of the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants, delegating the relevant appointing authority powers to the...

article-15-para-3.title: Article 15(3)
article-15-para-3.excerpt: Where exceptional circumstances so require, the Management Board may adopt a decision to temporarily suspend the delegation of appointing authority powers to the Executive Director and any appointing authority powers sub-delegated by the Executive Director and instead exercise them itself or...

article-17-para-1.title: Article 17(1)
article-17-para-1.excerpt: Meetings of the Management Board shall be convened by its Chairperson.

article-17-para-2.title: Article 17(2)
article-17-para-2.excerpt: The Management Board shall hold at least two ordinary meetings a year. It shall also hold extraordinary meetings at the request of its Chairperson, at the request of the Commission, or at the request of at least one third of its members.

article-17-para-3.title: Article 17(3)
article-17-para-3.excerpt: The Executive Director shall take part in the meetings of the Management Board but shall not have the right to vote.

article-17-para-4.title: Article 17(4)
article-17-para-4.excerpt: Members of the ENISA Advisory Group may take part in the meetings of the Management Board at the invitation of the Chairperson, but shall not have the right to vote.

article-17-para-5.title: Article 17(5)
article-17-para-5.excerpt: The members of the Management Board and their alternates may be assisted at the meetings of the Management Board by advisers or experts, subject to the rules of procedure of the Management Board.

article-17-para-6.title: Article 17(6)
article-17-para-6.excerpt: ENISA shall provide the secretariat of the Management Board.

article-18-para-1.title: Article 18(1)
article-18-para-1.excerpt: The Management Board shall take its decisions by a majority of its members.

article-18-para-2.title: Article 18(2)
article-18-para-2.excerpt: A majority of two-thirds of the members of the Management Board shall be required for the adoption of the single programming document and of the annual budget and for the appointment, extension of the term of office or removal of the Executive Director.

article-18-para-3.title: Article 18(3)
article-18-para-3.excerpt: Each member shall have one vote. In the absence of a member, their alternate shall be entitled to exercise the member’s right to vote.

article-18-para-4.title: Article 18(4)
article-18-para-4.excerpt: The Chairperson of the Management Board shall take part in the voting.

article-18-para-5.title: Article 18(5)
article-18-para-5.excerpt: The Executive Director shall not take part in the voting.

article-18-para-6.title: Article 18(6)
article-18-para-6.excerpt: The Management Board’s rules of procedure shall establish more detailed voting arrangements, in particular the circumstances in which a member may act on behalf of another member.

article-19-para-1.title: Article 19(1)
article-19-para-1.excerpt: The Management Board shall be assisted by an Executive Board.

article-19-para-2.title: Article 19(2)
article-19-para-2.excerpt: The Executive Board shall: (a) prepare decisions to be adopted by the Management Board;

article-19-para-2-point-b.title: Article 19(2)(b)
article-19-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) together with the Management Board, ensure the adequate follow-up to the findings and recommendations stemming from investigations of OLAF and the various internal or external audit reports and evaluations;

article-19-para-2-point-c.title: Article 19(2)(c)
article-19-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) without prejudice to the responsibilities of the Executive Director set out in Article 20, assist and advise the Executive Director in implementing the decisions of the Management Board on administrative and budgetary matters pursuant to Article 20.

article-19-para-3.title: Article 19(3)
article-19-para-3.excerpt: The Executive Board shall be composed of five members. The members of the Executive Board shall be appointed from among the members of the Management Board. One of the members shall be the Chairperson of the Management Board, who may also chair the Executive Board, and another shall be one of the...

article-19-para-4.title: Article 19(4)
article-19-para-4.excerpt: The term of office of the members of the Executive Board shall be four years. That term shall be renewable.

article-19-para-5.title: Article 19(5)
article-19-para-5.excerpt: The Executive Board shall meet at least once every three months. The Chairperson of the Executive Board shall convene additional meetings at the request of its members.

article-19-para-6.title: Article 19(6)
article-19-para-6.excerpt: The Management Board shall lay down the rules of procedure of the Executive Board.

article-19-para-7.title: Article 19(7)
article-19-para-7.excerpt: When necessary because of urgency, the Executive Board may take certain provisional decisions on behalf of the Management Board, in particular on administrative management matters, including the suspension of the delegation of the appointing authority powers and budgetary matters. Any such...

article-20-para-1.title: Article 20(1)
article-20-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall be managed by its Executive Director, who shall be independent in the performance of his or her duties. The Executive Director shall be accountable to the Management Board.

article-20-para-2.title: Article 20(2)
article-20-para-2.excerpt: The Executive Director shall report to the European Parliament on the performance of his or her duties when invited to do so. The Council may invite the Executive Director to report on the performance of his or her duties.

article-20-para-3.title: Article 20(3)
article-20-para-3.excerpt: The Executive Director shall be responsible for: (a) the day-to-day administration of ENISA;

article-20-para-3-point-b.title: Article 20(3)(b)
article-20-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) implementing the decisions adopted by the Management Board;

article-20-para-3-point-c.title: Article 20(3)(c)
article-20-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) preparing the draft single programming document and submitting it to the Management Board for approval before its submission to the Commission;

article-20-para-3-point-d.title: Article 20(3)(d)
article-20-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) implementing the single programming document and reporting to the Management Board thereon;

article-20-para-3-point-e.title: Article 20(3)(e)
article-20-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) preparing the consolidated annual report on ENISA’s activities, including the implementation of ENISA’s annual work programme, and presenting it to the Management Board for assessment and adoption;

article-20-para-3-point-f.title: Article 20(3)(f)
article-20-para-3-point-f.excerpt: (f) preparing an action plan that follows up on the conclusions of the retrospective evaluations, and reporting on progress every two years to the Commission;

article-20-para-3-point-g.title: Article 20(3)(g)
article-20-para-3-point-g.excerpt: (g) preparing an action plan that follows up on the conclusions of internal or external audit reports, as well as on investigations by OLAF and reporting on progress biannually to the Commission and regularly to the Management Board;

article-20-para-3-point-h.title: Article 20(3)(h)
article-20-para-3-point-h.excerpt: (h) preparing the draft financial rules applicable to ENISA as referred to in Article 32;

article-20-para-3-point-i.title: Article 20(3)(i)
article-20-para-3-point-i.excerpt: (i) preparing ENISA’s draft statement of estimates of revenue and expenditure and implementing its budget;

article-20-para-3-point-j.title: Article 20(3)(j)
article-20-para-3-point-j.excerpt: (j) protecting the financial interests of the Union by the application of preventive measures against fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities, by effective checks and, if irregularities are detected, by the recovery of the amounts wrongly paid and, where appropriate, by effective,...

article-20-para-3-point-k.title: Article 20(3)(k)
article-20-para-3-point-k.excerpt: (k) preparing an anti-fraud strategy for ENISA and presenting it to the Management Board for approval;

article-20-para-3-point-l.title: Article 20(3)(l)
article-20-para-3-point-l.excerpt: (l) developing and maintaining contact with the business community and consumers’ organisations to ensure regular dialogue with relevant stakeholders;

article-20-para-3-point-m.title: Article 20(3)(m)
article-20-para-3-point-m.excerpt: (m) exchanging views and information regularly with Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies regarding their activities relating to cybersecurity to ensure coherence in the development and the implementation of Union policy;

article-20-para-3-point-n.title: Article 20(3)(n)
article-20-para-3-point-n.excerpt: (n) carrying out other tasks assigned to the Executive Director by this Regulation.

article-20-para-4.title: Article 20(4)
article-20-para-4.excerpt: Where necessary and within ENISA’s objectives and tasks, the Executive Director may set up ad hoc working groups composed of experts, including experts from the Member States ’ competent authorities. The Executive Director shall inform the Management Board in advance thereof. The procedures...

article-20-para-5.title: Article 20(5)
article-20-para-5.excerpt: Where necessary, for the purpose of carrying out ENISA’s tasks in an efficient and effective manner and based on an appropriate cost-benefit analysis, the Executive Director may decide to establish one or more local offices in one or more Member States. Before deciding to establish a local office,...

article-21-para-1.title: Article 21(1)
article-21-para-1.excerpt: The Management Board, acting on a proposal from the Executive Director, shall establish in a transparent manner the ENISA Advisory Group composed of recognised experts representing the relevant stakeholders, such as the ICT industry, providers of electronic communications networks or services...

article-21-para-2.title: Article 21(2)
article-21-para-2.excerpt: Procedures for the ENISA Advisory Group, in particular regarding its composition, the proposal by the Executive Director referred to in paragraph 1, the number and appointment of its members and the operation of the ENISA Advisory Group, shall be specified in ENISA’s internal rules of operation and...

article-21-para-3.title: Article 21(3)
article-21-para-3.excerpt: The ENISA Advisory Group shall be chaired by the Executive Director or by any person whom the Executive Director appoints on a case-by-case basis.

article-21-para-4.title: Article 21(4)
article-21-para-4.excerpt: The term of office of the members of the ENISA Advisory Group shall be two-and-a-half years. Members of the Management Board shall not be members of the ENISA Advisory Group. Experts from the Commission and the Member States shall be entitled to be present at the meetings of the ENISA Advisory...

article-21-para-5.title: Article 21(5)
article-21-para-5.excerpt: The ENISA Advisory Group shall advise ENISA in respect of the performance of ENISA’s tasks, except of the application of the provisions of Title III of this Regulation. It shall in particular advise the Executive Director on the drawing up of a proposal for ENISA’s annual work programme, and on...

article-21-para-6.title: Article 21(6)
article-21-para-6.excerpt: The ENISA Advisory Group shall inform the Management Board of its activities on a regular basis.

article-22-para-1.title: Article 22(1)
article-22-para-1.excerpt: The Stakeholder Cybersecurity Certification Group shall be established.

article-22-para-2.title: Article 22(2)
article-22-para-2.excerpt: The Stakeholder Cybersecurity Certification Group shall be composed of members selected from among recognised experts representing the relevant stakeholders. The Commission, following a transparent and open call, shall select, on the basis of a proposal from ENISA, members of the Stakeholder...

article-22-para-3.title: Article 22(3)
article-22-para-3.excerpt: The Stakeholder Cybersecurity Certification Group shall: (a) advise the Commission on strategic issues regarding the European cybersecurity certification framework;

article-22-para-3-point-b.title: Article 22(3)(b)
article-22-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) upon request, advise ENISA on general and strategic matters concerning ENISA’s tasks relating to market, cybersecurity certification, and standardisation;

article-22-para-3-point-c.title: Article 22(3)(c)
article-22-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) assist the Commission in the preparation of the Union rolling work programme referred to in Article 47;

article-22-para-3-point-d.title: Article 22(3)(d)
article-22-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) issue an opinion on the Union rolling work programme pursuant to Article 47(4); and

article-22-para-3-point-e.title: Article 22(3)(e)
article-22-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) in urgent cases, provide advice to the Commission and the ECCG on the need for additional certification schemes not included in the Union rolling work programme, as outlined in Articles 47 and 48.

article-22-para-4.title: Article 22(4)
article-22-para-4.excerpt: The Stakeholder Certification Group shall be co-chaired by the representatives of the Commission and of ENISA, and its secretariat shall be provided by ENISA.

article-23-para-1.title: Article 23(1)
article-23-para-1.excerpt: The Management Board, acting on a proposal from the Executive Director, shall set up a National Liaison Officers Network composed of representatives of all Member States (National Liaison Officers). Each Member State shall appoint one representative to the National Liaison Officers Network. The...

article-23-para-2.title: Article 23(2)
article-23-para-2.excerpt: The National Liaison Officers Network shall in particular facilitate the exchange of information between ENISA and the Member States, and shall support ENISA in disseminating its activities, findings and recommendations to the relevant stakeholders across the Union.

article-23-para-3.title: Article 23(3)
article-23-para-3.excerpt: National Liaison Officers shall act as a point of contact at national level to facilitate cooperation between ENISA and national experts in the context of the implementation of ENISA’s annual work programme.

article-23-para-4.title: Article 23(4)
article-23-para-4.excerpt: While National Liaison Officers shall cooperate closely with the Management Board representatives of their respective Member States, the National Liaisons Officers Network itself shall not duplicate the work of the Management Board or of other Union forums.

article-23-para-5.title: Article 23(5)
article-23-para-5.excerpt: The functions and procedures of the National Liaisons Officers Network shall be specified in ENISA’s internal rules of operation and shall be made public.

article-24-para-1.title: Article 24(1)
article-24-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall operate in accordance with a single programming document containing its annual and multiannual programming, which shall include all of its planned activities.

article-24-para-2.title: Article 24(2)
article-24-para-2.excerpt: Each year, the Executive Director shall draw up a draft single programming document containing its annual and multiannual programming with the corresponding financial and human resources planning in accordance with Article 32 of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 1271/2013 [Commission...

article-24-para-3.title: Article 24(3)
article-24-para-3.excerpt: By 30 November each year, the Management Board shall adopt the single programming document referred to in paragraph 1 and shall transmit it to the European Parliament, to the Council and to the Commission by 31 January of the following year, as well as any subsequently updated versions of that...

article-24-para-4.title: Article 24(4)
article-24-para-4.excerpt: The single programming document shall become final after the definitive adoption of the general budget of the Union and shall be adjusted as necessary.

article-24-para-5.title: Article 24(5)
article-24-para-5.excerpt: The annual work programme shall comprise detailed objectives and expected results including performance indicators. It shall also contain a description of the actions to be financed and an indication of the financial and human resources allocated to each action, in accordance with the principles of...

article-24-para-6.title: Article 24(6)
article-24-para-6.excerpt: The Management Board shall amend the adopted annual work programme when a new task is assigned to ENISA. Any substantial amendments to the annual work programme shall be adopted by the same procedure as for the initial annual work programme. The Management Board may delegate the power to make...

article-24-para-7.title: Article 24(7)
article-24-para-7.excerpt: The multiannual work programme shall set out the overall strategic programming including objectives, expected results and performance indicators. It shall also set out the resource programming including multi-annual budget and staff.

article-24-para-8.title: Article 24(8)
article-24-para-8.excerpt: The resource programming shall be updated annually. The strategic programming shall be updated where appropriate and in particular where necessary to address the outcome of the evaluation referred to in Article 67.

article-25-para-1.title: Article 25(1)
article-25-para-1.excerpt: Members of the Management Board, the Executive Director, and officials seconded by Member States on a temporary basis, shall each make a declaration of commitments and a declaration indicating the absence or presence of any direct or indirect interest which might be considered to be prejudicial to...

article-25-para-2.title: Article 25(2)
article-25-para-2.excerpt: Members of the Management Board, the Executive Director, and external experts participating in ad hoc working groups, shall each accurately and completely declare, at the latest at the start of each meeting, any interest which might be considered to be prejudicial to their independence in relation...

article-25-para-3.title: Article 25(3)
article-25-para-3.excerpt: ENISA shall lay down, in its internal rules of operation, the practical arrangements for the rules on declarations of interest referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2.

article-26-para-1.title: Article 26(1)
article-26-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall carry out its activities with a high level of transparency and in accordance with Article 28.

article-26-para-2.title: Article 26(2)
article-26-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall ensure that the public and any interested parties are provided with appropriate, objective, reliable and easily accessible information, in particular with regard to the results of its work. It shall also make public the declarations of interest made in accordance with Article 25.

article-26-para-3.title: Article 26(3)
article-26-para-3.excerpt: The Management Board, acting on a proposal from the Executive Director, may authorise interested parties to observe the proceedings of some of ENISA’s activities.

article-26-para-4.title: Article 26(4)
article-26-para-4.excerpt: ENISA shall lay down, in its internal rules of operation, the practical arrangements for implementing the transparency rules referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2.

article-27-para-1.title: Article 27(1)
article-27-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to Article 28, ENISA shall not divulge to third parties information that it processes or receives in relation to which a reasoned request for confidential treatment has been made.

article-27-para-2.title: Article 27(2)
article-27-para-2.excerpt: Members of the Management Board, the Executive Director, the members of the ENISA Advisory Group, external experts participating in ad hoc working groups, and members of the staff of ENISA, including officials seconded by Member States on a temporary basis, shall comply with the confidentiality...

article-27-para-3.title: Article 27(3)
article-27-para-3.excerpt: ENISA shall lay down, in its internal rules of operation, the practical arrangements for implementing the confidentiality rules referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2.

article-27-para-4.title: Article 27(4)
article-27-para-4.excerpt: If required for the performance of ENISA’s tasks, the Management Board shall decide to allow ENISA to handle classified information. In that case ENISA, in agreement with the Commission services, shall adopt security rules applying the security principles set out in Commission Decisions (EU,...

article-28-para-1.title: Article 28(1)
article-28-para-1.excerpt: Regulation (EC) No 1049/2001 shall apply to documents held by ENISA.

article-28-para-2.title: Article 28(2)
article-28-para-2.excerpt: The Management Board shall adopt arrangements for implementing Regulation (EC) No 1049/2001 by 28 December 2019.

article-28-para-3.title: Article 28(3)
article-28-para-3.excerpt: Decisions taken by ENISA pursuant to Article 8 of Regulation (EC) No 1049/2001 may be the subject of a complaint to the European Ombudsman under Article 228 TFEU or of an action before the Court of Justice of the European Union under Article 263 TFEU.

article-29-para-1.title: Article 29(1)
article-29-para-1.excerpt: Each year, the Executive Director shall draw up a draft statement of estimates of ENISA’s revenue and expenditure for the following financial year, and shall transmit it to the Management Board, together with a draft establishment plan. Revenue and expenditure shall be in balance.

article-29-para-2.title: Article 29(2)
article-29-para-2.excerpt: Each year the Management Board, on the basis of the draft statement of estimates, shall produce a statement of estimates of ENISA’s revenue and expenditure for the following financial year.

article-29-para-3.title: Article 29(3)
article-29-para-3.excerpt: The Management Board, by 31 January each year, shall send the statement of estimates, which shall be part of the draft single programming document, to the Commission and the third countries with which the Union has concluded agreements as referred to in Article 42(2).

article-29-para-4.title: Article 29(4)
article-29-para-4.excerpt: On the basis of the statement of estimates, the Commission shall enter in the draft general budget of the Union the estimates it deems to be necessary for the establishment plan and the amount of the contribution to be charged to the general budget of the Union, which it shall submit to the...

article-29-para-5.title: Article 29(5)
article-29-para-5.excerpt: The European Parliament and the Council shall authorise the appropriations for the contribution from the Union to ENISA.

article-29-para-6.title: Article 29(6)
article-29-para-6.excerpt: The European Parliament and the Council shall adopt ENISA’s establishment plan.

article-29-para-7.title: Article 29(7)
article-29-para-7.excerpt: The Management Board shall adopt ENISA’s budget together with the single programming document. ENISA’s budget shall become final following the definitive adoption of the general budget of the Union. Where necessary, the Management Board shall adjust ENISA’s budget and single programming document in...

article-30-para-1.title: Article 30(1)
article-30-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to other resources, ENISA’s revenue shall be composed of: (a) a contribution from the general budget of the Union;

article-30-para-1-point-b.title: Article 30(1)(b)
article-30-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) revenue assigned to specific items of expenditure in accordance with its financial rules referred to in Article 32;

article-30-para-1-point-c.title: Article 30(1)(c)
article-30-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) Union funding in the form of delegation agreements or ad hoc grants in accordance with its financial rules referred to in Article 32 and with the provisions of the relevant instruments supporting the policies of the Union;

article-30-para-1-point-d.title: Article 30(1)(d)
article-30-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) contributions from third countries participating in the work of ENISA as referred to in Article 42;

article-30-para-1-point-e.title: Article 30(1)(e)
article-30-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) any voluntary contributions from Member States in money or in kind.

article-30-para-2.title: Article 30(2)
article-30-para-2.excerpt: The expenditure of ENISA shall include staff, administrative and technical support, infrastructure and operational expenses, and expenses resulting from contracts with third parties.

article-31-para-1.title: Article 31(1)
article-31-para-1.excerpt: The Executive Director shall be responsible for the implementation of ENISA’s budget.

article-31-para-2.title: Article 31(2)
article-31-para-2.excerpt: The Commission’s internal auditor shall exercise the same powers over ENISA as over Commission departments.

article-31-para-3.title: Article 31(3)
article-31-para-3.excerpt: ENISA’s accounting officer shall send the provisional accounts for the financial year (year N) to the Commission’s accounting officer and to the Court of Auditors by 1 March of the following financial year (year N + 1).

article-31-para-4.title: Article 31(4)
article-31-para-4.excerpt: Upon the receipt of the Court of Auditors’ observations on ENISA’s provisional accounts pursuant to Article 246 of Regulation (EU, Euratom) 2018/1046 of the European Parliament and of the Council [Regulation (EU, Euratom) 2018/1046 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 July 2018 on...

article-31-para-5.title: Article 31(5)
article-31-para-5.excerpt: The Management Board shall deliver an opinion on ENISA’s final accounts.

article-31-para-6.title: Article 31(6)
article-31-para-6.excerpt: By 31 March of year N + 1, the Executive Director shall transmit the report on the budgetary and financial management to the European Parliament, to the Council, to the Commission and to the Court of Auditors.

article-31-para-7.title: Article 31(7)
article-31-para-7.excerpt: By 1 July of year N + 1, ENISA’s accounting officer shall transmit ENISA’s final accounts to the European Parliament, to the Council, to the Commission’s accounting officer and to the Court of Auditors, together with the Management Board’s opinion.

article-31-para-8.title: Article 31(8)
article-31-para-8.excerpt: At the same date as the transmission of ENISA’s final accounts, ENISA’s accounting officer shall also send to the Court of Auditors a representation letter covering those final accounts, with a copy to the Commission’s accounting officer.

article-31-para-9.title: Article 31(9)
article-31-para-9.excerpt: By 15 November of year N + 1, the Executive Director shall publish ENISA’s final accounts in the Official Journal of the European Union.

article-31-para-10.title: Article 31(10)
article-31-para-10.excerpt: By 30 September of year N + 1, the Executive Director shall send the Court of Auditors a reply to its observations and shall also send a copy of that reply to the Management Board and to the Commission.

article-31-para-11.title: Article 31(11)
article-31-para-11.excerpt: The Executive Director shall submit to the European Parliament, at the latter’s request, any information required for the smooth application of the discharge procedure for the financial year concerned in accordance with Article 261(3) of Regulation (EU, Euratom) 2018/1046.

article-31-para-12.title: Article 31(12)
article-31-para-12.excerpt: On a recommendation from the Council, the European Parliament shall, before 15 May of year N + 2, give a discharge to the Executive Director in respect of the implementation of the budget for the year N.

article-33-para-1.title: Article 33(1)
article-33-para-1.excerpt: In order to facilitate the combating of fraud, corruption and other unlawful activities under Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 883/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council [Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 883/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 September 2013 concerning...

article-33-para-2.title: Article 33(2)
article-33-para-2.excerpt: The Court of Auditors shall have the power of audit, on the basis of documents and of on-the-spot inspections, over all grant beneficiaries, contractors and subcontractors who have received Union funds from ENISA.

article-33-para-3.title: Article 33(3)
article-33-para-3.excerpt: OLAF may carry out investigations, including on-the-spot checks and inspections, in accordance with the provisions and procedures laid down in Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 883/2013 and Council Regulation (Euratom, EC) No 2185/96 [Council Regulation (Euratom, EC) No 2185/96 of 11 November 1996...

article-33-para-4.title: Article 33(4)
article-33-para-4.excerpt: Without prejudice to paragraphs 1, 2 and 3, cooperation agreements with third countries or international organisations, contracts, grant agreements and grant decisions of ENISA shall contain provisions expressly empowering the Court of Auditors and OLAF to conduct such audits and investigations,...

article-36-para-1.title: Article 36(1)
article-36-para-1.excerpt: The Executive Director shall be engaged as a temporary agent of ENISA under point (a) of Article 2 of the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants.

article-36-para-2.title: Article 36(2)
article-36-para-2.excerpt: The Executive Director shall be appointed by the Management Board from a list of candidates proposed by the Commission, following an open and transparent selection procedure.

article-36-para-3.title: Article 36(3)
article-36-para-3.excerpt: For the purpose of concluding the employment contract with the Executive Director, ENISA shall be represented by the Chairperson of the Management Board.

article-36-para-4.title: Article 36(4)
article-36-para-4.excerpt: Before appointment, the candidate selected by the Management Board shall be invited to make a statement before the relevant committee of the European Parliament and to answer Members’ questions.

article-36-para-5.title: Article 36(5)
article-36-para-5.excerpt: The term of office of the Executive Director shall be five years. By the end of that period, the Commission shall carry out an assessment of the performance of the Executive Director and ENISA’s future tasks and challenges.

article-36-para-6.title: Article 36(6)
article-36-para-6.excerpt: The Management Board shall reach decisions on appointment, extension of the term of office or removal from office of the Executive Director in accordance with Article 18(2).

article-36-para-7.title: Article 36(7)
article-36-para-7.excerpt: The Management Board, acting on a proposal from the Commission which takes into account the assessment referred to in paragraph 5, may extend the term of office of the Executive Director once by five years.

article-36-para-8.title: Article 36(8)
article-36-para-8.excerpt: The Management Board shall inform the European Parliament about its intention to extend the Executive Director’s term of office. Within three months before any such extension, the Executive Director, if invited, shall make a statement before the relevant committee of the European Parliament and...

article-36-para-9.title: Article 36(9)
article-36-para-9.excerpt: An Executive Director whose term of office has been extended shall not participate in another selection procedure for the same post.

article-36-para-10.title: Article 36(10)
article-36-para-10.excerpt: The Executive Director may be removed from office only by decision of the Management Board acting on a proposal from the Commission.

article-37-para-1.title: Article 37(1)
article-37-para-1.excerpt: ENISA may make use of seconded national experts or other staff not employed by ENISA. The Staff Regulations of Officials and the Conditions of Employment of Other Servants shall not apply to such staff.

article-37-para-2.title: Article 37(2)
article-37-para-2.excerpt: The Management Board shall adopt a decision laying down rules on the secondment of national experts to ENISA.

article-38-para-1.title: Article 38(1)
article-38-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall be a body of the Union and shall have legal personality.

article-38-para-2.title: Article 38(2)
article-38-para-2.excerpt: In each Member State ENISA shall enjoy the most extensive legal capacity accorded to legal persons under national law. It may, in particular, acquire or dispose of movable and immovable property and be a party to legal proceedings.

article-38-para-3.title: Article 38(3)
article-38-para-3.excerpt: ENISA shall be represented by the Executive Director.

article-39-para-1.title: Article 39(1)
article-39-para-1.excerpt: The contractual liability of ENISA shall be governed by the law applicable to the contract in question.

article-39-para-2.title: Article 39(2)
article-39-para-2.excerpt: The Court of Justice of the European Union shall have jurisdiction to give judgment pursuant to any arbitration clause contained in a contract concluded by ENISA.

article-39-para-3.title: Article 39(3)
article-39-para-3.excerpt: In the case of non-contractual liability, ENISA shall make good any damage caused by it or its staff in the performance of their duties, in accordance with the general principles common to the laws of the Member States.

article-39-para-4.title: Article 39(4)
article-39-para-4.excerpt: The Court of Justice of the European Union shall have jurisdiction in any dispute over compensation for damage as referred to in paragraph 3.

article-39-para-5.title: Article 39(5)
article-39-para-5.excerpt: The personal liability of ENISA’s staff towards ENISA shall be governed by the relevant conditions applying to ENISA’s staff.

article-40-para-1.title: Article 40(1)
article-40-para-1.excerpt: Council Regulation No 1 [Council Regulation No 1 determining the languages to be used by the European Economic Community (OJ 17, 6.10.1958, p. 385/58).] shall apply to ENISA. The Member States and the other bodies appointed by the Member States may address ENISA and receive a reply in the official...

article-40-para-2.title: Article 40(2)
article-40-para-2.excerpt: The translation services required for the functioning of ENISA shall be provided by the Translation Centre for the Bodies of the European Union.

article-41-para-1.title: Article 41(1)
article-41-para-1.excerpt: The processing of personal data by ENISA shall be subject to Regulation (EU) 2018/1725.

article-41-para-2.title: Article 41(2)
article-41-para-2.excerpt: The Management Board shall adopt implementing rules as referred to in Article 45(3) of Regulation (EU) 2018/1725. The Management Board may adopt additional measures necessary for the application of Regulation (EU) 2018/1725 by ENISA.

article-42-para-1.title: Article 42(1)
article-42-para-1.excerpt: To the extent necessary in order to achieve the objectives set out in this Regulation, ENISA may cooperate with the competent authorities of third countries or with international organisations or both. To that end, ENISA may establish working arrangements with the authorities of third countries and...

article-42-para-2.title: Article 42(2)
article-42-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall be open to the participation of third countries that have concluded agreements with the Union to that effect. Under the relevant provisions of such agreements, working arrangements shall be established specifying in particular the nature, extent and manner in which those third countries...

article-42-para-3.title: Article 42(3)
article-42-para-3.excerpt: The Management Board shall adopt a strategy for relations with third countries and international organisations concerning matters for which ENISA is competent. The Commission shall ensure that ENISA operates within its mandate and the existing institutional framework by concluding appropriate...

article-44-para-1.title: Article 44(1)
article-44-para-1.excerpt: The necessary arrangements concerning the accommodation to be provided for ENISA in the host Member State and the facilities to be made available by that Member State together with the specific rules applicable in the host Member State to the Executive Director, members of the Management Board,...

article-44-para-2.title: Article 44(2)
article-44-para-2.excerpt: ENISA’s host Member State shall provide the best possible conditions for ensuring the proper functioning of ENISA, taking into account the accessibility of the location, the existence of adequate education facilities for the children of staff members, appropriate access to the labour market, social...

annex-para-1.title: Annex Para 1
annex-para-1.excerpt: A conformity assessment body shall be established under national law and shall have legal personality.

annex-para-2.title: Annex Para 2
annex-para-2.excerpt: A conformity assessment body shall be a third-party body that is independent of the organisation or the ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes that it assesses.

annex-para-3.title: Annex Para 3
annex-para-3.excerpt: A body that belongs to a business association or professional federation representing undertakings involved in the design, manufacturing, provision, assembly, use or maintenance of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes which it assesses may be considered to be a conformity assessment body,...

annex-para-4.title: Annex Para 4
annex-para-4.excerpt: The conformity assessment bodies, their top-level management and the persons responsible for carrying out the conformity assessment tasks shall not be the designer, manufacturer, supplier, installer, purchaser, owner, user or maintainer of the ICT product, ICT service or ICT process which is...

annex-para-5.title: Annex Para 5
annex-para-5.excerpt: The conformity assessment bodies, their top-level management and the persons responsible for carrying out the conformity assessment tasks shall not be directly involved in the design, manufacture or construction, the marketing, installation, use or maintenance of the ICT products, ICT services or...

annex-para-6.title: Annex Para 6
annex-para-6.excerpt: If a conformity assessment body is owned or operated by a public entity or institution, the independence and absence of any conflict of interest shall be ensured between the national cybersecurity certification authority and the conformity assessment body, and shall be documented.

annex-para-7.title: Annex Para 7
annex-para-7.excerpt: Conformity assessment bodies shall ensure that the activities of their subsidiaries and subcontractors do not affect the confidentiality, objectivity or impartiality of their conformity assessment activities.

annex-para-8.title: Annex Para 8
annex-para-8.excerpt: Conformity assessment bodies and their staff shall carry out conformity assessment activities with the highest degree of professional integrity and the requisite technical competence in the specific field, and shall be free from all pressures and inducements which might influence their judgement or...

annex-para-9.title: Annex Para 9
annex-para-9.excerpt: A conformity assessment body shall be capable of carrying out all the conformity assessment tasks assigned to it under this Regulation, regardless of whether those tasks are carried out by the conformity assessment body itself or on its behalf and under its responsibility. Any subcontracting to, or...

annex-para-10.title: Annex Para 10
annex-para-10.excerpt: At all times and for each conformity assessment procedure and each type, category or sub-category of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes, a conformity assessment body shall have at its disposal the necessary:

annex-para-10-point-a.title: Annex Para 10 Point A
annex-para-10-point-a.excerpt: (a) staff with technical knowledge and sufficient and appropriate experience to perform the conformity assessment tasks;

annex-para-10-point-b.title: Annex Para 10 Point B
annex-para-10-point-b.excerpt: (b) descriptions of procedures in accordance with which conformity assessment is to be carried out, to ensure the transparency of those procedures and the possibility of reproducing them. It shall have in place appropriate policies and procedures that distinguish between tasks that it carries out...

annex-para-10-point-c.title: Annex Para 10 Point C
annex-para-10-point-c.excerpt: (c) procedures for the performance of activities which take due account of the size of an undertaking, the sector in which it operates, its structure, the degree of complexity of the technology of the ICT product, ICT service or ICT process in question and the mass or serial nature of the...

annex-para-11.title: Annex Para 11
annex-para-11.excerpt: A conformity assessment body shall have the means necessary to perform the technical and administrative tasks connected with the conformity assessment activities in an appropriate manner, and shall have access to all necessary equipment and facilities.

annex-para-12.title: Annex Para 12
annex-para-12.excerpt: The persons responsible for carrying out conformity assessment activities shall have the following:

annex-para-12-point-a.title: Annex Para 12 Point A
annex-para-12-point-a.excerpt: (a) sound technical and vocational training covering all conformity assessment activities;

annex-para-12-point-b.title: Annex Para 12 Point B
annex-para-12-point-b.excerpt: (b) satisfactory knowledge of the requirements of the conformity assessments they carry out and adequate authority to carry out those assessments;

annex-para-12-point-c.title: Annex Para 12 Point C
annex-para-12-point-c.excerpt: (c) appropriate knowledge and understanding of the applicable requirements and testing standards;

annex-para-12-point-d.title: Annex Para 12 Point D
annex-para-12-point-d.excerpt: (d) the ability to draw up certificates, records and reports demonstrating that conformity assessments have been carried out.

annex-para-13.title: Annex Para 13
annex-para-13.excerpt: The impartiality of the conformity assessment bodies, of their top-level management, of the persons responsible for carrying out conformity assessment activities, and of any subcontractors shall be guaranteed.

annex-para-14.title: Annex Para 14
annex-para-14.excerpt: The remuneration of the top-level management and of the persons responsible for carrying out conformity assessment activities shall not depend on the number of conformity assessments carried out or on the results of those assessments.

annex-para-15.title: Annex Para 15
annex-para-15.excerpt: Conformity assessment bodies shall take out liability insurance unless liability is assumed by the Member State in accordance with its national law, or the Member State itself is directly responsible for the conformity assessment.

annex-para-16.title: Annex Para 16
annex-para-16.excerpt: The conformity assessment body and its staff, its committees, its subsidiaries, its subcontractors, and any associated body or the staff of external bodies of a conformity assessment body shall maintain confidentiality and observe professional secrecy with regard to all information obtained in...

annex-para-17.title: Annex Para 17
annex-para-17.excerpt: With the exception of point 16, the requirements of this Annex shall not preclude exchanges of technical information and regulatory guidance between a conformity assessment body and a person who applies for certification or who is considering whether to apply for certification.

annex-para-18.title: Annex Para 18
annex-para-18.excerpt: Conformity assessment bodies shall operate in accordance with a set of consistent, fair and reasonable terms and conditions, taking into account the interests of SMEs in relation to fees.

annex-para-19.title: Annex Para 19
annex-para-19.excerpt: Conformity assessment bodies shall meet the requirements of the relevant standard that is harmonised under Regulation (EC) No 765/2008 for the accreditation of conformity assessment bodies performing certification of ICT products, ICT services or ICT processes.

annex-para-20.title: Annex Para 20
annex-para-20.excerpt: Conformity assessment bodies shall ensure that testing laboratories used for conformity assessment purposes meet the requirements of the relevant standard that is harmonised under Regulation (EC) No 765/2008 for the accreditation of laboratories performing testing.

preamble.title: Preamble
preamble.excerpt: THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION,

recitals.title: Recitals
recitals.excerpt: (1) Network and information systems and electronic communications networks and services play a vital role in society and have become the backbone of economic growth. Information and communications technology (ICT) underpins the complex systems which support everyday societal activities, keep our...

article-1.title: Article 1
article-1.excerpt: The framework referred to in point (b) of the first subparagraph applies without prejudice to specific provisions in other Union legal acts regarding voluntary or mandatory certification.

article-2.title: Article 2
