article-9-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) the cyber crisis management procedures, including their integration into the general national crisis management framework and information exchange channels;

article-9-para-4-point-d.title: Article 9(4)(d)
article-9-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) national preparedness measures, including exercises and training activities;

article-9-para-4-point-e.title: Article 9(4)(e)
article-9-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) the relevant public and private stakeholders and infrastructure involved;

article-9-para-4-point-f.title: Article 9(4)(f)
article-9-para-4-point-f.excerpt: (f) national procedures and arrangements between relevant national authorities and bodies to ensure the Member State ’s effective participation in and support of the coordinated management of large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises at Union level.

article-9-para-5.title: Article 9(5)
article-9-para-5.excerpt: Within three months of the designation or establishment of the cyber crisis management authority referred to in paragraph 1, each Member State shall notify the Commission of the identity of its authority and of any subsequent changes thereto. Member States shall submit to the Commission and to the...

article-10-para-1.title: Article 10(1)
article-10-para-1.excerpt: Each Member State shall designate or establish one or more CSIRTs. The CSIRTs may be designated or established within a competent authority. The CSIRTs shall comply with the requirements set out in Article 11(1), shall cover at least the sectors, subsectors and types of entity referred to in...

article-10-para-2.title: Article 10(2)
article-10-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that each CSIRT has adequate resources to carry out effectively its tasks as set out in Article 11(3).

article-10-para-3.title: Article 10(3)
article-10-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that each CSIRT has at its disposal an appropriate, secure, and resilient communication and information infrastructure through which to exchange information with essential and important entities and other relevant stakeholders. To that end, Member States shall ensure that...

article-10-para-4.title: Article 10(4)
article-10-para-4.excerpt: The CSIRTs shall cooperate and, where appropriate, exchange relevant information in accordance with Article 29 with sectoral or cross-sectoral communities of essential and important entities.

article-10-para-5.title: Article 10(5)
article-10-para-5.excerpt: The CSIRTs shall participate in peer reviews organised in accordance with Article 19.

article-10-para-6.title: Article 10(6)
article-10-para-6.excerpt: Member States shall ensure the effective, efficient and secure cooperation of their CSIRTs in the CSIRTs network.

article-10-para-7.title: Article 10(7)
article-10-para-7.excerpt: The CSIRTs may establish cooperation relationships with third countries ’ national computer security incident response teams. As part of such cooperation relationships, Member States shall facilitate effective, efficient and secure information exchange with those third countries ’ national computer...

article-10-para-8.title: Article 10(8)
article-10-para-8.excerpt: The CSIRTs may cooperate with third countries ’ national computer security incident response teams or equivalent third-country bodies, in particular for the purpose of providing them with cybersecurity assistance.

article-10-para-9.title: Article 10(9)
article-10-para-9.excerpt: Each Member State shall notify the Commission without undue delay of the identity of the CSIRT referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article and the CSIRT designated as coordinator pursuant to Article 12(1), of their respective tasks in relation to essential and important entities, and of any...

article-10-para-10.title: Article 10(10)
article-10-para-10.excerpt: Member States may request the assistance of ENISA in developing their CSIRTs.

article-11-para-1.title: Article 11(1)
article-11-para-1.excerpt: The CSIRTs shall comply with the following requirements: (a) the CSIRTs shall ensure a high level of availability of their communication channels by avoiding single points of failure, and shall have several means for being contacted and for contacting others at all times; they shall clearly specify...

article-11-para-1-point-b.title: Article 11(1)(b)
article-11-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) the CSIRTs’ premises and the supporting information systems shall be located at secure sites;

article-11-para-1-point-c.title: Article 11(1)(c)
article-11-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) the CSIRTs shall be equipped with an appropriate system for managing and routing requests, in particular to facilitate effective and efficient handovers;

article-11-para-1-point-d.title: Article 11(1)(d)
article-11-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) the CSIRTs shall ensure the confidentiality and trustworthiness of their operations;

article-11-para-1-point-e.title: Article 11(1)(e)
article-11-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) the CSIRTs shall be adequately staffed to ensure availability of their services at all times and they shall ensure that their staff is trained appropriately;

article-11-para-1-point-f.title: Article 11(1)(f)
article-11-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) the CSIRTs shall be equipped with redundant systems and backup working space to ensure continuity of their services.

article-11-para-2.title: Article 11(2)
article-11-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that their CSIRTs jointly have the technical capabilities necessary to carry out the tasks referred to in paragraph 3. Member States shall ensure that sufficient resources are allocated to their CSIRTs to ensure adequate staffing levels for the purpose of enabling the...

article-11-para-3.title: Article 11(3)
article-11-para-3.excerpt: The CSIRTs shall have the following tasks: (a) monitoring and analysing cyber threats, vulnerabilities and incidents at national level and, upon request, providing assistance to essential and important entities concerned regarding real-time or near real-time monitoring of their network and...

article-11-para-3-point-b.title: Article 11(3)(b)
article-11-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) providing early warnings, alerts, announcements and dissemination of information to essential and important entities concerned as well as to the competent authorities and other relevant stakeholders on cyber threats, vulnerabilities and incidents, if possible in near real-time;

article-11-para-3-point-c.title: Article 11(3)(c)
article-11-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) responding to incidents and providing assistance to the essential and important entities concerned, where applicable;

article-11-para-3-point-d.title: Article 11(3)(d)
article-11-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) collecting and analysing forensic data and providing dynamic risk and incident analysis and situational awareness regarding cybersecurity;

article-11-para-3-point-e.title: Article 11(3)(e)
article-11-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) providing, upon the request of an essential or important entity, a proactive scanning of the network and information systems of the entity concerned to detect vulnerabilities with a potential significant impact;

article-11-para-3-point-f.title: Article 11(3)(f)
article-11-para-3-point-f.excerpt: (f) participating in the CSIRTs network and providing mutual assistance in accordance with their capacities and competencies to other members of the CSIRTs network upon their request;

article-11-para-3-point-g.title: Article 11(3)(g)
article-11-para-3-point-g.excerpt: (g) where applicable, acting as a coordinator for the purposes of the coordinated vulnerability disclosure under Article 12(1);

article-11-para-3-point-h.title: Article 11(3)(h)
article-11-para-3-point-h.excerpt: (h) contributing to the deployment of secure information-sharing tools pursuant to Article 10(3).

article-11-para-4.title: Article 11(4)
article-11-para-4.excerpt: The CSIRTs shall establish cooperation relationships with relevant stakeholders in the private sector, with a view to achieving the objectives of this Directive.

article-11-para-5.title: Article 11(5)
article-11-para-5.excerpt: In order to facilitate cooperation referred to in paragraph 4, the CSIRTs shall promote the adoption and use of common or standardised practices, classification schemes and taxonomies in relation to: (a) incident -handling procedures;

article-12-para-1.title: Article 12(1)
article-12-para-1.excerpt: Each Member State shall designate one of its CSIRTs as a coordinator for the purposes of coordinated vulnerability disclosure. The CSIRT designated as coordinator shall act as a trusted intermediary, facilitating, where necessary, the interaction between the natural or legal person reporting a...

article-12-para-1-point-b.title: Article 12(1)(b)
article-12-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) assisting the natural or legal persons reporting a vulnerability; and

article-12-para-1-point-c.title: Article 12(1)(c)
article-12-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) negotiating disclosure timelines and managing vulnerabilities that affect multiple entities.

article-12-para-2.title: Article 12(2)
article-12-para-2.excerpt: ENISA shall develop and maintain, after consulting the Cooperation Group, a European vulnerability database. To that end, ENISA shall establish and maintain the appropriate information systems, policies and procedures, and shall adopt the necessary technical and organisational measures to ensure...

article-12-para-2-point-b.title: Article 12(2)(b)
article-12-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the affected ICT products or ICT services and the severity of the vulnerability in terms of the circumstances under which it may be exploited;

article-12-para-2-point-c.title: Article 12(2)(c)
article-12-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the availability of related patches and, in the absence of available patches, guidance provided by the competent authorities or the CSIRTs addressed to users of vulnerable ICT products and ICT services as to how the risks resulting from disclosed vulnerabilities can be mitigated.

article-13-para-1.title: Article 13(1)
article-13-para-1.excerpt: Where they are separate, the competent authorities, the single point of contact and the CSIRTs of the same Member State shall cooperate with each other with regard to the fulfilment of the obligations laid down in this Directive.

article-13-para-2.title: Article 13(2)
article-13-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that their CSIRTs or, where applicable, their competent authorities, receive notifications of significant incidents pursuant to Article 23, and incidents, cyber threats and near misses pursuant to Article 30.

article-13-para-3.title: Article 13(3)
article-13-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that their CSIRTs or, where applicable, their competent authorities inform their single points of contact of notifications of incidents, cyber threats and near misses submitted pursuant to this Directive.

article-13-para-4.title: Article 13(4)
article-13-para-4.excerpt: In order to ensure that the tasks and obligations of the competent authorities, the single points of contact and the CSIRTs are carried out effectively, Member States shall, to the extent possible, ensure appropriate cooperation between those bodies and law enforcement authorities, data protection...

article-13-para-5.title: Article 13(5)
article-13-para-5.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that their competent authorities under this Directive and their competent authorities under Directive (EU) 2022/2557 cooperate and exchange information on a regular basis with regard to the identification of critical entities, on risks, cyber threats, and incidents as...

article-13-para-6.title: Article 13(6)
article-13-para-6.excerpt: Member States shall simplify the reporting through technical means for notifications referred to in Articles 23 and 30.

article-14-para-1.title: Article 14(1)
article-14-para-1.excerpt: In order to support and facilitate strategic cooperation and the exchange of information among Member States, as well as to strengthen trust and confidence, a Cooperation Group is established.

article-14-para-2.title: Article 14(2)
article-14-para-2.excerpt: The Cooperation Group shall carry out its tasks on the basis of biennial work programmes referred to in paragraph 7.

article-14-para-3.title: Article 14(3)
article-14-para-3.excerpt: The Cooperation Group shall be composed of representatives of Member States, the Commission and ENISA. The European External Action Service shall participate in the activities of the Cooperation Group as an observer. The European Supervisory Authorities (ESAs) and the competent authorities under...

article-14-para-4.title: Article 14(4)
article-14-para-4.excerpt: The Cooperation Group shall have the following tasks: (a) to provide guidance to the competent authorities in relation to the transposition and implementation of this Directive;

article-14-para-4-point-b.title: Article 14(4)(b)
article-14-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) to provide guidance to the competent authorities in relation to the development and implementation of policies on coordinated vulnerability disclosure, as referred to in Article 7(2), point (c);

article-14-para-4-point-c.title: Article 14(4)(c)
article-14-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) to exchange best practices and information in relation to the implementation of this Directive, including in relation to cyber threats, incidents, vulnerabilities, near misses, awareness-raising initiatives, training, exercises and skills, capacity building, standards and technical...

article-14-para-4-point-d.title: Article 14(4)(d)
article-14-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) to exchange advice and cooperate with the Commission on emerging cybersecurity policy initiatives and the overall consistency of sector-specific cybersecurity requirements;

article-14-para-4-point-e.title: Article 14(4)(e)
article-14-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) to exchange advice and cooperate with the Commission on draft delegated or implementing acts adopted pursuant to this Directive;

article-14-para-4-point-f.title: Article 14(4)(f)
article-14-para-4-point-f.excerpt: (f) to exchange best practices and information with relevant Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies;

article-14-para-4-point-g.title: Article 14(4)(g)
article-14-para-4-point-g.excerpt: (g) to exchange views on the implementation of sector-specific Union legal acts that contain provisions on cybersecurity;

article-14-para-4-point-h.title: Article 14(4)(h)
article-14-para-4-point-h.excerpt: (h) where relevant, to discuss reports on the peer review referred to in Article 19(9) and draw up conclusions and recommendations;

article-14-para-4-point-i.title: Article 14(4)(i)
article-14-para-4-point-i.excerpt: (i) to carry out coordinated security risk assessments of critical supply chains in accordance with Article 22(1);

article-14-para-4-point-j.title: Article 14(4)(j)
article-14-para-4-point-j.excerpt: (j) to discuss cases of mutual assistance, including experiences and results from cross-border joint supervisory actions as referred to in Article 37;

article-14-para-4-point-k.title: Article 14(4)(k)
article-14-para-4-point-k.excerpt: (k) upon the request of one or more Member States concerned, to discuss specific requests for mutual assistance as referred to in Article 37;

article-14-para-4-point-l.title: Article 14(4)(l)
article-14-para-4-point-l.excerpt: (l) to provide strategic guidance to the CSIRTs network and EU-CyCLONe on specific emerging issues;

article-14-para-4-point-m.title: Article 14(4)(m)
article-14-para-4-point-m.excerpt: (m) to exchange views on the policy on follow-up actions following large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises on the basis of lessons learned of the CSIRTs network and EU-CyCLONe;

article-14-para-4-point-n.title: Article 14(4)(n)
article-14-para-4-point-n.excerpt: (n) to contribute to cybersecurity capabilities across the Union by facilitating the exchange of national officials through a capacity building programme involving staff from the competent authorities or the CSIRTs;

article-14-para-4-point-o.title: Article 14(4)(o)
article-14-para-4-point-o.excerpt: (o) to organise regular joint meetings with relevant private stakeholders from across the Union to discuss activities carried out by the Cooperation Group and gather input on emerging policy challenges;

article-14-para-4-point-p.title: Article 14(4)(p)
article-14-para-4-point-p.excerpt: (p) to discuss the work undertaken in relation to cybersecurity exercises, including the work done by ENISA;

article-14-para-4-point-q.title: Article 14(4)(q)
article-14-para-4-point-q.excerpt: (q) to establish the methodology and organisational aspects of the peer reviews referred to in Article 19(1), as well as to lay down the self-assessment methodology for Member States in accordance with Article 19(5), with the assistance of the Commission and ENISA, and, in cooperation with the...

article-14-para-4-point-r.title: Article 14(4)(r)
article-14-para-4-point-r.excerpt: (r) to prepare reports for the purpose of the review referred to in Article 40 on the experience gained at a strategic level and from peer reviews;

article-14-para-4-point-s.title: Article 14(4)(s)
article-14-para-4-point-s.excerpt: (s) to discuss and carry out on a regular basis an assessment of the state of play of cyber threats or incidents, such as ransomware.

article-14-para-5.title: Article 14(5)
article-14-para-5.excerpt: Member States shall ensure effective, efficient and secure cooperation of their representatives in the Cooperation Group.

article-14-para-6.title: Article 14(6)
article-14-para-6.excerpt: The Cooperation Group may request from the CSIRTs network a technical report on selected topics.

article-14-para-7.title: Article 14(7)
article-14-para-7.excerpt: By 1 February 2024 and every two years thereafter, the Cooperation Group shall establish a work programme in respect of actions to be undertaken to implement its objectives and tasks.

article-14-para-8.title: Article 14(8)
article-14-para-8.excerpt: The Commission may adopt implementing acts laying down procedural arrangements necessary for the functioning of the Cooperation Group.

article-14-para-9.title: Article 14(9)
article-14-para-9.excerpt: The Cooperation Group shall meet on a regular basis and in any event at least once a year with the Critical Entities Resilience Group established under Directive (EU) 2022/2557 to promote and facilitate strategic cooperation and the exchange of information.

article-15-para-1.title: Article 15(1)
article-15-para-1.excerpt: In order to contribute to the development of confidence and trust and to promote swift and effective operational cooperation among Member States, a network of national CSIRTs is established.

article-15-para-2.title: Article 15(2)
article-15-para-2.excerpt: The CSIRTs network shall be composed of representatives of the CSIRTs designated or established pursuant to Article 10 and the computer emergency response team for the Union’s institutions, bodies and agencies (CERT-EU). The Commission shall participate in the CSIRTs network as an observer. ENISA...

article-15-para-3.title: Article 15(3)
article-15-para-3.excerpt: The CSIRTs network shall have the following tasks: (a) to exchange information about the CSIRTs’ capabilities;

article-15-para-3-point-b.title: Article 15(3)(b)
article-15-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) to facilitate the sharing, transfer and exchange of technology and relevant measures, policies, tools, processes, best practices and frameworks among the CSIRTs;

article-15-para-3-point-c.title: Article 15(3)(c)
article-15-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) to exchange relevant information about incidents, near misses, cyber threats, risks and vulnerabilities;

article-15-para-3-point-d.title: Article 15(3)(d)
article-15-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) to exchange information with regard to cybersecurity publications and recommendations;

article-15-para-3-point-e.title: Article 15(3)(e)
article-15-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) to ensure interoperability with regard to information-sharing specifications and protocols;

article-15-para-3-point-f.title: Article 15(3)(f)
article-15-para-3-point-f.excerpt: (f) at the request of a member of the CSIRTs network potentially affected by an incident, to exchange and discuss information in relation to that incident and associated cyber threats, risks and vulnerabilities;

article-15-para-3-point-g.title: Article 15(3)(g)
article-15-para-3-point-g.excerpt: (g) at the request of a member of the CSIRTs network, to discuss and, where possible, implement a coordinated response to an incident that has been identified within the jurisdiction of that Member State;

article-15-para-3-point-h.title: Article 15(3)(h)
article-15-para-3-point-h.excerpt: (h) to provide Member States with assistance in addressing cross-border incidents pursuant to this Directive;

article-15-para-3-point-i.title: Article 15(3)(i)
article-15-para-3-point-i.excerpt: (i) to cooperate, exchange best practices and provide assistance to the CSIRTs designated as coordinators pursuant to Article 12(1) with regard to the management of the coordinated disclosure of vulnerabilities which could have a significant impact on entities in more than one Member State;

article-15-para-3-point-j.title: Article 15(3)(j)
article-15-para-3-point-j.excerpt: (j) to discuss and identify further forms of operational cooperation, including in relation to: (i) categories of cyber threats and incidents;

article-15-para-3-point-j-subpoint-iv.title: Article 15 Para 3 Point J Subpoint Iv
article-15-para-3-point-j-subpoint-iv.excerpt: (iv) principles and arrangements for coordination in response to cross-border risks and incidents;

article-15-para-3-point-j-subpoint-v.title: Article 15 Para 3 Point J Subpoint V
article-15-para-3-point-j-subpoint-v.excerpt: (v) contribution to the national large-scale cybersecurity incident and crisis response plan referred to in Article 9(4) at the request of a Member State;

article-15-para-3-point-k.title: Article 15(3)(k)
article-15-para-3-point-k.excerpt: (k) to inform the Cooperation Group of its activities and of the further forms of operational cooperation discussed pursuant to point (j), and, where necessary, request guidance in that regard;

article-15-para-3-point-l.title: Article 15(3)(l)
article-15-para-3-point-l.excerpt: (l) to take stock of cybersecurity exercises, including those organised by ENISA;

article-15-para-3-point-m.title: Article 15(3)(m)
article-15-para-3-point-m.excerpt: (m) at the request of an individual CSIRT, to discuss the capabilities and preparedness of that CSIRT;

article-15-para-3-point-n.title: Article 15(3)(n)
article-15-para-3-point-n.excerpt: (n) to cooperate and exchange information with regional and Union-level Security Operations Centres (SOCs) in order to improve common situational awareness on incidents and cyber threats across the Union;

article-15-para-3-point-o.title: Article 15(3)(o)
article-15-para-3-point-o.excerpt: (o) where relevant, to discuss the peer-review reports referred to in Article 19(9);

article-15-para-3-point-p.title: Article 15(3)(p)
article-15-para-3-point-p.excerpt: (p) to provide guidelines in order to facilitate the convergence of operational practices with regard to the application of the provisions of this Article concerning operational cooperation.

article-15-para-4.title: Article 15(4)
article-15-para-4.excerpt: By 17 January 2025, and every two years thereafter, the CSIRTs network shall, for the purpose of the review referred to in Article 40, assess the progress made with regard to the operational cooperation and adopt a report. The report shall, in particular, draw up conclusions and recommendations on...

article-15-para-5.title: Article 15(5)
article-15-para-5.excerpt: The CSIRTs network shall adopt its rules of procedure.

article-15-para-6.title: Article 15(6)
article-15-para-6.excerpt: The CSIRTs network and EU-CyCLONe shall agree on procedural arrangements and cooperate on the basis thereof.

article-16-para-1.title: Article 16(1)
article-16-para-1.excerpt: EU-CyCLONe is established to support the coordinated management of large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises at operational level and to ensure the regular exchange of relevant information among Member States and Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies.

article-16-para-2.title: Article 16(2)
article-16-para-2.excerpt: EU-CyCLONe shall be composed of the representatives of Member States ’ cyber crisis management authorities as well as, in cases where a potential or ongoing large-scale cybersecurity incident has or is likely to have a significant impact on services and activities falling within the scope of this...

article-16-para-3.title: Article 16(3)
article-16-para-3.excerpt: EU-CyCLONe shall have the following tasks: (a) to increase the level of preparedness of the management of large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises;

article-16-para-3-point-b.title: Article 16(3)(b)
article-16-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) to develop a shared situational awareness for large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises;

article-16-para-3-point-c.title: Article 16(3)(c)
article-16-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) to assess the consequences and impact of relevant large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises and propose possible mitigation measures;

article-16-para-3-point-d.title: Article 16(3)(d)
article-16-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) to coordinate the management of large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises and support decision-making at political level in relation to such incidents and crises;

article-16-para-3-point-e.title: Article 16(3)(e)
article-16-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) to discuss, upon the request of a Member State concerned, national large-scale cybersecurity incident and crisis response plans referred to in Article 9(4).

article-16-para-5.title: Article 16(5)
article-16-para-5.excerpt: EU-CyCLONe shall report on a regular basis to the Cooperation Group on the management of large-scale cybersecurity incidents and crises, as well as trends, focusing in particular on their impact on essential and important entities.

article-16-para-6.title: Article 16(6)
article-16-para-6.excerpt: EU-CyCLONe shall cooperate with the CSIRTs network on the basis of agreed procedural arrangements provided for in Article 15(6).

article-16-para-7.title: Article 16(7)
article-16-para-7.excerpt: By 17 July 2024 and every 18 months thereafter, EU-CyCLONe shall submit to the European Parliament and to the Council a report assessing its work.

article-18-para-1.title: Article 18(1)
article-18-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall adopt, in cooperation with the Commission and the Cooperation Group, a biennial report on the state of cybersecurity in the Union and shall submit and present that report to the European Parliament. The report shall, inter alia, be made available in machine-readable data and include the...

article-18-para-1-point-b.title: Article 18(1)(b)
article-18-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) an assessment of the development of cybersecurity capabilities in the public and private sectors across the Union;

article-18-para-1-point-c.title: Article 18(1)(c)
article-18-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) an assessment of the general level of cybersecurity awareness and cyber hygiene among citizens and entities, including small and medium-sized enterprises;

article-18-para-1-point-d.title: Article 18(1)(d)
article-18-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) an aggregated assessment of the outcome of the peer reviews referred to in Article 19;

article-18-para-1-point-e.title: Article 18(1)(e)
article-18-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) an aggregated assessment of the level of maturity of cybersecurity capabilities and resources across the Union, including those at sector level, as well as of the extent to which the Member States ’ national cybersecurity strategies are aligned.

article-18-para-2.title: Article 18(2)
article-18-para-2.excerpt: The report shall include particular policy recommendations, with a view to addressing shortcomings and increasing the level of cybersecurity across the Union, and a summary of the findings for the particular period from the EU Cybersecurity Technical Situation Reports on incidents and cyber threats...

article-18-para-3.title: Article 18(3)
article-18-para-3.excerpt: ENISA, in cooperation with the Commission, the Cooperation Group and the CSIRTs network, shall develop the methodology, including the relevant variables, such as quantitative and qualitative indicators, of the aggregated assessment referred to in paragraph 1, point (e).

article-19-para-1.title: Article 19(1)
article-19-para-1.excerpt: (a) the level of implementation of the cybersecurity risk -management measures and reporting obligations laid down in Articles 21 and 23;

article-19-para-2.title: Article 19(2)
article-19-para-2.excerpt: The methodology referred to in paragraph 1 shall include objective, non-discriminatory, fair and transparent criteria on the basis of which the Member States designate cybersecurity experts eligible to carry out the peer reviews. The Commission and ENISA shall participate as observers in the peer...

article-19-para-4.title: Article 19(4)
article-19-para-4.excerpt: Before commencing a peer review as referred to in paragraph 1, Member States shall notify the participating Member States of its scope, including the specific issues identified pursuant to paragraph 3.

article-19-para-5.title: Article 19(5)
article-19-para-5.excerpt: Prior to the commencement of the peer review, Member States may carry out a self-assessment of the reviewed aspects and provide that self-assessment to the designated cybersecurity experts. The Cooperation Group shall, with the assistance of the Commission and ENISA, lay down the methodology for...

article-19-para-6.title: Article 19(6)
article-19-para-6.excerpt: Peer reviews shall entail physical or virtual on-site visits and off-site exchanges of information. In line with the principle of good cooperation, the Member State subject to the peer review shall provide the designated cybersecurity experts with the information necessary for the assessment,...

article-19-para-3.title: Article 19(3)
article-19-para-3.excerpt: Member States may identify specific issues as referred to in paragraph 1, point (f), for the purposes of a peer review.

article-19-para-7.title: Article 19(7)
article-19-para-7.excerpt: Once subject to a peer review, the same aspects reviewed in a Member State shall not be subject to a further peer review in that Member State for two years following the conclusion of the peer review, unless otherwise requested by the Member State or agreed upon after a proposal of the Cooperation...

article-19-para-8.title: Article 19(8)
article-19-para-8.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that any risk of conflict of interest concerning the designated cybersecurity experts is revealed to the other Member States, the Cooperation Group, the Commission and ENISA, before the commencement of the peer review. The Member State subject to the peer review may...

article-19-para-9.title: Article 19(9)
article-19-para-9.excerpt: Cybersecurity experts participating in peer reviews shall draft reports on the findings and conclusions of the peer reviews. Member States subject to a peer review may provide comments on the draft reports concerning them and such comments shall be attached to the reports. The reports shall include...

article-20-para-1.title: Article 20(1)
article-20-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the management bodies of essential and important entities approve the cybersecurity risk -management measures taken by those entities in order to comply with Article 21, oversee its implementation and can be held liable for infringements by the entities of that...

article-20-para-2.title: Article 20(2)
article-20-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the members of the management bodies of essential and important entities are required to follow training, and shall encourage essential and important entities to offer similar training to their employees on a regular basis, in order that they gain sufficient...

article-21-para-1.title: Article 21(1)
article-21-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that essential and important entities take appropriate and proportionate technical, operational and organisational measures to manage the risks posed to the security of network and information systems which those entities use for their operations or for the provision of...

article-21-para-2.title: Article 21(2)
article-21-para-2.excerpt: The measures referred to in paragraph 1 shall be based on an all-hazards approach that aims to protect network and information systems and the physical environment of those systems from incidents, and shall include at least the following: (a) policies on risk analysis and information system...

article-21-para-2-point-c.title: Article 21(2)(c)
article-21-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) business continuity, such as backup management and disaster recovery, and crisis management;

article-21-para-2-point-d.title: Article 21(2)(d)
article-21-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) supply chain security, including security-related aspects concerning the relationships between each entity and its direct suppliers or service providers;

article-21-para-2-point-e.title: Article 21(2)(e)
article-21-para-2-point-e.excerpt: (e) security in network and information systems acquisition, development and maintenance, including vulnerability handling and disclosure;

article-21-para-2-point-f.title: Article 21(2)(f)
article-21-para-2-point-f.excerpt: (f) policies and procedures to assess the effectiveness of cybersecurity risk -management measures;

article-21-para-2-point-g.title: Article 21(2)(g)
article-21-para-2-point-g.excerpt: (g) basic cyber hygiene practices and cybersecurity training;

article-21-para-2-point-h.title: Article 21(2)(h)
article-21-para-2-point-h.excerpt: (h) policies and procedures regarding the use of cryptography and, where appropriate, encryption;

article-21-para-2-point-i.title: Article 21(2)(i)
article-21-para-2-point-i.excerpt: (i) human resources security, access control policies and asset management;

article-21-para-2-point-j.title: Article 21(2)(j)
article-21-para-2-point-j.excerpt: (j) the use of multi-factor authentication or continuous authentication solutions, secured voice, video and text communications and secured emergency communication systems within the entity, where appropriate.

article-21-para-3.title: Article 21(3)
article-21-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that, when considering which measures referred to in paragraph 2, point (d), of this Article are appropriate, entities take into account the vulnerabilities specific to each direct supplier and service provider and the overall quality of products and cybersecurity...

article-21-para-4.title: Article 21(4)
article-21-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that an entity that finds that it does not comply with the measures provided for in paragraph 2 takes, without undue delay, all necessary, appropriate and proportionate corrective measures.

article-21-para-5.title: Article 21(5)
article-21-para-5.excerpt: By 17 October 2024, the Commission shall adopt implementing acts laying down the technical and the methodological requirements of the measures referred to in paragraph 2 with regard to DNS service providers, TLD name registries, cloud computing service providers, data centre service providers,...

article-22-para-1.title: Article 22(1)
article-22-para-1.excerpt: The Cooperation Group, in cooperation with the Commission and ENISA, may carry out coordinated security risk assessments of specific critical ICT services, ICT systems or ICT products supply chains, taking into account technical and, where relevant, non-technical risk factors.

article-22-para-2.title: Article 22(2)
article-22-para-2.excerpt: The Commission, after consulting the Cooperation Group and ENISA, and, where necessary, relevant stakeholders, shall identify the specific critical ICT services, ICT systems or ICT products that may be subject to the coordinated security risk assessment referred to in paragraph 1.

article-23-para-1.title: Article 23(1)
article-23-para-1.excerpt: Each Member State shall ensure that essential and important entities notify, without undue delay, its CSIRT or, where applicable, its competent authority in accordance with paragraph 4 of any incident that has a significant impact on the provision of their services as referred to in paragraph 3...

article-23-para-2.title: Article 23(2)
article-23-para-2.excerpt: Where applicable, Member States shall ensure that essential and important entities communicate, without undue delay, to the recipients of their services that are potentially affected by a significant cyber threat any measures or remedies that those recipients are able to take in response to that...

article-23-para-3.title: Article 23(3)
article-23-para-3.excerpt: An incident shall be considered to be significant if: (a) it has caused or is capable of causing severe operational disruption of the services or financial loss for the entity concerned;

article-23-para-3-point-b.title: Article 23(3)(b)
article-23-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) it has affected or is capable of affecting other natural or legal persons by causing considerable material or non-material damage.

article-23-para-4.title: Article 23(4)
article-23-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that, for the purpose of notification under paragraph 1, the entities concerned submit to the CSIRT or, where applicable, the competent authority: (a) without undue delay and in any event within 24 hours of becoming aware of the significant incident, an early warning,...

article-23-para-4-point-b.title: Article 23(4)(b)
article-23-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) without undue delay and in any event within 72 hours of becoming aware of the significant incident, an incident notification, which, where applicable, shall update the information referred to in point (a) and indicate an initial assessment of the significant incident, including its severity and...

article-23-para-4-point-c.title: Article 23(4)(c)
article-23-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) upon the request of a CSIRT or, where applicable, the competent authority, an intermediate report on relevant status updates;

article-23-para-4-point-d.title: Article 23(4)(d)
article-23-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) a final report not later than one month after the submission of the incident notification under point (b), including the following: (i) a detailed description of the incident, including its severity and impact;

article-23-para-4-point-d-subpoint-ii.title: Article 23 Para 4 Point D Subpoint Ii
article-23-para-4-point-d-subpoint-ii.excerpt: (ii) the type of threat or root cause that is likely to have triggered the incident;

article-23-para-4-point-d-subpoint-iv.title: Article 23 Para 4 Point D Subpoint Iv
article-23-para-4-point-d-subpoint-iv.excerpt: (iv) where applicable, the cross-border impact of the incident;

article-23-para-4-point-e.title: Article 23(4)(e)
article-23-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) in the event of an ongoing incident at the time of the submission of the final report referred to in point (d), Member States shall ensure that entities concerned provide a progress report at that time and a final report within one month of their handling of the incident.

article-23-para-5.title: Article 23(5)
article-23-para-5.excerpt: The CSIRT or the competent authority shall provide, without undue delay and where possible within 24 hours of receiving the early warning referred to in paragraph 4, point (a), a response to the notifying entity, including initial feedback on the significant incident and, upon request of the...

article-23-para-6.title: Article 23(6)
article-23-para-6.excerpt: Where appropriate, and in particular where the significant incident concerns two or more Member States, the CSIRT, the competent authority or the single point of contact shall inform, without undue delay, the other affected Member States and ENISA of the significant incident. Such information shall...

article-23-para-7.title: Article 23(7)
article-23-para-7.excerpt: Where public awareness is necessary to prevent a significant incident or to deal with an ongoing significant incident, or where disclosure of the significant incident is otherwise in the public interest, a Member State ’s CSIRT or, where applicable, its competent authority, and, where appropriate,...

article-23-para-8.title: Article 23(8)
article-23-para-8.excerpt: At the request of the CSIRT or the competent authority, the single point of contact shall forward notifications received pursuant to paragraph 1 to the single points of contact of other affected Member States.

article-23-para-9.title: Article 23(9)
article-23-para-9.excerpt: The single point of contact shall submit to ENISA every three months a summary report, including anonymised and aggregated data on significant incidents, incidents, cyber threats and near misses notified in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article and with Article 30. In order to contribute to...

article-23-para-10.title: Article 23(10)
article-23-para-10.excerpt: The CSIRTs or, where applicable, the competent authorities shall provide to the competent authorities under Directive (EU) 2022/2557 information about significant incidents, incidents, cyber threats and near misses notified in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article and with Article 30 by...

article-23-para-11.title: Article 23(11)
article-23-para-11.excerpt: The Commission may adopt implementing acts further specifying the type of information, the format and the procedure of a notification submitted pursuant to paragraph 1 of this Article and to Article 30 and of a communication submitted pursuant to paragraph 2 of this Article.

article-24-para-1.title: Article 24(1)
article-24-para-1.excerpt: In order to demonstrate compliance with particular requirements of Article 21, Member States may require essential and important entities to use particular ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes, developed by the essential or important entity or procured from third parties, that are certified...

article-24-para-2.title: Article 24(2)
article-24-para-2.excerpt: The Commission is empowered to adopt delegated acts, in accordance with Article 38, to supplement this Directive by specifying which categories of essential and important entities are to be required to use certain certified ICT products, ICT services and ICT processes or obtain a certificate under...

article-24-para-3.title: Article 24(3)
article-24-para-3.excerpt: Where no appropriate European cybersecurity certification scheme for the purposes of paragraph 2 of this Article is available, the Commission may, after consulting the Cooperation Group and the European Cybersecurity Certification Group, request ENISA to prepare a candidate scheme pursuant to...

article-25-para-1.title: Article 25(1)
article-25-para-1.excerpt: In order to promote the convergent implementation of Article 21(1) and (2), Member States shall, without imposing or discriminating in favour of the use of a particular type of technology, encourage the use of European and international standards and technical specifications relevant to the...

article-25-para-2.title: Article 25(2)
article-25-para-2.excerpt: ENISA, in cooperation with Member States, and, where appropriate, after consulting relevant stakeholders, shall draw up advice and guidelines regarding the technical areas to be considered in relation to paragraph 1 as well as regarding already existing standards, including national standards,...

article-26-para-1.title: Article 26(1)
article-26-para-1.excerpt: Entities falling within the scope of this Directive shall be considered to fall under the jurisdiction of the Member State in which they are established, except in the case of: (a) providers of public electronic communications networks or providers of publicly available electronic communications...

article-26-para-1-point-b.title: Article 26(1)(b)
article-26-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) DNS service providers, TLD name registries, entities providing domain name registration services, cloud computing service providers, data centre service providers, content delivery network providers, managed service providers, managed security service providers, as well as providers of online...

article-26-para-1-point-c.title: Article 26(1)(c)
article-26-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) public administration entities, which shall be considered to fall under the jurisdiction of the Member State which established them.

article-26-para-2.title: Article 26(2)
article-26-para-2.excerpt: For the purposes of this Directive, an entity as referred to in paragraph 1, point (b), shall be considered to have its main establishment in the Union in the Member State where the decisions related to the cybersecurity risk -management measures are predominantly taken. If such a Member State...

article-26-para-3.title: Article 26(3)
article-26-para-3.excerpt: If an entity as referred to in paragraph 1, point (b), is not established in the Union, but offers services within the Union, it shall designate a representative in the Union. The representative shall be established in one of those Member States where the services are offered. Such an entity shall...

article-26-para-4.title: Article 26(4)
article-26-para-4.excerpt: The designation of a representative by an entity as referred to in paragraph 1, point (b), shall be without prejudice to legal actions, which could be initiated against the entity itself.

article-26-para-5.title: Article 26(5)
article-26-para-5.excerpt: Member States that have received a request for mutual assistance in relation to an entity as referred to in paragraph 1, point (b), may, within the limits of that request, take appropriate supervisory and enforcement measures in relation to the entity concerned that provides services or which has a...

article-27-para-1.title: Article 27(1)
article-27-para-1.excerpt: ENISA shall create and maintain a registry of DNS service providers, TLD name registries, entities providing domain name registration services, cloud computing service providers, data centre service providers, content delivery network providers, managed service providers, managed security service...

article-27-para-2.title: Article 27(2)
article-27-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall require entities referred to in paragraph 1 to submit the following information to the competent authorities by 17 January 2025: (a) the name of the entity;

article-27-para-2-point-b.title: Article 27(2)(b)
article-27-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the relevant sector, subsector and type of entity referred to in Annex I or II, where applicable;

article-27-para-2-point-c.title: Article 27(2)(c)
article-27-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the address of the entity ’s main establishment and its other legal establishments in the Union or, if not established in the Union, of its representative designated pursuant to Article 26(3);

article-27-para-2-point-d.title: Article 27(2)(d)
article-27-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) up-to-date contact details, including email addresses and telephone numbers of the entity and, where applicable, its representative designated pursuant to Article 26(3);

article-27-para-2-point-e.title: Article 27(2)(e)
article-27-para-2-point-e.excerpt: (e) the Member States where the entity provides services; and

article-27-para-3.title: Article 27(3)
article-27-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the entities referred to in paragraph 1 notify the competent authority about any changes to the information they submitted under paragraph 2 without delay and in any event within three months of the date of the change.

article-27-para-4.title: Article 27(4)
article-27-para-4.excerpt: Upon receipt of the information referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3, except for that referred to in paragraph 2, point (f), the single point of contact of the Member State concerned shall, without undue delay, forward it to ENISA.

article-27-para-5.title: Article 27(5)
article-27-para-5.excerpt: Where applicable, the information referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Article shall be submitted through the national mechanism referred to in Article 3(4), fourth subparagraph.

article-28-para-1.title: Article 28(1)

Member...

article-29-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) enhances the level of cybersecurity, in particular through raising awareness in relation to cyber threats, limiting or impeding the ability of such threats to spread, supporting a range of defensive capabilities, vulnerability remediation and disclosure, threat detection, containment and...

Such exchange shall be implemented through cybersecurity information-sharing arrangements in respect of the...

article-29-para-5.title: Article 29(5)
article-29-para-5.excerpt: ENISA shall provide assistance for the establishment of cybersecurity information-sharing arrangements referred to in paragraph 2 by exchanging best practices and providing guidance.

article-30-para-1.title: Article 30(1)
article-30-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that, in addition to the notification obligation provided for in Article 23, notifications can be submitted to the CSIRTs or, where applicable, the competent authorities, on a voluntary basis, by: (a) essential and important entities with regard to incidents, cyber...

article-30-para-2.title: Article 30(2)
article-30-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall process the notifications referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 23. Member States may prioritise the processing of mandatory notifications over voluntary notifications.

article-31-para-1.title: Article 31(1)
article-31-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that their competent authorities effectively supervise and take the measures necessary to ensure compliance with this Directive.

article-31-para-2.excerpt: Member States may allow their competent authorities to prioritise supervisory tasks. Such prioritisation shall be based on a risk -based approach. article-31-para-3.title: Article 31(3)
article-31-para-3.excerpt: The competent authorities shall work in close cooperation with supervisory authorities under Regulation (EU) 2016/679 when addressing incidents resulting in personal data breaches, without prejudice to the competence and tasks of the supervisory authorities under that Regulation.

article-31-para-4.title: Article 31(4)
article-31-para-4.excerpt: Without prejudice to national legislative and institutional frameworks, Member States shall ensure that, in the supervision of compliance of public administration entities with this Directive and the imposition of enforcement measures with regard to infringements of this Directive, the competent...

article-32-para-1.title: Article 32(1)
article-32-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the supervisory or enforcement measures imposed on essential entities in respect of the obligations laid down in this Directive are effective, proportionate and dissuasive, taking into account the circumstances of each individual case.

article-32-para-2.title: Article 32(2)
article-32-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the competent authorities, when exercising their supervisory tasks in relation to essential entities, have the power to subject those entities at least to: (a) on-site inspections and off-site supervision, including random checks conducted by trained professionals;

article-32-para-2-point-b.title: Article 32(2)(b)
article-32-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) regular and targeted security audits carried out by an independent body or a competent authority;

article-32-para-2-point-c.title: Article 32(2)(c)
article-32-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) ad hoc audits, including where justified on the ground of a significant incident or an infringement of this Directive by the essential entity;

article-32-para-2-point-d.title: Article 32(2)(d)
article-32-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) security scans based on objective, non-discriminatory, fair and transparent risk assessment criteria, where necessary with the cooperation of the entity concerned;

article-32-para-2-point-e.title: Article 32(2)(e)

article-32-para-2-point-f.title: Article 32(2)(f)
article-32-para-2-point-f.excerpt: (f) requests to access data, documents and information necessary to carry out their supervisory tasks;

article-32-para-2-point-g.title: Article 32(2)(g)
article-32-para-2-point-g.excerpt: (g) requests for evidence of implementation of cybersecurity policies, such as the results of security audits carried out by a qualified auditor and the respective underlying evidence.

article-32-para-3.title: Article 32(3)
article-32-para-3.excerpt: When exercising their powers under paragraph 2, point (e), (f) or (g), the competent authorities shall state the purpose of the request and specify the information requested.

article-32-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that their competent authorities, when exercising their enforcement powers in relation to essential entities, have the power at least to: (a) issue warnings about infringements of this Directive by the entities concerned;

article-32-para-4-point-b.title: Article 32(4)(b)
article-32-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) adopt binding instructions, including with regard to measures necessary to prevent or remedy an incident, as well as time-limits for the implementation of such measures and for reporting on their implementation, or an order requiring the entities concerned to remedy the deficiencies identified...

article-32-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) order the entities concerned to cease conduct that infringes this Directive and desist from repeating that conduct;

article-32-para-4-point-d.title: Article 32(4)(d)
article-32-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) order the entities concerned to ensure that their cybersecurity risk -management measures comply with Article 21 or to fulfil the reporting obligations laid down in Article 23, in a specified manner and within a specified period;

article-32-para-4-point-e.title: Article 32(4)(e)
article-32-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) order the entities concerned to inform the natural or legal persons with regard to which they provide services or carry out activities which are potentially affected by a significant cyber threat of the nature of the threat, as well as of any possible protective or remedial measures which can...

article-32-para-4-point-h.title: Article 32(4)(h)

article-32-para-4-point-i.title: Article 32(4)(i)

article-32-para-7.title: Article 32(7)

article-32-para-7-point-a-subpoint-iii.title: Article 32 Para 7 Point A Subpoint Iii

article-32-para-7-point-d.title: Article 32(7)(d)

article-32-para-7-point-e.title: Article 32(7)(e)

article-32-para-7-point-h.title: Article 32(7)(h)
article-32-para-7-point-h.excerpt: (h) the level of cooperation of the natural or legal persons held responsible with the competent authorities.

article-32-para-8.title: Article 32(8)

article-33-para-3.excerpt: When exercising their powers under paragraph 2, point (d), (e) or (f), the competent authorities shall state the purpose of the request and specify the information requested.

article-34-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the administrative fines imposed on essential and important entities pursuant to this Article in respect of infringements of this Directive are effective, proportionate and dissuasive, taking into account the circumstances of each individual case.

article-34-para-2.title: Article 34(2)
article-34-para-2.excerpt: Administrative fines shall be imposed in addition to any of the measures referred to in Article 32(4), points (a) to (h), Article 32(5) and Article 33(4), points (a) to (g).

article-34-para-3.title: Article 34(3)
article-34-para-3.excerpt: When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and deciding on its amount in each individual case, due regard shall be given, as a minimum, to the elements provided for in Article 32(7).

article-34-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that where they infringe Article 21 or 23, essential entities are subject, in accordance with paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Article, to administrative fines of a maximum of at least EUR 10000000 or of a maximum of at least 2 % of the total worldwide annual turnover in the...

article-34-para-6.excerpt: Member States may provide for the power to impose periodic penalty payments in order to compel an essential or important entity to cease an infringement of this Directive in accordance with a prior decision of the competent authority.

article-34-para-7.title: Article 34(7)
article-34-para-7.excerpt: Without prejudice to the powers of the competent authorities pursuant to Articles 32 and 33, each Member State may lay down the rules on whether and to what extent administrative fines may be imposed on public administration entities.

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' provider of person identification data ' means a natural or legal person responsible for issuing and revoking the person identification data and ensuring that the person identification data of a user is cryptographically bound to a wallet unit;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' wallet unit attestation ' means a data object that describes the components of the wallet unit or allows authentication and validation of those components;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and that the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-11.title: Article 2(11)
article-2-para-11.excerpt: (11) ' wallet-relying party ' means a relying party that intends to rely upon wallet units for the provision of public or private services by means of digital interaction;

article-2-para-12.title: Article 2(12)
article-2-para-12.excerpt: (12) ' wallet-relying party access certificate ' means a certificate for electronic seals or signatures authenticating and validating the wallet-relying party issued by a provider of wallet-relying party access certificates;

article-2-para-13.title: Article 2(13)
article-2-para-13.excerpt: (13) ' provider of wallet-relying party access certificates ' means a natural or legal person mandated by a Member State to issue relying party access certificates to wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: Providers of person identification data shall issue person identification data to wallet units in accordance with the electronic identification schemes under which wallet solutions are provided.

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: Providers of person identification data shall ensure that person identification data issued to wallet units contains the information necessary for authentication and validation of the person identification data.

article-3-para-3.title: Article 3(3)
article-3-para-3.excerpt: Providers of person identification data shall ensure that person identification data issued to wallet units comply with the technical specifications set out in the Annex.

article-3-para-4.title: Article 3(4)
article-3-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the person identification data issued to a given wallet user is unique for the Member State.

article-3-para-5.title: Article 3(5)
article-3-para-5.excerpt: Providers of person identification data shall ensure that person identification data that they issue is cryptographically bound to the wallet unit to which it is issued.

article-3-para-6.title: Article 3(6)
article-3-para-6.excerpt: Member States shall make publicly available a list of wallet solutions that are supported by providers of person identification data that is part of electronic identification schemes of that Member State.

article-3-para-7.title: Article 3(7)
article-3-para-7.excerpt: Member States shall enroll wallet users in accordance with the requirements relating to enrolment at assurance level high, as set out in Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502. In the context of the enrolment process, providers of person identification data shall perform identity...

article-3-para-8.title: Article 3(8)
article-3-para-8.excerpt: When issuing person identification data to wallet units, providers of person identification data shall identify themselves to wallet units using their wallet-relying party access certificate or by using another authentication mechanism in accordance with an electronic identity scheme notified at...

article-3-para-9.title: Article 3(9)
article-3-para-9.excerpt: Before issuing person identification data to a wallet unit, providers of person identification data shall authenticate and validate the wallet unit attestation of the wallet unit and verify that the wallet unit belongs to a wallet solution the provider of person identification data accepts or use...

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Electronic attestations of attributes issued to wallet units shall comply with at least one of the standards in the list set out in Annex I of Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: Providers of electronic attestations of attributes shall identify themselves to wallet units using their wallet-relying party access certificate.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: Providers of electronic attestations of attributes shall ensure that electronic attestations of attributes issued to wallet units contain the information necessary for authentication and validation of those electronic attestations of attributes.

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Providers of person identification data issued to a wallet unit shall have written and publicly accessible policies relating to validity status management, including, where applicable, the conditions under which such person identification data can be revoked without delay.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: Only providers of person identification data or electronic attestation of attributes can revoke the person identification data or electronic attestations of attributes issued by them.

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: Where providers of person identification data have revoked person identification data, they shall, through dedicated and secure channels, inform wallet users subject of those person identification data within 24 hours of the revocation and of the reasons for the revocation. This shall be done in a...

article-5-para-4.title: Article 5(4)
article-5-para-4.excerpt: Where providers of person identification data revoke person identification data issued to wallet units, they shall do so in each of the following circumstances: (a) upon the explicit request of the wallet user to whose wallet unit the person identification data or electronic attestation of...

article-5-para-4-point-b.title: Article 5(4)(b)
article-5-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) where the wallet unit attestation to which the person identification data was issued to has been revoked;

article-5-para-4-point-c.title: Article 5(4)(c)
article-5-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) in other situations determined by the providers of person identification data or electronic attestations of attributes in their policies referred to in paragraph 1.

article-5-para-5.title: Article 5(5)
article-5-para-5.excerpt: Providers of person identification data issued to a wallet unit shall ensure that revocations cannot be reverted.

article-5-para-6.title: Article 5(6)
article-5-para-6.excerpt: The revoked person identification data shall remain accessible for as long as required by Union law or national law.

article-5-para-7.title: Article 5(7)
article-5-para-7.excerpt: Where providers of person identification data revoke person identification data issued to wallet units, they shall make publicly available the validity status of person identification data they issue, in a privacy preserving manner, and indicate the location of that information in the person...

article-5-para-8.title: Article 5(8)
article-5-para-8.excerpt: Providers of person identification data shall enable privacy preserving techniques which ensure unlinkability where the electronic attestations of attributes do not require the identification of the user.
