article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' provider of person identification data ' means a natural or legal person responsible for issuing and revoking the person identification data and ensuring that the person identification data of a user is cryptographically bound to a wallet unit;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' wallet-relying party ' means a relying party that intends to rely upon wallet units for the provision of public or private services by means of digital interaction;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' wallet unit attestation ' means a data object that describes the components of the wallet unit or allows authentication and validation of those components;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' embedded disclosure policy ' means a set of rules, embedded in an electronic attestation of attributes by its provider, that indicates the conditions that a wallet-relying party has to meet to access the electronic attestation of attributes;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and that the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-11.title: Article 2(11)
article-2-para-11.excerpt: (11) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-12.title: Article 2(12)
article-2-para-12.excerpt: (12) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-13.title: Article 2(13)
article-2-para-13.excerpt: (13) ' wallet cryptographic operation ' means a cryptographic mechanism necessary in the context of authentication of the wallet user and the issuance or presentation of person identification data or electronic attestations of attributes;

article-2-para-14.title: Article 2(14)
article-2-para-14.excerpt: (14) ' wallet-relying party access certificate ' means a certificate for electronic seals or signatures authenticating and validating the wallet-relying party issued by a provider of wallet-relying party access certificates;

article-2-para-15.title: Article 2(15)
article-2-para-15.excerpt: (15) ' provider of wallet-relying party access certificates ' means a natural or legal person mandated by a Member State to issue relying party access certificates to wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: Wallet units shall not perform any functionality listed in Article 5a(4) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, except wallet user authentication to access the wallet unit, until the wallet unit has successfully authenticated the wallet user.

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: Wallet providers shall, for each wallet unit, sign or seal, at least one wallet unit attestation compliant with the requirements laid down in Article 6. The certificate used to sign or seal the wallet unit attestation shall be issued under a certificate listed in the trusted list referred to in...

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Wallet instances shall use at least one wallet secure cryptographic device to manage critical assets.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure integrity, authenticity and confidentiality of the communication between wallet instances and wallet secure cryptographic applications.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: Where critical assets relate to performing electronic identification at assurance level high, the wallet cryptographic operations or other operations processing critical assets shall be performed in accordance with the requirements for the characteristics and design of electronic identification...

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that wallet secure cryptographic applications: (a) perform wallet cryptographic operations involving critical assets other than those needed for the wallet unit to authenticate the wallet user only in cases where those applications have successfully authenticated...

article-5-para-1-point-b.title: Article 5(1)(b)
article-5-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) where they authenticate wallet users in the context of performing electronic identification at assurance level high; perform authentication of wallet users, in accordance with, the requirements for the characteristics and design of electronic identification means at assurance level high, as set...

article-5-para-1-point-c.title: Article 5(1)(c)
article-5-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) are able to securely generate new cryptographic keys;

article-5-para-1-point-d.title: Article 5(1)(d)
article-5-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) are able to perform secure erasure of critical assets;

article-5-para-1-point-e.title: Article 5(1)(e)
article-5-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) are able to generate a proof of possession of private keys;

article-5-para-1-point-f.title: Article 5(1)(f)
article-5-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) protect the private keys generated by those wallet secure cryptographic applications during the existence of the keys;

article-5-para-1-point-g.title: Article 5(1)(g)
article-5-para-1-point-g.excerpt: (g) comply with the requirements for the characteristics and design of electronic identification means at assurance level high, as set out in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502;

article-5-para-1-point-h.title: Article 5(1)(h)
article-5-para-1-point-h.excerpt: (h) are the only components able to execute wallet cryptographic operations and any other operation with critical assets in the context of performing electronic identification at assurance level high.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: Where wallet providers decide to provide a wallet secure cryptographic application to an embedded secure element these wallet providers shall base their technical solution on the technical specifications listed in Annex I or on other equivalent technical specifications.

article-6-para-1.title: Article 6(1)
article-6-para-1.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that each wallet unit contains wallet unit attestations.

article-6-para-2.title: Article 6(2)
article-6-para-2.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that the wallet unit attestations referred to in paragraph 1 contain public keys and that the corresponding private keys are protected by a wallet secure cryptographic device.

article-6-para-3.title: Article 6(3)
article-6-para-3.excerpt: Wallet providers shall: (a) inform wallet users of their rights and obligations in relation to their wallet unit;

article-6-para-3-point-b.title: Article 6(3)(b)
article-6-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) provide mechanisms, independent of wallet units, for the secure identification and authentication of wallet users;

article-6-para-3-point-c.title: Article 6(3)(c)
article-6-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) ensure wallet users have the right to request revocation of their wallet unit attestations, using the authentication mechanisms referred to in point (b).

article-7-para-1.title: Article 7(1)
article-7-para-1.excerpt: Wallet providers shall be the only entities capable of revoking wallet unit attestations for wallet units that they have provided.

article-7-para-2.title: Article 7(2)
article-7-para-2.excerpt: Wallet providers shall establish a publicly available policy specifying the conditions and the timeframe for the revocation of wallet unit attestations.

article-7-para-3.title: Article 7(3)
article-7-para-3.excerpt: Where wallet providers have revoked wallet unit attestations, they shall inform affected wallet users within 24 hours of the revocation of their wallet units, including the reason for the revocation and the consequences for the wallet user. This information shall be provided in a manner that is...

article-7-para-4.title: Article 7(4)
article-7-para-4.excerpt: Where wallet providers have revoked wallet unit attestations, they shall make publicly available the validity status of the wallet unit attestation in a privacy preserving manner and describe the location of that information in the wallet unit attestation.

article-9-para-1.title: Article 9(1)
article-9-para-1.excerpt: Irrespective of whether or not a transaction is successfully completed, wallet instances shall log all transactions with wallet-relying parties and other wallet units, including electronic signing and sealing.

article-9-para-2.title: Article 9(2)
article-9-para-2.excerpt: The logged information shall at least contain: (a) the time and date of the transaction;

article-9-para-2-point-b.title: Article 9(2)(b)
article-9-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the name, contact details, and the unique identifier of the corresponding wallet-relying party and the Member State in which that wallet-relying party is established, or in case of other wallet units, relevant information from the wallet unit attestation;

article-9-para-2-point-c.title: Article 9(2)(c)
article-9-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the type or types of data requested and presented in the transaction;

article-9-para-2-point-d.title: Article 9(2)(d)
article-9-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) in the case of non-completed transactions, the reason for such non-completion.

article-9-para-3.title: Article 9(3)
article-9-para-3.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure integrity, authenticity and confidentiality of the logged information.

article-9-para-4.title: Article 9(4)
article-9-para-4.excerpt: Wallet instances shall log reports sent by the wallet user to the data protection authorities via their wallet unit.

article-9-para-5.title: Article 9(5)
article-9-para-5.excerpt: The logs referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be accessible to the wallet provider, where it is necessary for the provision of wallet services, on the basis of explicit prior consent by the wallet user.

article-9-para-6.title: Article 9(6)
article-9-para-6.excerpt: The logs referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall remain accessible for as long as they are required by Union law or national law.

article-9-para-7.title: Article 9(7)
article-9-para-7.excerpt: Wallet providers shall enable wallet users to export the logged information referred to in paragraph 2.

article-10-para-1.title: Article 10(1)
article-10-para-1.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that electronic attestations of attributes with common embedded disclosure policies set out in Annex III can be processed by the wallet units that they provide.

article-10-para-2.title: Article 10(2)
article-10-para-2.excerpt: Wallet instances shall be able to process and present such embedded disclosure policies referred to in paragraph 1 in conjunction with data received from the requesting wallet-relying party.

article-10-para-3.title: Article 10(3)
article-10-para-3.excerpt: Wallet instances shall verify whether the wallet-relying party complies with the requirements of the embedded disclosure policy and inform the wallet user of the result.

article-11-para-1.title: Article 11(1)
article-11-para-1.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that wallet users are able to receive, qualified certificates for qualified electronic signatures or seals which are linked to qualified signature or seal creation devices that are either local, external, or remote in relation to the wallet instances.

article-11-para-2.title: Article 11(2)
article-11-para-2.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that wallet solutions are able to securely interface with one of the following types of qualified signature or seal creation devices: local, external, or remotely managed qualified signature or seal creation devices for the purposes of using the qualified certificates...

article-11-para-3.title: Article 11(3)
article-11-para-3.excerpt: Wallet providers shall ensure that wallet users who are natural persons have, at least for non-professional purposes, free-of-charge access to signature creation applications which allow the creation of free-of-charge qualified electronic signatures using the certificates referred to in paragraph 1.

article-12-para-1.title: Article 12(1)
article-12-para-1.excerpt: The signature creation applications used by wallet units may be provided either by wallet providers, by providers of trust services or by wallet-relying parties.

article-12-para-2.title: Article 12(2)
article-12-para-2.excerpt: Signature creation applications shall have the following functions: (a) signing or sealing wallet user -provided data;

article-12-para-2-point-b.title: Article 12(2)(b)
article-12-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) signing or sealing relying party -provided data;

article-12-para-2-point-c.title: Article 12(2)(c)
article-12-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) creating signatures or seals in accordance with at least the mandatory formats referred to in Annex IV;

article-12-para-2-point-d.title: Article 12(2)(d)
article-12-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) informing wallet users about the result of the signature or seal creation process.

article-12-para-3.title: Article 12(3)
article-12-para-3.excerpt: The signature creation applications may either be integrated into or be external to wallet instances. Where signature creation applications rely on remote qualified signature creation devices and where they are integrated into wallet instances, they shall support the application programming...

article-14-para-1.title: Article 14(1)
article-14-para-1.excerpt: Wallet units shall support the generation of pseudonyms for wallet users in compliance with the technical specifications set out in Annex V.

article-14-para-2.title: Article 14(2)
article-14-para-2.excerpt: Wallet units shall support the generation, upon the request of a wallet-relying party, of a pseudonym which is specific and unique to that wallet-relying party and provide this pseudonym to the wallet-relying party, either standalone or in combination with any person identification data or...

annex-i-para-1.excerpt: SAM.01 Secured Applications for Mobile – Requirements for supporting 3rd party Applets on eSIM and eSE via SAM. v1.1 2023, GSMA;

annex-i-para-7.excerpt: GPD_SPE_0 75 Open Mobile API Specification OMAPI API for mobile apps to access secure elements on user devices. v3.3 2018-08, GlobalPlatform.

annex-ii-para-2.excerpt: ' Verifiable Credentials Data Model 1.1', W3C Recommendation, 3 March 2022.

annex-iii-para-1.excerpt: 'No policy' indicating that no policy applies to the electronic attestations of attributes.

annex-iii-para-2.excerpt: 'Authorised relying parties only policy', indicating that wallet users may only disclose electronic attestations of attributes to authenticated relying parties which are explicitly listed in the disclosure policies.

annex-iii-para-3.title: Annex III(3)
annex-iii-para-3.excerpt: 'Specific root of trust' indicating that wallet users should only disclose the specific electronic attestation of attributes to authenticated wallet-relying parties with wallet-relying party access certificates derived from a specific root (or list of specific roots) or intermediate certificate(s).

annex-iv-para-2-point-a.excerpt: (a) XAdES as specified in 'ETSI EN 319 132-1 V1.2.1 (2022-02) Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); XAdES digital signatures; Part 1: Building blocks and XAdES baseline signatures ( XAdES )' for signing of XML format;

annex-iv-para-2-point-b.title: Annex Iv Para 2 Point B
annex-iv-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) JAdES as specified in 'ETSI TS 119 182-1 V1.2.1 (2024-07) Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); JAdES digital signatures; Part 1: Building blocks and JAdES baseline signatures' for signing of JSON format;

annex-iv-para-2-point-c.title: Annex Iv Para 2 Point C
annex-iv-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) CAdES (CMS Advanced Electronic Signature ) as specified in 'ETSI EN 3191 22-1 V1.3.1 (2023-06) Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); CAdES digital signatures; Part 1: Building blocks and CAdES baseline signatures' for the signing of CMS format;

annex-iv-para-2-point-d.title: Annex Iv Para 2 Point D
annex-iv-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) ASiC (Associated Signature Container) as specified in 'ETSI EN 319 162-1 V1.1.1 (2016-04) Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); Associated Signature Containers ( ASiC ); Part 1: Building blocks and ASiC baseline containers and ETSI EN 319 162-2 V1.1.1 (2016-04) Electronic Signatures...

annex-iv-para-3.excerpt: Application programming interface: Cloud Signature Consortium (CSC) specification v2.0 (20 April 2023).

recital-6.title: Recital 6
recital-6.excerpt: (6) For the same objective of establishing information sources that enable the authentication of entities in the European Digital Identity Wallet ecosystem, the Commission should establish an infrastructure to make the information available to the public in a secure, human-readable, clear, and...

recital-7.title: Recital 7
recital-7.excerpt: (7) The European Data Protection Supervisor was consulted in accordance with Article 42(1) of Regulation (EU) 2018/1725, and delivered its opinion on 30 September 2024.

recital-8.title: Recital 8
recital-8.excerpt: (8) The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the Committee referred to in Article 48 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014,

article-1-para-1.title: Article 1(1)
article-1-para-1.excerpt: (1) the electronic registers used by a Member State to publish information on wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State in accordance with Article 5b(5) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 ('registers of wallet-relying parties '), the location of the registers of wallet-relying parties, and...

article-1-para-2.title: Article 1(2)
article-1-para-2.excerpt: (2) the identity of the registered wallet-relying parties;

article-1-para-3.title: Article 1(3)
article-1-para-3.excerpt: (3) the authenticity and validity of wallet units;

article-1-para-5.title: Article 1(5)
article-1-para-5.excerpt: (5) the authenticity of person identification data;

article-1-para-6.title: Article 1(6)
article-1-para-6.excerpt: (6) the identification of the providers of person identification data; to be updated on a regular basis to keep in line with technology and standards developments and with the work carried out on the basis of Recommendation (EU) 2021/946, and in particular the architecture and reference framework.

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' provider of person identification data ' means a natural or legal person responsible for issuing and revoking the person identification data and ensuring that the person identification data of a user is cryptographically bound to a wallet unit;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' wallet-relying party ' means a relying party that intends to rely upon wallet units for the provision of public or private services by means of digital interaction;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' register of wallet-relying parties ' means an electronic register used by a Member State to make information on wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State publicly available as set out in Article 5b(5) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' registrar of wallet-relying parties ' means the body responsible for establishing and maintaining the list of registered wallet-relying parties established in their territory who has been designated by a Member State;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and that the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-11.title: Article 2(11)
article-2-para-11.excerpt: (11) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-12.title: Article 2(12)
article-2-para-12.excerpt: (12) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-13.title: Article 2(13)
article-2-para-13.excerpt: (13) ' provider of wallet-relying party access certificates ' means a natural or legal person mandated by a Member State to issue relying party access certificates to wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State;

article-2-para-14.title: Article 2(14)
article-2-para-14.excerpt: (14) ' wallet-relying party access certificate ' means a certificate for electronic seals or signatures authenticating and validating the wallet-relying party issued by a provider of wallet-relying party access certificates.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall make available to Member States a secure electronic notification system, no later than twelve months after the publication of this Regulation in the Official Journal of the European Union, enabling Member States to notify the information on the bodies and mechanisms referred to...

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: The secure electronic notification system shall comply with the technical requirements laid down in Annex I.

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall submit, through the secure electronic notification system referred to in Article 3(1), at least the information specified in Annex II.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall make the notifications at least in English. Member States shall not be obliged to translate any document supporting the notifications where this would create an unreasonable administrative or financial burden.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: The Commission may request additional information or clarifications from the Member States for the purpose of verifying the completeness and consistency of the notified information.

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall establish, maintain and publish a list compiling the information notified by Member States on registrars of wallet-relying parties and registers of wallet-relying parties as referred to in Annex II section 1.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: The Commission shall establish, maintain and publish a list compiling the information notified by Member States on wallet providers, providers of person identification data and providers of wallet-relying party access certificates, as referred to in Annex II sections 2, 3 and 4.

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: The Commission shall ensure the lists referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Article can be accessed: (a) in both electronically signed or sealed form suitable for automated processing and through a human readable website available in at least English;

article-5-para-3-point-b.title: Article 5(3)(b)
article-5-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) without the need to register or to be authenticated to obtain or read the lists;

article-5-para-3-point-c.title: Article 5(3)(c)
article-5-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) securely by using state of the art transport layer encryption.

article-5-para-4.title: Article 5(4)
article-5-para-4.excerpt: In addition to the publications of the lists referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2, the Commission shall publish: (a) the technical specifications the Commission uses for the structure of the lists;

article-5-para-4-point-b.title: Article 5(4)(b)
article-5-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) the details of the URL where the lists are published;

article-5-para-4-point-c.title: Article 5(4)(c)
article-5-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) the certificates to be used to verify the signature or seal on the lists;

article-5-para-4-point-d.title: Article 5(4)(d)
article-5-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) the details on mechanisms used to validate changes to the location referred to in point (b) or to the certificates referred to in point (c).

annex-ii-para-1.title: Annex II(1)
annex-ii-para-1.excerpt: (1) Member States shall provide the following information to the Commission on providers of wallet-relying party access certificates: (a) the name of the provider of wallet-relying party access certificates;

annex-ii-para-1-point-b.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point B
annex-ii-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) where applicable, a registration number of the provider of wallet-relying party access certificates;

annex-ii-para-1-point-c.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point C
annex-ii-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) the Member State in which the provider of wallet-relying party access certificates is established;

annex-ii-para-1-point-d.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point D
annex-ii-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) the contact email and contact phone number of the provider of wallet-relying party access certificates, for matters related to the access certificates it provides to wallet-relying parties;

annex-ii-para-1-point-e.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point E
annex-ii-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) where applicable, the URL of the webpage of the provider of wallet-relying party access certificates that contains additional information about the provider and the access certificates it provides to wallet-relying parties;

annex-ii-para-1-point-f.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point F
annex-ii-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) the URL of the webpage that contains the policies, terms and conditions that apply to the provision and use of the access certificates it provides to wallet-relying parties;

annex-ii-para-1-point-g.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point G
annex-ii-para-1-point-g.excerpt: (g) one or more certificates compliant with IETF RFC 3647 that can be used to verify the signature or seal created by the provider of wallet-relying party access certificates on the access certificate it provides to wallet-relying parties, with, where applicable, the information required to...

annex-ii-para-1-point-h.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point H
annex-ii-para-1-point-h.excerpt: (h) one or more certificates compliant with IETF RFC 3647 that can be used to verify the signature or seal created by the provider of person identification data on the person identification data it provides, and for which the certified identity data include the name, and where applicable, the...

annex-ii-para-1-point-i.title: Annex Ii Para 1 Point I
annex-ii-para-1-point-i.excerpt: (i) for each wallet solution provided by the wallet provider, the name and the reference number of the wallet solution it provides, as the Commission shall publish this information in the Official Journal of the European Union pursuant to Article 5d of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

annex-ii-para-2.title: Annex II(2)
annex-ii-para-2.excerpt: (2) The information referred to in point (1) shall be provided per provider of wallet-relying party access certificates.

recital-1.excerpt: (1) Pursuant to Article 5c of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, the certification of European Digital Identity Wallets ('wallets') is to be made in accordance with functional, cybersecurity, and data protection requirements to ensure a high level of security and trust in the wallets. Those certification...

recital-2.title: Recital 2
recital-2.excerpt: (2) Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council Regulation 2016/679 and, where relevant, Directive 2002/58/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council Directive 2002/58 apply to the personal data processing activities under this Regulation.

recital-3.title: Recital 3
recital-3.excerpt: (3) The Commission regularly assesses new technologies, practices, standards or technical specifications. To ensure the highest level of harmonisation among Member States for the development and certification of the wallets, the technical specifications set out in this Regulation rely on the work...

recital-4.title: Recital 4

That assurance level has to be reached by the overall wallet solution....

recital-6.title: Recital 6

The scheme owner may be a conformity assessment body, a governmental body or authority, a trade association, a group of conformity assessment...

recital-7.title: Recital 7
recital-7.excerpt: (7) The object of certification should include the software components of the wallet solution, such as the wallet instance. The wallet secure cryptographic application (' WSCA '), the wallet secure cryptographic device (' WSCD ') and the platforms on which these software components are executed,...

recital-8.title: Recital 8
recital-8.excerpt: (8) Fully mobile, secure and user -friendly wallets are supported by the availability of standardised and certified tamper-resistant solutions, such as embedded secure elements, external devices such as smartcards, or embedded SIM platforms in mobile devices. It is important to ensure the timely...

recital-9.title: Recital 9
