article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: Where a public sector body acts as a relying party in the context of an online cross-border service offered by or on behalf of that public sector body, Member States shall ensure that the process set out in paragraph 2 is used to ensure unequivocal identity matching of natural persons.

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: Unequivocal identity matching shall be done by, or on behalf of, the relying party, or a register relied upon by relying parties, or a centralised system, by requesting, as applicable, receiving, and validating the authenticity of the information listed in paragraphs 3 or 4.

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: When reliance is on a wallet, the information to be used for unequivocal identity matching shall be the mandatory person identification data set out in Section 1 of the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2977, together with any optional data that is needed to ensure that the presented...

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: When reliance is on a notified electronic identification scheme, the information to be used for unequivocal identity matching shall be the mandatory attributes of the minimum data set for a natural person set out in Section 1 of the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1501 including, where...

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: When determining whether there is an unequivocal identity match, the relying party, or the party acting on its behalf, shall match the information provided by the user to those the relying party or a party acting on its behalf or a register relied upon by relying parties that has already registered.

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: The outcome of the process described in paragraph 5 shall, to the extent possible, not be affected by differences in transliteration, blank spaces, hyphenation, concatenation, and similar orthographic variations that are required under Union law or national law of the Member State.

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: Where the match is exact for the information referred to in paragraph 2 and relates to only one natural person or the outcome of the process leads to a new registration of the user that is equivalent in its function to a successful identity matching process, the identity matching process shall be...

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: Member States may rely on centralised identity matching systems, operated by a public sector body established in that Member State, to ensure that notified electronic identification means or wallets from another Member State can be matched with existing registrations and records using online...

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: Where Member States enable wallet-relying parties which are not public sector bodies to perform identity matching the mechanisms and procedures laid down in this Regulation shall apply, where applicable.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: The first time a user performs the identity matching process and it is deemed successful pursuant to Article 2(7), the relying party or the party acting on its behalf, or a register relied upon by relying parties or the centralised system shall ensure that the user is informed of the fact that the...

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: Where applicable, the user shall also be informed if he or she: (a) has been registered as a new user;

article-3-para-2-point-b.title: Article 3(2)(b)
article-3-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) has been successfully matched to a single existing user of the relying party or;

article-3-para-2-point-c.title: Article 3(2)(c)
article-3-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) has been successfully matched to a single existing user in a register relied upon by the relying party or the party acting on its behalf;

article-3-para-2-point-d.title: Article 3(2)(d)
article-3-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) can reuse completed identity matching processes in the future by choosing one of the following options including the retention time: storage of an association in a register operated by the relying party or in a register relied upon by the relying party that can be reused in future access...

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Where an identity matching process is deemed unsuccessful pursuant to Article 2(7), the relying party or the party acting on its behalf or the centralised system shall ensure that the user of a notified electronic identification means or of a wallet is informed if: (a) the data made available was...

article-4-para-1-point-b.title: Article 4(1)(b)
article-4-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) other options for identity matching available to the user or other methods for gaining access to the service are available.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: The options or other methods referred to in paragraph 1, point (b) may include: (a) a different notified electronic identification means or a different wallet;

article-4-para-2-point-b.title: Article 4(2)(b)
article-4-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) an update of information already registered with the relying party, the party acting on its behalf or a register relied upon by the relying party or the centralised identity matching system;

article-4-para-2-point-c.title: Article 4(2)(c)
article-4-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) additional information provided by the relying party or a party acting on their behalf for identity matching or the centralised system.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: Where the complementary methods result in a successful and unequivocal match or registration, the outcome shall follow the obligations set out in Article 3.

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: Where the relying party or the centralised system determines either initially or after unsuccessfully performing the complementary identity matching processes that the user has not previously been registered, the relying party or the centralised system may consider this user as a new user and where...

article-4-para-5.title: Article 4(5)
article-4-para-5.excerpt: Where the complementary methods do not result in a successful and unequivocal match, the party performing the identity matching may assess if the user has no prior interaction or interactions with the relying party or a register relied upon by the relying party and therefore shall be considered as...

article-4-para-6.title: Article 4(6)
article-4-para-6.excerpt: Where there is a new user relying parties shall apply the process set out in Article 3. Relying parties may register new users in accordance with national law or administrative practices.

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Where an identity matching process as set out in Article 2 is completed, whether successfully or unsuccessfully, the relying party or the party acting on its behalf or the register relied upon by the relying party shall keep the logs relating to the identity matching process and its outcome,...

article-5-para-1-point-b.title: Article 5(1)(b)
article-5-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) the date and time of the identity matching process;

article-5-para-1-point-c.title: Article 5(1)(c)
article-5-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) any relevant documentation provided as part of the complementary methods referred to in Article 4(1) and (2) necessary for dispute handling;

article-5-para-1-point-d.title: Article 5(1)(d)
article-5-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) where applicable, any identifiers or account numbers used by the relying party, or a register relied upon by relying parties, or the party acting on its behalf, or the centralised identity matching system that relates to the natural person.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: Relying parties or the parties acting on their behalf, shall consider security and privacy by design principles related to the logging of the information included in paragraph 1.

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: Relying parties or the parties acting on their behalf, shall retain the logs for a minimum of 6 months and a maximum of 12 months for security purposes. For other purposes, including enabling the registration and processing of user complaints, the retention time may be extended if required by Union...

preamble.title: Preamble
preamble.excerpt: Having regard to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union,

recitals.title: Recitals
recitals.excerpt: (1) Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 requires that European Digital Identity Wallets ('wallets') and notified electronic identification means are available as an option for authentication to gain access to online cross-border public services provided by Member States. In such cross-border authentication...

article-1.title: Article 1
article-1.excerpt: This Regulation lays down rules for cross-border identity matching of natural persons by public sector bodies or by bodies acting on behalf of a public sector body, to be updated on a regular basis to keep in line with technology and standards developments and with the work carried out on the basis...

article-2.title: Article 2
article-2.excerpt: Where a public sector body acts as a relying party in the context of an online cross-border service offered by or on behalf of that public sector body, Member States shall ensure that the process set out in paragraph 2 is used to ensure unequivocal identity matching of natural persons.

article-3.title: Article 3
article-3.excerpt: Obligations of relying parties where the identity matching process is successful

article-4.title: Article 4
article-4.excerpt: Obligations of relying parties where the identity matching process is not successful

article-5.title: Article 5
article-5.excerpt: Obligations of relying parties following the completion of the identity matching process

article-6.title: Article 6
article-6.excerpt: This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the

recital-1.title: Recital 1
recital-1.excerpt: (1) The European Digital Identity Framework ('framework') set out in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 is a crucial component in the establishment of a secure and interoperable digital identity ecosystem across the Union. With the European Digital Identity Wallets ('wallets') as its cornerstone, the...

recital-2.title: Recital 2
recital-2.excerpt: (2) Regulations (EU) 2016/679 Regulation 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 Regulation 2018/1725 of the European Parliament and of the Council, and, where relevant, Directive 2002/58/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council Directive 2002/58 apply to the personal data processing activities under...

recital-3.title: Recital 3
recital-3.excerpt: (3) The Commission regularly assesses new technologies, practices, standards and technical specifications. To ensure the highest level of harmonisation among Member States for the development and certification of the wallets, the technical specifications set out in this Regulation rely on the work...

recital-4.title: Recital 4
recital-4.excerpt: (4) In the event of a security breach or a compromise of the wallet solutions or of the validation mechanisms referred to in Article 5a(8) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, or of the electronic identification scheme under which the wallet solutions are provided, reactions to such security breaches...

recital-5.title: Recital 5
recital-5.excerpt: (5) To ensure appropriate reactions to a security breach or compromise, Member States should assess whether a security breach or compromise of a wallet solution, of the validation mechanisms referred to in Article 5a(8) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, or of the electronic identification scheme...

recital-6.title: Recital 6
recital-6.excerpt: (6) Due to the impact and inconvenience caused by suspending the use of wallet solutions, Member States will need to evaluate whether the revocation of wallet unit attestations or any other additional measures are necessary to react adequately to the security breach or compromise.

recital-7.title: Recital 7
recital-7.excerpt: (7) To keep wallet users informed about the status of their wallets, they are to be provided with adequate information about security breaches or compromises affecting their wallets. As wallet-relying parties registered in the Union can also be affected by security breaches and compromises,...

recital-8.title: Recital 8
recital-8.excerpt: (8) To enhance transparency and build trust into the digital identity ecosystem, the information about the security breaches or compromises and about their consequences should at least include the information required under this Regulation. Information concerning security breaches or compromises...

recital-9.title: Recital 9
recital-9.excerpt: (9) To enable users to access their wallet units again after a security breach or compromise has been remedied, the Member State that provided the wallet solutions, will need to re-establish the provision and use of that wallet solutions without undue delay. This can be done by re-establishing the...

recital-10.title: Recital 10
recital-10.excerpt: (10) To ensure the withdrawal of wallets where a security breach or compromise has not been remedied within three months of the suspension or where this is justified by the severity of the security breach or compromise, the Member State should ensure that the relevant wallet unit attestations are...

recital-11.title: Recital 11
recital-11.excerpt: (11) The period of three months following the suspension of the provision and the use of a wallet solution, and during which the security breach or compromise having led to that suspension is to be remedied, should provide for a time limit after which the wallet solution is to be withdrawn unless...

recital-12.title: Recital 12
recital-12.excerpt: (12) To reduce the administrative burden for Member States regarding the information to be provided, in accordance with this Regulation, to the Commission and to other Member States, Member States should use existing notification tools such as the Cyber Incident Reporting and Analysis System...

recital-13.title: Recital 13
recital-13.excerpt: (13) The European Data Protection Supervisor was consulted in accordance with Article 42(1) of Regulation (EU) 2018/1725 and delivered its opinion on 31 January 2025.

recital-14.title: Recital 14
recital-14.excerpt: (14) The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the committee established by Article 48 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014,

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' wallet-relying party ' means a relying party that intends to rely upon wallet units for the provision of public or private services by means of digital interaction;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and that the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' wallet unit attestation ' means a data object that describes the components of the wallet unit or allows authentication and validation of those components.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to Directive (EU) 2022/2555 and to Regulations (EU) 2019/881 and (EU) 2024/2847, Member States shall duly consider the criteria set out in the Annex I to this Regulation to assess whether a security breach or compromise of a wallet solution, of the validation mechanisms referred...

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: Where a Member State establishes, on the basis of the assessment laid down in paragraph 1, that a security breach or compromise is affecting the reliability of a wallet solution and suspends the provision and the use of that wallet solution, that Member State shall take the measures set out in...

article-3-para-3.title: Article 3(3)
article-3-para-3.excerpt: Where a Member State becomes aware of information relating to a possible security breach or compromise possibly affecting the reliability of one or more wallet solutions provided by another Member State, that Member State shall, without undue delay, communicate to the Commission and the single...

article-3-para-4.title: Article 3(4)
article-3-para-4.excerpt: The Member State receiving information provided pursuant to paragraph 3 shall take the measures set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 without undue delay.

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that no wallet units are provided, used or activated under the suspended wallet solution.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall evaluate whether revoking wallet unit attestations of the wallet units affected by the suspension of a wallet solution, or any other additional remedy, is necessary to react adequately to the security breach or compromise.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: The measures set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be taken without undue delay, and in any event no later than 24 hours after the suspension of the provision and the use of the wallet solution affected by the security breach or compromise.

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: The measures set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not hinder affected wallet users from exercising their right to data portability set out in Article 5a(4), point (g) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. This is under the condition that this right may be exercised by wallet users without impairing the...

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Information in a clear, comprehensive and easily accessible manner about the suspension of the provision and the use of a wallet solution shall be provided, without undue delay and no later than 24 hours after the suspension of the provision and the use of the wallet solution, to: (a) the single...

article-5-para-1-point-d.title: Article 5(1)(d)
article-5-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) the wallet-relying parties registered in accordance with Article 5b of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: The information provided in accordance with paragraph 1 shall include at least the following: (a) the name of the provider of the wallet solution the provision and the use of which has been suspended;

article-5-para-2-point-b.title: Article 5(2)(b)
article-5-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the name and reference identifier of that wallet solution, as indicated in the list of certified wallets drawn up pursuant to Article 5d of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, and, where applicable, the concerned versions;

article-5-para-2-point-c.title: Article 5(2)(c)
article-5-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the date and time when the security breach or compromise was detected;

article-5-para-2-point-d.title: Article 5(2)(d)
article-5-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) if known, the date and time when the security breach or compromise became effective, based on network or system logs or other data sources;

article-5-para-2-point-e.title: Article 5(2)(e)
article-5-para-2-point-e.excerpt: (e) the date and time of the suspension of the wallet solution;

article-5-para-2-point-f.title: Article 5(2)(f)
article-5-para-2-point-f.excerpt: (f) contact details, including at least an email address and a telephone number for the notifying Member State, and, where different, for the wallet provider referred to in point (a);

article-5-para-2-point-g.title: Article 5(2)(g)
article-5-para-2-point-g.excerpt: (g) a description of the security breach or compromise;

article-5-para-2-point-h.title: Article 5(2)(h)
article-5-para-2-point-h.excerpt: (h) a description of the data compromised, including, where applicable, the categories of personal data as defined in Article 9(1) and Article 10 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679;

article-5-para-2-point-i.title: Article 5(2)(i)
article-5-para-2-point-i.excerpt: (i) where possible, an estimate of the approximate number of wallet users affected and of other natural persons affected;

article-5-para-2-point-j.title: Article 5(2)(j)
article-5-para-2-point-j.excerpt: (j) a description of the potential impacts on wallet-relying parties or on wallet users, and in the latter case, where relevant, any indications of measures that wallet users can take to mitigate those potential impacts;

article-5-para-2-point-k.title: Article 5(2)(k)
article-5-para-2-point-k.excerpt: (k) a description of the measures taken or planned to remedy the security breach or compromise, together with a planning and deadline for such remedy;

article-5-para-2-point-l.title: Article 5(2)(l)
article-5-para-2-point-l.excerpt: (l) where applicable and appropriate, a description of the measures taken or planned for transitioning wallet users affected to alternative wallet solutions or services.

article-6-para-1.title: Article 6(1)
article-6-para-1.excerpt: (1) re-establish the provision and use of the wallet units provided under that wallet solution by issuing a wallet unit provided under a new version of the wallet solution to all affected users;

article-6-para-2.title: Article 6(2)
article-6-para-2.excerpt: (2) issue new wallet unit attestations to new wallet units or, where applicable, to previously issued wallet units, provided those wallet units fulfil the security requirements in place after the security breach or compromise is remedied;

article-6-para-3.title: Article 6(3)
article-6-para-3.excerpt: (3) repeal any measure implemented pursuant to Article 4 and hindering the provision of new wallet units under the affected wallet solution, where that measure was linked solely to the now remedied security breach or compromise.

article-7-para-1.title: Article 7(1)
article-7-para-1.excerpt: (1) information about that fact is provided without undue delay to all parties having received information on the suspension of the provision and the use of that wallet solution in accordance with Article 5(1).

article-7-para-2.title: Article 7(2)
article-7-para-2.excerpt: (2) information provided pursuant to point (1) shall include at least the elements referred to in Article 5(2), points (a), (b) and (f) to (h) and the following: (a) the date and time when the security breach or compromise was remedied;

article-7-para-2-point-b.title: Article 7(2)(b)
article-7-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the date and time of the re-establishment of the affected wallet solution, and, where appropriate, of the affected wallet units provided under that wallet solution;

article-7-para-2-point-c.title: Article 7(2)(c)
article-7-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) a description of the measures taken to remedy the security breach or compromise;

article-7-para-2-point-d.title: Article 7(2)(d)
article-7-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) a description of the potential residual impacts on wallet-relying parties or on wallet users, and in the latter case, where relevant, any indications of measures that wallet users can take to mitigate those potential residual impacts.

article-8-para-1.title: Article 8(1)
article-8-para-1.excerpt: If a security breach or compromise having led to the suspension of the provision and the use of a wallet solution is not remedied within three months after the date of suspension of the provision and the use of that wallet solution, the Member State providing that wallet solution shall ensure the...

article-8-para-2.title: Article 8(2)
article-8-para-2.excerpt: When a Member State withdraws a wallet solution, it shall ensure that: (a) the wallet unit attestations of the wallet unit of the affected wallet solution are revoked;

article-8-para-2-point-b.title: Article 8(2)(b)
article-8-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the wallet unit attestations cannot revert to a valid state;

article-8-para-2-point-c.title: Article 8(2)(c)
article-8-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) no new wallet unit attestation can be issued to existing wallet units provided under the affected wallet solution;

article-8-para-2-point-d.title: Article 8(2)(d)
article-8-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) no new wallet unit can be provided under the affected wallet solution.

article-8-para-3.title: Article 8(3)
article-8-para-3.excerpt: The measures set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not hinder affected wallet users from exercising their right to data portability set out in Article 5a(4) point (g) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. This is under the condition that this right may be exercised by wallet users without impairing the...

article-9-para-1.title: Article 9(1)
article-9-para-1.excerpt: Information in a clear, comprehensive and easily accessible manner about the withdrawal of a wallet solution shall be provided, without undue delay and no later than 24 hours after the withdrawal of the wallet solution, to: (a) the single points of contact designated pursuant to Article 46c(1) of...

article-9-para-1-point-d.title: Article 9(1)(d)
article-9-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) the wallet-relying parties registered in accordance with Article 5b of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

article-9-para-2.title: Article 9(2)
article-9-para-2.excerpt: Information provided in accordance with paragraph 1 shall include at least the following: (a) the name of the provider of the wallet solution which has been withdrawn;

article-9-para-2-point-b.title: Article 9(2)(b)
article-9-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the name and reference identifier of that wallet solution, as indicated on the list of certified wallets drawn up pursuant to Article 5d of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, and, where applicable, the concerned versions;

article-9-para-2-point-c.title: Article 9(2)(c)
article-9-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the date and time of the detection of the security breach or compromise that led to the withdrawal of the affected wallet solution because of its severity or because it was not remedied within three months;

article-9-para-2-point-d.title: Article 9(2)(d)
article-9-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) if known, the date and time when the security breach or compromise became effective, based on network or system logs or other data sources;

article-9-para-2-point-e.title: Article 9(2)(e)
article-9-para-2-point-e.excerpt: (e) the date and time of the withdrawal of the wallet solution and of the effective revocation of the wallet unit attestations of the wallet units provided under the wallet solution;

article-9-para-2-point-f.title: Article 9(2)(f)
article-9-para-2-point-f.excerpt: (f) whether the withdrawal is the result of the severity of the security breach or compromise or is the consequence of the security breach or compromise not being remedied;

article-9-para-2-point-g.title: Article 9(2)(g)
article-9-para-2-point-g.excerpt: (g) contact details, including at least an email address and a telephone number for the notifying Member State, and, where different, for the wallet provider referred to in point (a);

article-9-para-2-point-h.title: Article 9(2)(h)
article-9-para-2-point-h.excerpt: (h) a description of the security breach or compromise;

article-9-para-2-point-i.title: Article 9(2)(i)
article-9-para-2-point-i.excerpt: (i) a description of the data compromised, including, where applicable, the categories of personal data as specified in Article 9(1) and Article 10 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679;

article-9-para-2-point-j.title: Article 9(2)(j)
article-9-para-2-point-j.excerpt: (j) where possible, an estimate of the approximate number of wallet users affected and of other natural persons affected;

article-9-para-2-point-k.title: Article 9(2)(k)
article-9-para-2-point-k.excerpt: (k) a description of the potential impacts on wallet-relying parties or on wallet users, and in the latter case, where relevant, any indications of measures that wallet users can take to mitigate those potential impacts;

article-9-para-2-point-l.title: Article 9(2)(l)
article-9-para-2-point-l.excerpt: (l) a description of the measures taken or planned for transitioning wallet users affected to alternative wallet solutions or, where applicable and appropriate, alternative services.

annex-para-1.title: Annex Para 1
annex-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall base their assessment of a security breach or compromise on the following criteria:

annex-para-1-point-a.title: Annex Para 1 Point A
annex-para-1-point-a.excerpt: (a) the breach or compromise has caused or is capable of causing the death of a natural person or considerable damage to a natural person ’s health;

annex-para-1-point-b.title: Annex Para 1 Point B
annex-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) a successful suspectedly malicious or unauthorised access to the network and information systems of a wallet provider, of provider of validation mechanisms referred to in Article 5a(8) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, or of a provider of the electronic identification scheme under which a wallet...

annex-para-1-point-c.title: Annex Para 1 Point C
annex-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) a wallet solution, a validation mechanism referred to in Article 5a(8) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, or an electronic identification scheme under which a wallet solution is provided, or a part of them: is completely or projected to be completely unavailable to wallet users or wallet-relying...

annex-para-1-point-d.title: Annex Para 1 Point D
annex-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) it is suspected that more than 1 % of the wallet users or wallet-relying parties are impacted or are projected to be impacted by limited availability of the wallet solution, or of the services provided by concerned entities as regards the wallet solution;

annex-para-1-point-e.title: Annex Para 1 Point E
annex-para-1-point-e.excerpt: (e) there is a capability of compromise or there has been a compromise of physical access restricted to trusted personnel of concerned entities, or of the protection of such physical access, to one or more of the locations of network and information systems supporting the wallet solution, the...

annex-para-1-point-f.title: Annex Para 1 Point F
annex-para-1-point-f.excerpt: (f) the privacy, integrity, confidentiality or authenticity of data stored, transmitted or processed in the wallet solution is compromised, or is capable of being compromised, in one or more of the following ways: it has an impact on more than 1 % of the wallet users of the affected wallet solution...

annex-para-1-point-g.title: Annex Para 1 Point G
annex-para-1-point-g.excerpt: (g) the certification of the wallet solution has been cancelled or is projected to be cancelled;

annex-para-1-point-h.title: Annex Para 1 Point H
annex-para-1-point-h.excerpt: (h) the breach or compromise has caused or is capable of causing direct financial loss for a concerned entity, and that loss exceeds EUR 500000 or, where applicable, 5 % of the concerned entity ’s total annual turnover in the preceding financial year, whichever is lower.

annex-para-2.title: Annex Para 2
annex-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall not consider planned consequences of a maintenance operation carried out by or on behalf of the concerned entities, provided such maintenance operation:

annex-para-2-point-a.title: Annex Para 2 Point A
annex-para-2-point-a.excerpt: (a) has been notified in advance to potentially affected wallet users, wallet-relying parties and relevant competent supervisory bodies;

annex-para-2-point-b.title: Annex Para 2 Point B
annex-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) does not meet any of the criteria set out in paragraph 1 of this Annex.

annex-para-3.title: Annex Para 3
annex-para-3.excerpt: As regards to point (c) of paragraph 1, the duration of an incident affecting availability shall be measured from the moment the proper provision of the affected service is disrupted until the moment the service is restored and operational again. Where a concerned entity is unable to determine the...

annex-para-4.title: Annex Para 4
annex-para-4.excerpt: As regards point (d) of paragraph 1, limited availability of a service is considered to occur in particular when a service is considerably slower than the average response time, or where not all functionalities of a service are available. Where possible, objective criteria based on the average...

annex-para-5.title: Annex Para 5
annex-para-5.excerpt: To determine the direct financial losses resulting from a breach or compromise referred to in point (h) of paragraph 1, concerned entities shall take into account all financial losses incurred as a result of the incident, such as costs for replacement or relocation of software, hardware or...

preamble.title: Preamble
preamble.excerpt: Having regard to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union,

recitals.title: Recitals
recitals.excerpt: (1) The European Digital Identity Framework ('framework') set out in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 is a crucial component in the establishment of a secure and interoperable digital identity ecosystem across the Union. With the European Digital Identity Wallets ('wallets') as its cornerstone, the...

article-1.title: Article 1
article-1.excerpt: This Regulation lays down rules for reactions to security breaches of the wallets, of the validation mechanisms referred to in Article 5a(8) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, and of the electronic identification scheme under which the wallets are provided.

article-2.title: Article 2
article-2.excerpt: For the purpose of this Regulation, the following definitions apply:

article-3.title: Article 3
article-3.excerpt: Without prejudice to Directive (EU) 2022/2555 and to Regulations (EU) 2019/881 and (EU) 2024/2847, Member States shall duly consider the criteria set out in the Annex I to this Regulation to assess whether a security breach or compromise of a wallet solution, of the validation mechanisms referred...

article-4.title: Article 4
article-4.excerpt: Suspension of the provision and the use of wallets and other remedies

article-5.title: Article 5
article-5.excerpt: Information in a clear, comprehensive and easily accessible manner about the suspension of the provision and the use of a wallet solution shall be provided, without undue delay and no later than 24 hours after the suspension of the provision and the use of the wallet solution, to:

article-6.title: Article 6
article-6.excerpt: Re-establishment of the provision and the use of wallets

article-7.title: Article 7
article-7.excerpt: Where a Member State re-establishes a wallet solution, that Member State shall ensure that:

article-8.title: Article 8
article-8.excerpt: If a security breach or compromise having led to the suspension of the provision and the use of a wallet solution is not remedied within three months after the date of suspension of the provision and the use of that wallet solution, the Member State providing that wallet solution shall ensure the...

article-9.title: Article 9
article-9.excerpt: Information in a clear, comprehensive and easily accessible manner about the withdrawal of a wallet solution shall be provided, without undue delay and no later than 24 hours after the withdrawal of the wallet solution, to:

article-10.title: Article 10
article-10.excerpt: Member States shall send information set out in Articles 3, 5, 7 and 9 to the Commission and the single points of contact of the Member States designated pursuant to Article 46c(1) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, via the CIRAS operated by ENISA, or an equivalent system agreed by the Member States...

article-11.title: Article 11
article-11.excerpt: This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the

annex.title: Annex
annex.excerpt: Criteria for the assessment of a security breach or compromise

recital-1.title: Recital 1
recital-1.excerpt: (1) For the purposes of registering relying parties that intend to rely on European Digital Identity Wallets ('wallets') for the provision of digital public or private services, as required by Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, Member States should establish and maintain national registers of...

recital-2.title: Recital 2
recital-2.excerpt: (2) The Commission regularly assesses new technologies, practices, standards and technical specifications. To ensure the highest level of harmonisation among Member States for the development and certification of the wallets, the technical specifications set out in this Regulation rely on the work...

recital-3.title: Recital 3
recital-3.excerpt: (3) To ensure broad access to the registers and to achieve interoperability, Member States should set up both human and machine-readable interfaces that meet the technical specifications set out in this Regulation. Providers of wallet-relying party access certificates and wallet-relying party...

recital-4.title: Recital 4
recital-4.excerpt: (4) As registration policies provide clear guidance to the wallet-relying parties on the registration process, Member States should set out and publish the registration policies applicable to the national registers established in their territory.

recital-5.title: Recital 5
recital-5.excerpt: (5) The purpose of registering wallet-relying parties is to build trust in the use of the wallets through greater transparency. Therefore, Member States should make the relevant information available to the public in a manner that is both human and machine-readable. To this end, wallet-relying...

recital-6.title: Recital 6
recital-6.excerpt: (6) Further, for the purpose of transparency, wallet-relying parties should declare, whether they intend to rely upon electronic identification of natural persons.

recital-7.title: Recital 7
recital-7.excerpt: (7) To ensure that the registration process is cost-effective and proportionate to risk, registrars should set up online and, where applicable, automated registration processes for wallet-relying parties that are easy to use. Registrars should verify applications for registration without undue...

recital-8.title: Recital 8
recital-8.excerpt: (8) Member States are to ensure that the wallets are able to authenticate wallet-relying parties, irrespective of where they are established in the Union. For this purpose, wallet-relying parties should use wallet-relying party access certificates when they identify themselves to wallet units. To...

recital-9.title: Recital 9
recital-9.excerpt: (9) As set out in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, wallet-relying parties are not to request users to provide any data other than those indicated for the intended use of wallets during the registration process. Wallet users should be able to verify the registration data of wallet-relying parties. To...

recital-10.title: Recital 10
recital-10.excerpt: (10) To protect users against oversharing information with wallet-relying parties and warn them in such cases, Member States should include common access policies in their certificate policies that would enable a wallet solution to inform the wallet user whenever a wallet-relying party is asking...

recital-11.title: Recital 11
recital-11.excerpt: (11) To protect wallet users, registrars should be able to suspend or cancel the registration of any wallet-relying party without prior notice where the registrars have reason to believe that the registration contains information which is inaccurate, out of date or misleading; that the...

recital-12.title: Recital 12
recital-12.excerpt: (12) For the purpose of ex post monitoring, investigations by law enforcement and dispute handling, registrars should keep records of all the information provided by wallet-relying parties established in their national register for 10 years.

recital-13.title: Recital 13
recital-13.excerpt: (13) Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and, where relevant, Directive 2002/58/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council Directive 2002/58 apply to the personal data processing activities under this Regulation.

recital-14.title: Recital 14
recital-14.excerpt: (14) The European Data Protection Supervisor was consulted in accordance with Article 42(1) of Regulation (EU) 2018/1725 of the European Parliament and of the Council Regulation 2018/1725, and delivered its opinion on 31 January 2025.

recital-15.title: Recital 15
recital-15.excerpt: (15) The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the committee established by Article 48 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014,

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet-relying party ' means a relying party that intends to rely upon wallet units for the provision of public or private services by means of digital interaction;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and that the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' national register of wallet-relying parties ' means a national electronic register used by a Member State to make information on wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State publicly available as set out in Article 5b(5) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014;

article-2-para-11.title: Article 2(11)
article-2-para-11.excerpt: (11) ' provider of wallet-relying party access certificates ' means a natural or legal person mandated by a Member State to issue wallet-relying party access certificates to wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State;

article-2-para-12.title: Article 2(12)
article-2-para-12.excerpt: (12) ' wallet-relying party access certificate ' means a certificate for electronic seals or signatures authenticating and validating the wallet-relying party issued by a provider of wallet-relying party access certificates;

article-2-para-13.title: Article 2(13)
article-2-para-13.excerpt: (13) ' provider of person identification data ' means a natural or legal person responsible for issuing and revoking the person identification data and ensuring that the person identification data of a user is cryptographically bound to a wallet unit;

article-2-para-14.title: Article 2(14)
article-2-para-14.excerpt: (14) ' registrar of wallet-relying parties ' means the body responsible for establishing and maintaining the list of registered wallet-relying parties established in their territory and who has been designated by a Member State;

article-2-para-15.title: Article 2(15)
article-2-para-15.excerpt: (15) ' wallet-relying party registration certificate ' means a data object that describes the intended use of the relying party and indicates the attributes the relying party has registered to intend to request from users;

article-2-para-16.title: Article 2(16)
article-2-para-16.excerpt: (16) ' provider of wallet-relying party registration certificates ' means a natural or legal person mandated by a Member State to issue wallet-relying party registration certificates to wallet-relying parties registered in that Member State.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall establish and maintain at least one national register of wallet-relying parties with information regarding registered wallet-relying parties established in that Member State.

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: The register shall include at least the information set out in Annex I.

article-3-para-3.title: Article 3(3)
article-3-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall designate at least one registrar to manage and operate at least one national register of wallet-relying parties.

article-3-para-4.title: Article 3(4)
article-3-para-4.excerpt: Member States shall make the information set out in Annex I on registered wallet-relying parties publicly available online, both in human-readable form and in a form suitable for automated processing.

article-3-para-5.title: Article 3(5)
article-3-para-5.excerpt: The information referred to in paragraph 2 shall be available through a single common application programming interface ('API') and through a national website. It shall be electronically signed or sealed by or on behalf of the registrar, in accordance with the common requirements for a single API...

article-3-para-6.title: Article 3(6)
article-3-para-6.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the API referred to in paragraph 5 complies with the common requirements set out in Section 2 of Annex II.

article-3-para-7.title: Article 3(7)
article-3-para-7.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that the registers comply with the relevant common registration policies set out in Article 4.

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall lay down and publish one or more national registration policies applicable to the national registers established in their territory.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: Member States may include or reuse existing sectoral or national registration policies.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: The national registration policy shall include at least information on: (a) the identification and authentication procedures applicable to wallet-relying parties during the registration process;

article-4-para-3-point-b.title: Article 4(3)(b)
article-4-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) the required supporting documentation, regarding the identity, business registration, applicable entitlement or entitlements, and other relevant information on the wallet-relying party;

article-4-para-3-point-c.title: Article 4(3)(c)
article-4-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) the authentic sources or other official electronic records and where those sources or records can be relied upon to provide accurate data;

article-4-para-3-point-d.title: Article 4(3)(d)
article-4-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) any other information or other evidence required as part of the registration process;

article-4-para-3-point-e.title: Article 4(3)(e)
article-4-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) where applicable, the automated means of enabling wallet-relying parties to register or to update an existing registration;

article-4-para-3-point-f.title: Article 4(3)(f)
article-4-para-3-point-f.excerpt: (f) the redress mechanism available to wallet-relying parties under the laws and procedures of the Member State where the national register is established;

article-4-para-3-point-g.title: Article 4(3)(g)
article-4-para-3-point-g.excerpt: (g) the rules and procedures for the verification of the identity of the registered wallet-relying parties and of any other relevant information provided by that party.

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: The procedures and documentation referred to in paragraph 3, points (a) and (b), shall enable the wallet-relying parties to indicate which specific entitlement or entitlements it is acting under, as set out in Annex I.

article-4-para-5.title: Article 4(5)
article-4-para-5.excerpt: Where appropriate, the requirements set out in the national registration policy shall not impede an automated registration process.

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Wallet-relying parties shall at least provide the information set out in Annex I to national registers.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: Wallet-relying parties shall ensure that the information provided is accurate at the time of registration.

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: Wallet-relying parties shall update any information previously registered in the national register of wallet-relying parties without undue delay.

article-6-para-1.title: Article 6(1)
article-6-para-1.excerpt: Registrars shall establish easy to use electronic, and where possible, automated registration processes for wallet-relying parties.

article-6-para-2.title: Article 6(2)
article-6-para-2.excerpt: Registrars shall process applications for registration without undue delay and provide a response to the application for registration to the applicant within the timeframe defined in the applicable registration policy, using appropriate means and in accordance with the laws and procedures of the...

article-6-para-3.title: Article 6(3)
article-6-para-3.excerpt: Where possible, registrars shall verify in an automated manner: (a) the accuracy, validity, authenticity and integrity of the information required under Article 5;

article-6-para-3-point-b.title: Article 6(3)(b)
article-6-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) where applicable, the power of attorney of representatives of the wallet-relying parties drawn up and submitted in accordance with the laws and procedures of the Member State where the national register is established;

article-6-para-3-point-c.title: Article 6(3)(c)
article-6-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) the type of entitlement or entitlements of the wallet-relying parties as set out in Annex I;

article-6-para-3-point-d.title: Article 6(3)(d)
article-6-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) the absence of an existing registration in another national register.

article-6-para-4.title: Article 6(4)
article-6-para-4.excerpt: Registrars shall verify the information set out in paragraph 3 against the supporting documentation provided by the wallet-relying parties or against appropriate authentic sources or other official electronic records in the Member State where the national register is established and to which the...

article-6-para-5.title: Article 6(5)
article-6-para-5.excerpt: The verification of entitlements of wallet-relying parties referred to in paragraph 3, point (c) shall be carried out in accordance with Annex III.

article-6-para-6.title: Article 6(6)
article-6-para-6.excerpt: Where the registrar cannot verify the information in accordance with paragraphs 3 to 5, the registrar shall reject the registration.

article-6-para-7.title: Article 6(7)
article-6-para-7.excerpt: When a wallet-relying party no longer intends to rely upon wallet units for the provision of public or private services under a specific registration, it shall notify the relevant registrar without undue delay and request the cancellation of that registration.

article-7-para-1.title: Article 7(1)
article-7-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall authorise at least one certificate authority to issue wallet-relying party access certificates.

article-7-para-2.title: Article 7(2)
article-7-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall ensure that providers of wallet-relying party access certificates issue wallet-relying party access certificates exclusively to registered wallet-relying parties.

article-7-para-3.title: Article 7(3)
article-7-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall implement in a syntactically and semantically harmonised manner the certificate policies and certificate practice statements for the wallet-relying party access certificates, in accordance with the requirements set out in Annex IV.

article-8-para-1.title: Article 8(1)
article-8-para-1.excerpt: Member States may authorise at least one certificate authority to issue wallet-relying party registration certificates.

article-8-para-2.title: Article 8(2)
article-8-para-2.excerpt: Where a Member State authorised the issuance of a wallet-relying party registration certificate, that Member State shall; (a) require providers of wallet-relying party registration certificates to issue wallet-relying party registration certificates exclusively to registered wallet-relying parties;

article-8-para-2-point-b.title: Article 8(2)(b)
article-8-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) ensure that each intended use is expressed in the wallet-relying party registration certificates;

article-8-para-2-point-c.title: Article 8(2)(c)
article-8-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) ensure that wallet-relying party registration certificates include a general access policy, being syntactically and semantically harmonised across the Union, informing users that the wallet-relying party is only allowed to request the data specified in the registration certificates for the...

article-8-para-2-point-d.title: Article 8(2)(d)
article-8-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) ensure that providers of wallet solutions established in that Member State comply with the general access policy by informing users when a wallet-relying party requests data that is not specified in the registration certificates;

article-8-para-2-point-e.title: Article 8(2)(e)
article-8-para-2-point-e.excerpt: (e) implement wallet-relying party registration certificates in a syntactically and semantically harmonised manner and in line with the requirements set out in Annex V;

article-8-para-2-point-f.title: Article 8(2)(f)
article-8-para-2-point-f.excerpt: (f) implement dedicated certificate policies and certificate practice statements for the wallet-relying party registration certificates in accordance with the requirements set out in Annex V;

article-8-para-2-point-g.title: Article 8(2)(g)
article-8-para-2-point-g.excerpt: (g) ensure that wallet-relying parties provide a URL to the privacy policy regarding the intended use.

article-8-para-3.title: Article 8(3)
article-8-para-3.excerpt: The policy referred to in point (g) shall be expressed in the wallet-relying party registration certificate.

article-9-para-1.title: Article 9(1)
article-9-para-1.excerpt: Registrars shall suspend or cancel a registration of a wallet-relying party where such a suspension or cancellation is requested by a supervisory body pursuant to Article 46a(4), point (f) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

article-9-para-2.title: Article 9(2)
article-9-para-2.excerpt: Registrars may suspend or cancel a registration of a wallet-relying party where the registrars have reasons to believe one of the following: (a) the registration contains information, which is inaccurate, out of date or misleading;

article-9-para-2-point-b.title: Article 9(2)(b)
article-9-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the wallet-relying party is not compliant with the registration policy;

article-9-para-2-point-c.title: Article 9(2)(c)
article-9-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) the wallet-relying party is requesting more attributes than they have registered in accordance with Article 5 and Article 6;

article-9-para-2-point-d.title: Article 9(2)(d)
article-9-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) the wallet-relying party is otherwise acting in breach of Union or national law in a manner related to their role as wallet-relying party.

article-9-para-3.title: Article 9(3)
article-9-para-3.excerpt: Registrars shall suspend or cancel a registration of a wallet-relying party where the request for cancellation or suspension is made by the same wallet-relying party.

article-9-para-4.title: Article 9(4)
article-9-para-4.excerpt: When considering the suspension or cancellation in accordance with paragraph 2, the registrar shall conduct a proportionality assessment, taking into account the impact on the fundamental rights, security and confidentiality of the users in the ecosystem, as well as the severity of the disruption...

article-9-para-5.title: Article 9(5)
article-9-para-5.excerpt: Where the registration of a wallet-relying party is suspended or cancelled, the registrar shall inform the provider of the relevant wallet-relying party access certificates, the provider of the relevant wallet-relying party registration certificates, and the affected wallet-relying party of this...

article-9-para-6.title: Article 9(6)
article-9-para-6.excerpt: The provider of wallet-relying party access certificates and the provider of wallet -relying registration certificates, shall, where applicable, revoke without undue delay the wallet-relying party access certificates, and the wallet-relying party registration certificates, respectively, of the...

annex-i-para-1.title: Annex I(1)
annex-i-para-1.excerpt: Where applicable, the name of the wallet-relying party, as stated in an official record together with identification data of that official record.

annex-i-para-1-point-a.title: Annex I Para 1 Point A
annex-i-para-1-point-a.excerpt: (a) if none are applicable, paragraph 2 shall be used.

annex-i-para-2.title: Annex I(2)
annex-i-para-2.excerpt: Where applicable, a user -friendly name of the wallet-relying party that can be either a trade name or service name that is recognisable to the user.

annex-i-para-3.title: Annex I(3)
annex-i-para-3.excerpt: Where applicable, one or more identifiers of the wallet-relying party, as stated in an official record together with identification data of that official record, expressed as:

annex-i-para-3-point-a.title: Annex I Para 3 Point A
annex-i-para-3-point-a.excerpt: (a) an economic operators registration and identification ('EORI') number as referred to in Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No 1352/2013;

annex-i-para-3-point-b.title: Annex I Para 3 Point B
annex-i-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) a registration number as registered in a national business register;

annex-i-para-3-point-c.title: Annex I Para 3 Point C
annex-i-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) a legal entity identifier ('LEI') as referred to in Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2022/1860;

annex-i-para-3-point-e.title: Annex I Para 3 Point E
annex-i-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) an excise number as referred to in Article 2(12) of Council Regulation (EU) No 389/2012;

annex-i-para-3-point-g.title: Annex I Para 3 Point G
annex-i-para-3-point-g.excerpt: (g) an european unique identifier ('EUID') as referred to in Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2021/1042;

annex-i-para-4.title: Annex I(4)
annex-i-para-4.excerpt: The physical address where the wallet-relying party is established.

annex-i-para-5.title: Annex I(5)

article-1.title: Article 1
article-1.excerpt: This Regulation lays down rules for the registration of wallet-relying parties.

article-2.title: Article 2
article-2.excerpt: For the purposes of this Regulation, the following definitions apply:

article-3.title: Article 3
article-3.excerpt: Member States shall establish and maintain at least one national register of wallet-relying parties with information regarding registered wallet-relying parties established in that Member State.

article-4.title: Article 4
article-4.excerpt: Member States shall lay down and publish one or more national registration policies applicable to the national registers established in their territory.

article-6.title: Article 6
article-6.excerpt: Registrars shall establish easy to use electronic, and where possible, automated registration processes for wallet-relying parties.

article-7.title: Article 7
article-7.excerpt: Member States shall authorise at least one certificate authority to issue wallet-relying party access certificates.

article-8.title: Article 8
article-8.excerpt: Member States may authorise at least one certificate authority to issue wallet-relying party registration certificates.

article-9.title: Article 9
article-9.excerpt: Registrars shall suspend or cancel a registration of a wallet-relying party where such a suspension or cancellation is requested by a supervisory body pursuant to Article 46a(4), point (f) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and that the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' provider of person identification data ' means a natural or legal person responsible for issuing and revoking the person identification data and ensuring that the person identification data of a user is cryptographically bound to a wallet unit.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)

article-3-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall submit the information required under paragraph 1 at least in English.

article-3-para-3.excerpt: Where there are any changes to the submitted information, including changes to the certification status of the wallets, Member States shall submit the updated information through the channel referred to in paragraph 1.
