article-1-para-1.title: Article 1(1)
article-1-para-1.excerpt: Where a Member State makes a pre- notification of an electronic identification scheme to the Commission and to the other Member States, the peer review shall be initiated in accordance with Article 2.

article-1-para-2.title: Article 1(2)
article-1-para-2.excerpt: The Member State that makes a pre- notification of an electronic identification scheme may, at any point, withdraw its pre- notification. Where the Member State withdraws their pre- notification of the electronic identification scheme, the peer review shall be considered as terminated.

article-1-para-3.title: Article 1(3)
article-1-para-3.excerpt: Any Member State may decide to participate in the peer review of the electronic identification scheme of another Member State.

article-1-para-4.title: Article 1(4)
article-1-para-4.excerpt: Each Member State involved in a peer review shall bear the costs it incurs in the process.

article-1-para-5.title: Article 1(5)
article-1-para-5.excerpt: Representatives of the Member States that conduct the peer review shall use the information obtained through the peer review solely for the purposes of that review and shall not disclose any sensitive or confidential information obtained during the peer review to third parties.

article-1-para-6.title: Article 1(6)
article-1-para-6.excerpt: A Member State that decides to participate in the peer review of an electronic identification scheme of another Member State shall disclose any conflict of interest in relation to representatives appointed by that Member State. Where there is a conflict of interest, the Member State whose...

article-1-para-7.title: Article 1(7)
article-1-para-7.excerpt: Any disputes arising during the peer review in relation to the peer review activities as laid down in Article 4(4) of this Regulation shall be settled in accordance with the Cooperation Group ’s rules of procedure.

article-1-para-8.title: Article 1(8)
article-1-para-8.excerpt: An electronic identification scheme shall not be subject to further peer review within two years from the conclusion of a peer review, except where significant changes set out in Article 6(1) were made to the peer-reviewed electronic identification scheme.

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: The pre- notification shall include at least: (a) a comparison between the pre-notified electronic identification scheme and requirements laid down in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502, under the form of a level of assurance mapping document for the peer review in accordance with Annex I to...

article-2-para-1-point-b.title: Article 2(1)(b)
article-2-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) a high-level description of the electronic identification scheme, of its ecosystem and of electronic identification in the Member State having made the pre- notification, under the form of a whitepaper in accordance with Annex II to this Regulation;

article-2-para-1-point-c.title: Article 2(1)(c)
article-2-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) information regarding interoperability of the electronic identification scheme and the requirements laid down in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1501, under the form of an interoperability framework mapping document in accordance with the template set out in Annex III to this Regulation.

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: The Commission shall disseminate the pre- notification information to the Cooperation Group.

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: The information required under paragraph 1, point (c), shall be provided at least in English. Member States shall not be obliged to translate any document where this would create an unreasonable administrative or financial burden.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)
article-3-para-1.excerpt: (a) one coordinator who shall be responsible for organising the peer review and managing communication with Member States, the Cooperation Group and the Commission;

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: (b) up to three rapporteurs depending on the scope of the peer review and each one of them to lead a working group as referred to in Article 4(2);

article-3-para-3.title: Article 3(3)
article-3-para-3.excerpt: (c) at least one active member per working group, who shall assist in generating questions and providing feedback to the rapporteurs and contribute to drafting the final peer review report.

article-3-para-4.title: Article 3(4)
article-3-para-4.excerpt: After the Member State having made the pre- notification has given the presentation referred to in paragraph 3, the other Member States may appoint representatives to participate in the peer review on their behalf. If they do so, they shall provide the names and contact details of their...

article-3-para-5.title: Article 3(5)
article-3-para-5.excerpt: The coordinator referred to in paragraph 4, point (a), shall oversee proper execution of the peer review and monitor compliance with the procedural requirements set out in this Regulation. To that end, the coordinator shall carry out the following tasks in a timely manner: (a) organisation of the...

article-3-para-5-point-c.title: Article 3(5)(c)
article-3-para-5-point-c.excerpt: (c) drafting of the opinion on the peer reviewed electronic identification scheme.

article-3-para-6.title: Article 3(6)
article-3-para-6.excerpt: The rapporteurs referred to in paragraph 4, point (b), shall identify questions for the Member State having made the pre- notification and draft the elements of the peer review report that relate to the area of responsibility of their respective working group.

article-3-para-7.title: Article 3(7)
article-3-para-7.excerpt: Taking into account the guidance provided by the Cooperation Group, the Member State having made the pre- notification and the Member States involved in the peer review shall agree on any organisational arrangements relating to the peer review not specifically provided for in this Regulation,...

article-3-para-8.title: Article 3(8)
article-3-para-8.excerpt: The duration of the peer review shall not exceed three months from the official start date of the peer review referred to in paragraph 3 and may be extended by a maximum of two months where all Member States involved in the peer review agree to do so.

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: The peer review group shall conduct the peer review based on the information provided in accordance with Article 2(1) by the Member State having made the pre- notification.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: The peer review shall be organised in three working groups, or using any other process agreed in the Cooperation Group in accordance with its Rules of Procedure. Where working groups are used, each working group shall be composed of one rapporteur and at least one active member.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: The working groups referred to in paragraph 2 shall be the following: (a) an enrolment working group, peer-reviewing the alignment of the pre-notified electronic identification scheme with the requirements in relation to enrolment as set out in section 2.1 of the Annex to Implementing Regulation...

article-4-para-3-point-b.title: Article 4(3)(b)
article-4-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) an electronic identification means management and authentication working group, peer-reviewing the alignment of the pre-notified electronic identification scheme with the requirements in relation to electronic identification means management and authentication as set out in sections 2.2 and 2.3...

article-4-para-3-point-c.title: Article 4(3)(c)
article-4-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) a management and organisation working group peer-reviewing the alignment of the pre-notified electronic identification scheme with the requirements in relation to management and organisation as set out in section 2.4 of Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502.

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: The peer review shall include, but is not limited to, one or more of the following activities: (a) assessment of relevant documentation provided by the Member State having made the pre- notification;

article-4-para-4-point-b.title: Article 4(4)(b)
article-4-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) examination of processes described as part of that documentation;

article-4-para-4-point-d.title: Article 4(4)(d)
article-4-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) consideration of independent third-party assessments, where relevant assessments of this kind are available;

article-4-para-4-point-e.title: Article 4(4)(e)
article-4-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) drafting of the peer review report that summarises the peer review’s findings and results.

article-4-para-5.title: Article 4(5)
article-4-para-5.excerpt: The working groups may make duly justified requests for additional information, supported by additional documentation, from the Member State having made the pre- notification where the information provided in accordance with Article 2(1) is not sufficient, for the termination of the peer review.

article-4-para-6.title: Article 4(6)
article-4-para-6.excerpt: The Member State having made the pre- notification shall comply with such requests except where one of the following applies: (a) it does not possess the information or documentation and obtaining it would generate an unreasonable administrative burden;

article-4-para-6-point-b.title: Article 4(6)(b)
article-4-para-6-point-b.excerpt: (b) the information or documentation requested concerns matters of public security or national security;

article-4-para-6-point-c.title: Article 4(6)(c)
article-4-para-6-point-c.excerpt: (c) the information concerns business matters, professional or company secrets;

article-4-para-6-point-d.title: Article 4(6)(d)
article-4-para-6-point-d.excerpt: (d) the sensitivity of the information makes it impossible to establish a secure channel to communicate the information to the members of the peer review group.

article-4-para-7.title: Article 4(7)
article-4-para-7.excerpt: In such cases, the Member State having made the pre- notification shall inform the coordinator of the reasons for refusing to provide the requested information or documentation and shall provide a high-level summary of the information or a redacted version of the documentation.

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Without prejudice to Article 3(9), the peer review group shall: (a) provide a draft peer review report to the Member State having made the pre- notification no later than three months after the start date of the peer review referred to in Article 3(3) unless the peer review is subject to an...

article-5-para-1-point-b.title: Article 5(1)(b)
article-5-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) provide the draft final peer review report to the Commission and the Cooperation Group after taking into consideration any observations from the Member State having made the pre- notification on the content of the draft peer review report, and no later than three months and two weeks after the...

article-5-para-1-point-c.title: Article 5(1)(c)
article-5-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) provide the Member State having made the pre- notification with a draft opinion on the pre-notified electronic identification scheme no later than three months and two weeks after the official start date of the peer review referred to in Article 3(3) unless the peer review is subject to an...

article-5-para-1-point-d.title: Article 5(1)(d)
article-5-para-1-point-d.excerpt: (d) provide the Commission and the Cooperation Group with a draft final opinion on the pre-notified electronic identification scheme no later than three months and three weeks after the start date of the peer review referred to in Article 3 (3) unless the peer review is subject to an extension in...

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: Before the Cooperation Group adopts and publishes, on a dedicated website of the Commission, its final opinion on the conclusion of the peer review in accordance with paragraph 9, it may require additional information or clarification from the Member State having made the pre- notification or from...

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: The Member State having made the pre- notification shall provide the required additional information referred to in paragraph 2, except where one of the following applies: (a) the Member State does not possess the information and obtaining it would cause an unreasonable administrative burden;

article-5-para-3-point-b.title: Article 5(3)(b)
article-5-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) the information concerns matters of public or national security;

article-5-para-3-point-c.title: Article 5(3)(c)
article-5-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) the information concerns matters of business, professional or company secrets;

article-5-para-3-point-d.title: Article 5(3)(d)
article-5-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) the sensitivity of the information makes it impossible to establish a secure channel to communicate the information to the Cooperation Group.

article-5-para-4.title: Article 5(4)
article-5-para-4.excerpt: The final peer review report shall list the information that was requested by the peer review group or by the Cooperation Group but could not be provided on one or more grounds set out in paragraph 3, without specifying the reasons provided by the Member State having made the pre- notification. The...

article-5-para-5.title: Article 5(5)
article-5-para-5.excerpt: The peer review group shall present the final peer review report and its draft final opinion to the Cooperation Group no later than four months, or in the case of prolongation in accordance with Article 3(8) no later than six months after the official start date of the peer review pursuant to...

article-5-para-6.title: Article 5(6)
article-5-para-6.excerpt: The final opinion of the peer review group on the electronic identification scheme of the Member State having made the pre- notification shall list any commitments made by that Member State.

article-5-para-7.title: Article 5(7)
article-5-para-7.excerpt: After the presentation of the final peer review report and the final opinion of the peer review group, the Cooperation Group shall adopt and publish its own opinion on the conclusion of the peer review, indicating if and how the peer-reviewed electronic identification scheme meets the requirements...

article-5-para-8.title: Article 5(8)
article-5-para-8.excerpt: The opinion of the Cooperation Group shall identify the Member State having made the pre- notification as well as the pre-notified electronic identification scheme and its assurance level. The opinion shall also state whether the peer review was completed successfully.

article-5-para-9.title: Article 5(9)
article-5-para-9.excerpt: Information provided in accordance with Article 2(1) shall be published by the Cooperation Group, except where the Member State that provided the information has indicated in writing that such information should not be made public.

article-6-para-1.title: Article 6(1)
article-6-para-1.excerpt: Where a notified electronic identification scheme changes in a manner that is likely to impact its interoperability, security or trustworthiness, the Member State having made the notification shall without undue delay notify the Cooperation Group of those changes and update the information...

article-6-para-2.title: Article 6(2)
article-6-para-2.excerpt: Following the receipt of a notification referred to in paragraph 1, and provided the notified electronic identification scheme has been peer-reviewed, any Member State of the Cooperation Group may request an update to the peer review.

article-6-para-3.title: Article 6(3)
article-6-para-3.excerpt: In case of a request for an update, the procedures set out in Articles 3 to 5 shall apply accordingly and the peer review group shall limit the peer review to the elements that have been changed pursuant to the original notification and to the impacts of those changes.

annex-i-para-1.title: Annex I(1)
annex-i-para-1.excerpt: (1) general information, including: (a) the name of the notifying Member State;

annex-i-para-1-point-b.title: Annex I Para 1 Point B
annex-i-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) the title of the electronic identification scheme (if any);

annex-i-para-1-point-c.title: Annex I Para 1 Point C
annex-i-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) the level or levels of assurance of the electronic identification scheme, indicated as low, substantial or high.

annex-i-para-2.title: Annex I(2)
annex-i-para-2.excerpt: (2) the authority or authorities responsible for the electronic identification scheme, including: (a) the name or names of the authority or authorities responsible for the electronic identification scheme;

annex-i-para-2-point-b.title: Annex I Para 2 Point B

annex-i-para-3-point-c.title: Annex I Para 3 Point C

annex-i-para-3-point-d.title: Annex I Para 3 Point D

annex-i-para-4.title: Annex I(4)
annex-i-para-4.excerpt: (4) a description of the electronic identification scheme, including: (a) where applicable, the document or documents that shall be enclosed for each of the following topics: a brief description of the electronic identification scheme, including the context in which it operates, its scope, and...

annex-i-para-4-point-b.title: Annex I Para 4 Point B
annex-i-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) the applicable supervisory, liability and management regime, including: a description of the supervisory regime of the electronic identification scheme including the evaluation process with respect to the following:

annex-i-para-4-point-c.title: Annex I Para 4 Point C
annex-i-para-4-point-c.excerpt: (c) a description of the electronic identification scheme components, including: a description of how the requirements in relation to minimum technical specifications and procedures for assurance levels for electronic identification means, as set out in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502, have...

annex-i-para-4-point-d.title: Annex I Para 4 Point D
annex-i-para-4-point-d.excerpt: (d) a description of how interoperability and minimum technical and operational security requirements are met;

annex-i-para-4-point-e.title: Annex I Para 4 Point E
annex-i-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) a list of all the supporting documentation submitted and a statement to which of the elements above they relate, including references to any domestic legislation which relates to the electronic identification provision relevant to the notification and relevant audit reports, certification...

annex-i-para-4-point-f.title: Annex I Para 4 Point F
annex-i-para-4-point-f.excerpt: (f) the relevant documents and information as regards the certification of the electronic identification scheme pursuant to Article 12a(1) and, where applicable, to Article 12a(5), of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.

annex-iii-para-1.title: Annex III(1)
annex-iii-para-1.excerpt: A minimum data set of person identification data uniquely representing a natural or a legal person shall meet the requirements set out in the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1501 when used in a cross-border context.

annex-iii-para-2.title: Annex III(2)
annex-iii-para-2.excerpt: A minimum data set for a natural person representing a legal person shall contain the combination of the attributes listed in the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1501 for natural persons and legal persons when used in a cross-border context.

annex-iii-para-3.title: Annex III(3)
annex-iii-para-3.excerpt: Data shall be transmitted based on original characters and, where appropriate, also transliterated into Latin characters.

annex-iii-para-4.title: Annex III(4)
annex-iii-para-4.excerpt: (d) flexibility to meet the needs of additional attributes relating to identification.

annex-iv-para-3.title: Annex IV(3)
annex-iv-para-3.excerpt: agreed to organise the peer review of the eID scheme according to Article 46e(5)(d) of the European Digital Identity Regulation and Implementing Regulation (EU) 2025/1568;

annex-iv-para-5.title: Annex IV(5)
annex-iv-para-5.excerpt: agreed which topics the peer review process would cover and how it would be organised according to the provisions of Implementing Regulation (EU) 2025/1568.

article-1-para-1.title: Article 1(1)
article-1-para-1.excerpt: (1) qualified electronic attestations of attributes;

article-1-para-2.excerpt: (2) electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source;

article-1-para-3.excerpt: (3) the list of providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source;

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: (1) ' wallet unit ' means a unique configuration of a wallet solution that includes wallet instances, wallet secure cryptographic applications and wallet secure cryptographic devices provided by a wallet provider to an individual wallet user;

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: (2) ' wallet user ' means a user who is in control of the wallet unit;

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: (3) ' catalogue of attributes ' means a digital repository of attributes that is maintained and published online by the Commission;

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: (4) ' scheme for the attestation of attributes ' means a set of rules applicable to one or more types of electronic attestation of attributes;

article-2-para-5.title: Article 2(5)
article-2-para-5.excerpt: (5) ' type of electronic attestation of attributes ' means a specifically named and semantically described group of electronic attestation of attributes;

article-2-para-6.title: Article 2(6)
article-2-para-6.excerpt: (6) ' catalogue of schemes for the attestation of attributes ' means a digital repository listing schemes for the attestation of attributes registered in accordance with this Regulation and that is maintained [and published online] by the Commission;

article-2-para-7.title: Article 2(7)
article-2-para-7.excerpt: (7) ' wallet solution ' means a combination of software, hardware, services, settings, and configurations, including wallet instances, one or more wallet secure cryptographic applications and one or more wallet secure cryptographic devices;

article-2-para-8.title: Article 2(8)
article-2-para-8.excerpt: (8) ' wallet instance ' means the application installed and configured on a wallet user ’s device or environment, which is part of a wallet unit, and which the wallet user uses to interact with the wallet unit;

article-2-para-9.title: Article 2(9)
article-2-para-9.excerpt: (9) ' wallet secure cryptographic application ' means an application that manages critical assets by being linked to and using the cryptographic and non-cryptographic functions provided by the wallet secure cryptographic device;

article-2-para-10.title: Article 2(10)
article-2-para-10.excerpt: (10) ' wallet secure cryptographic device ' means a tamper-resistant device that provides an environment that is linked to and used by the wallet secure cryptographic application to protect critical assets and provide cryptographic functions for the secure execution of critical operations;

article-2-para-11.title: Article 2(11)
article-2-para-11.excerpt: (11) ' wallet provider ' means a natural or legal person who provides wallet solutions;

article-2-para-12.title: Article 2(12)
article-2-para-12.excerpt: (12) ' critical assets ' means assets within or in relation to a wallet unit of such extraordinary importance that where their availability, confidentiality or integrity are compromised, this would have a very serious, debilitating effect on the ability to rely on the wallet unit;

article-2-para-13.title: Article 2(13)
article-2-para-13.excerpt: (13) ' owner of a scheme for the attestation of attributes ' means an entity responsible for establishing and maintaining a scheme for the attestation of attributes.

article-3-para-1.title: Article 3(1)

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: Where providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source issue electronic attestations of attributes which are included in schemes registered in the...

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source shall have written and publicly accessible policies relating to validity or revocation status...

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source shall be the only entities able to revoke the electronic attestations of attributes they issue.

article-4-para-3.excerpt: Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source, whenever those attestations are issued with a validity period of more than 24 hours, shall revoke...

article-4-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) where it is known to the provider that there has been a compromise of the security or trustworthiness of the qualified electronic attestations of attributes or electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source;

article-4-para-3-point-c.title: Article 4(3)(c)
article-4-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) in other situations, as required by Union or national law, or as determined by the providers in their policies as referred to in paragraph 1.

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source shall set up revocation techniques and management methods that are privacy preserving and hindering...

article-4-para-5.excerpt: Providers of qualified electronic attestations of attributes and providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source shall make available to relying parties information on the validity or revocation status of the...

article-5-para-1.title: Article 5(1)
article-5-para-1.excerpt: Member States shall submit at least the information set out in Annex III on public sector bodies as referred to in Article 45f (3) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 through a secure electronic notification system provided by the Commission.

article-5-para-2.title: Article 5(2)
article-5-para-2.excerpt: Member States shall notify any changes to the notified information.

article-5-para-3.title: Article 5(3)
article-5-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall make the notifications at least in English. Member States shall not be obliged to translate any document supporting the notifications where this would create an unreasonable administrative or financial burden.

article-5-para-4.title: Article 5(4)
article-5-para-4.excerpt: The Commission may, where appropriate, ask the Member States to provide additional information.

article-6-para-1.title: Article 6(1)
article-6-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall establish, maintain, and publish a list of providers of electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source on the basis of the information notified by Member States pursuant to Article 5.

article-6-para-2.title: Article 6(2)
article-6-para-2.excerpt: The Commission shall ensure that the list referred to in paragraph 1 can be accessed: (a) in both electronically signed or sealed form suitable for automated processing, and through a human-readable website;

article-6-para-2-point-b.title: Article 6(2)(b)
article-6-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) without the need to register or to be authenticated;

article-6-para-2-point-c.title: Article 6(2)(c)
article-6-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) only by using state of the art transport layer security.

article-6-para-3.title: Article 6(3)
article-6-para-3.excerpt: The Commission shall publish through a secure channel and without undue delay: (a) the technical specifications of the list;

article-6-para-3-point-b.title: Article 6(3)(b)
article-6-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) the details of the URL where the list is published;

article-6-para-3-point-c.title: Article 6(3)(c)
article-6-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) the certificates to be used to verify the electronic signature or seal on the list;

article-6-para-3-point-d.title: Article 6(3)(d)
article-6-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) details relating to the mechanisms used to validate future changes to the location or to the certificates referred to in points (b) and (c).

article-7-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall establish and publish a catalogue of attributes and set up a secure system to enable requests to include or modify attributes in the catalogue of attributes.

article-7-para-2.title: Article 7(2)
article-7-para-2.excerpt: The Commission shall assess requests made using the system referred to in paragraph 1 to include or modify an attribute in the catalogue of attributes, after considering any advice provided by the Cooperation Group. The Commission’s assessment shall, take into account whether the inclusion of the...

article-7-para-3.excerpt: Member States shall request the inclusion of attributes listed in Annex VI to Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 to the catalogue of attributes wherever those attributes rely on authentic sources for the purpose of the verification by qualified trust service providers.

article-7-para-4.title: Article 7(4)
article-7-para-4.excerpt: In addition, Member States may request the inclusion of attributes not listed in Annex VI to the catalogue of attributes wherever those attributes rely on authentic sources within the public sector. Private entities that are considered to be a primary source of information or recognised as...

article-7-para-5.excerpt: The request to include or to modify an attribute in the catalogue shall contain at least the following information: (a) identification of the entity making the request;

article-7-para-5-point-b.title: Article 7(5)(b)
article-7-para-5-point-b.excerpt: (b) where applicable, a reference to Union or national law or administrative practice under which the entity making the request is considered to be a primary source of information or recognised authentic source.

article-7-para-5-point-c.title: Article 7(5)(c)
article-7-para-5-point-c.excerpt: (c) if the request refers to an attribute already existing in the catalogue or is a new attribute;

article-7-para-5-point-d.title: Article 7(5)(d)
article-7-para-5-point-d.excerpt: (d) a namespace for the identifier of the attributes, the value of which is unique within the catalogue of attributes;

article-7-para-5-point-e.title: Article 7(5)(e)
article-7-para-5-point-e.excerpt: (e) an identifier of the attribute, unique within the namespace, and the version of the attribute;

article-7-para-5-point-h.title: Article 7(5)(h)
article-7-para-5-point-h.excerpt: (h) the verification point for the attribute at national level or a link to a description on how to initiate the verification requests.

article-7-para-6.title: Article 7(6)
article-7-para-6.excerpt: The request to include or modify an attribute shall be signed or sealed by the requester by means of a qualified electronic signature or seal or an advanced electronic signature or seal based on a qualified certificate.

article-7-para-7.title: Article 7(7)
article-7-para-7.excerpt: The Commission, following the assessment referred to in paragraph 2 and having verified that the information provided in the request for the inclusion or modification of an attribute includes all the information listed in paragraph 5, may include the requested attribute or modification in the...

article-7-para-8.title: Article 7(8)
article-7-para-8.excerpt: The catalogue of attributes sealed by the Commission shall be publicly accessible, through a secure channel, free of charge and without prior identification or authentication, and shall be published in both machine-readable and human-readable forms. article-7-para-9.title: Article 7(9)
article-7-para-9.excerpt: The Commission shall publish the technical specifications the Commission uses for the catalogue of attributes.

article-7-para-10.title: Article 7(10)
article-7-para-10.excerpt: The Commission shall issue a unique identifier to each registered attribute.

article-8-para-1.title: Article 8(1)
article-8-para-1.excerpt: The Commission shall establish and publish a catalogue of schemes for the attestation of attributes and set up a secure system to enable requests to include or modify schemes for the attestation of attributes in the catalogue of schemes for the attestation of attributes.

article-8-para-2.title: Article 8(2)
article-8-para-2.excerpt: Requests to include or modify schemes for the attestation of attributes in the catalogue of schemes for the attestation of attributes shall be assessed by the Commission, after considering any advice provided by the Cooperation Group. article-8-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) the name and contact information of the scheme for the attestation of attributes owner;

article-8-para-3-point-d.excerpt: (d) a reference to specific laws, standards or guidelines, where the issuance, validation, or use of an electronic attestation of attributes within the scope of the scheme is subject to them;

article-8-para-3-point-e.title: Article 8(3)(e)
article-8-para-3-point-e.excerpt: (e) the format or formats of electronic attestation of attributes within the scope of the scheme;

article-8-para-3-point-f.title: Article 8(3)(f)
article-8-para-3-point-f.excerpt: (f) one or more namespaces, attribute identifiers, semantic descriptions and data types of each attribute that is part of an electronic attestation of attributes within the scope of the scheme, either by reference to an attribute in the catalogue of attributes in Article 7, or an attribute defined...

article-8-para-3-point-g.excerpt: (g) a description of the trust model and the governance mechanisms applied under the scheme, including the revocation mechanisms;

article-8-para-3-point-h.excerpt: (h) any requirements concerning the providers of the electronic attestations of attributes or the sources of information on which those providers rely when issuing electronic attestations of attributes, including any authentic sources, if applicable;

article-8-para-3-point-i.excerpt: (i) a statement whether electronic attestations of attributes within the scope of the scheme are to be issued as qualified electronic attestations of attributes, as electronic attestations of attributes issued by or on behalf of a public sector body responsible for an authentic source, or as both.

article-8-para-5.excerpt: The Commission, following the assessment referred to in paragraph 2 and having verified that the information provided in the request for the inclusion or modification of an attestation scheme contains all the information listed in paragraphs 3 and 4 may include the requested scheme or modification...

article-8-para-6.excerpt: The catalogue of schemes for the attestation of attributes, sealed by the Commission, shall be publicly accessible, through a secure channel, free of charge and without prior identification or authentication, and shall be machine-readable and human-readable. article-8-para-7.excerpt: The Commission shall publish the technical specifications the Commission uses for the catalogue of schemes for the attestation of attributes.

article-8-para-8.title: Article 8(8)
article-8-para-8.excerpt: The Commission shall issue a unique identifier to each registered scheme for the attestation of attributes.

article-2-para-1.title: Article 2(1)
article-2-para-1.excerpt: The risk management policies referred to in Article 19a(1) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall clearly identify the trust services they apply to, shall be specific to the trust services concerned and shall be approved by the management body of the non- qualified trust service provider.

article-2-para-2.title: Article 2(2)
article-2-para-2.excerpt: The risk management policies shall include at least all the following elements: (a) the overall risk tolerance level in accordance with the criticality and required level of security of the trust services, having regard to the latest technological developments;

article-2-para-2-point-b.title: Article 2(2)(b)
article-2-para-2-point-b.excerpt: (b) the relevant risk criteria, including at least the likelihood, impact and level of the risk, taking into account cyber threat intelligence and vulnerabilities;

article-2-para-2-point-c.title: Article 2(2)(c)
article-2-para-2-point-c.excerpt: (c) an approach for the identification and documentation of the risks to the provision of the trust services, taking into account the complete scope of the information system used by the non- qualified trust service provider, including risks associated with the components of the system as well as...

article-2-para-2-point-d.title: Article 2(2)(d)
article-2-para-2-point-d.excerpt: (d) a process for the evaluation of the identified risks based on the risk criteria referred to in point (b);

article-2-para-2-point-e.title: Article 2(2)(e)
article-2-para-2-point-e.excerpt: (e) a process for the identification, prioritisation and continuous monitoring of the implementation of appropriate risk treatment measures;

article-2-para-2-point-f.title: Article 2(2)(f)
article-2-para-2-point-f.excerpt: (f) a process for continuous monitoring of the implementation of the risk management policies.

article-2-para-3.title: Article 2(3)
article-2-para-3.excerpt: Non- qualified trust service providers shall establish appropriate procedures and maintain documents to ensure that the requirements set out in the applicable legislation are implemented.

article-2-para-4.title: Article 2(4)
article-2-para-4.excerpt: Non- qualified trust service providers shall establish appropriate documented procedures ensuring the monitoring of Union and national legislative and regulatory changes that may impact the provision of trust services.

article-3-para-2.title: Article 3(2)
article-3-para-2.excerpt: (b) identify potential single point of failure in the provision of the trust services;

article-3-para-3.title: Article 3(3)
article-3-para-3.excerpt: (c) evaluate the identified risks based on the risk criteria referred to in Article 2(2), point (b).

article-4-para-1.title: Article 4(1)
article-4-para-1.excerpt: In accordance with the policies referred to in Article 2, non- qualified trust service providers shall plan, document and implement risk treatment measures, and shall, in particular, carry out the following tasks: (a) identify and prioritise appropriate risk treatment measures;

article-4-para-1-point-b.title: Article 4(1)(b)
article-4-para-1-point-b.excerpt: (b) select, approve and document the chosen risk treatment measures, including their security requirements and operational procedures, in a risk treatment plan, identify who is responsible for implementing the risk treatment measures and when they are to be implemented;

article-4-para-1-point-c.title: Article 4(1)(c)
article-4-para-1-point-c.excerpt: (c) continuously monitor the implementation of the risk treatment measures.

article-4-para-2.title: Article 4(2)
article-4-para-2.excerpt: The risk treatment plan set out in paragraph 1, point (b), shall provide reasons justifying the acceptance of residual risks in a comprehensible manner.

article-4-para-3.title: Article 4(3)
article-4-para-3.excerpt: As part of the risk treatment measures referred to in paragraph 1, non- qualified trust service providers shall also: (a) verify, where applicable, the identity of the users of the trust service directly or by means of a third party and publish information on the identity verification methods used;

article-4-para-3-point-b.title: Article 4(3)(b)
article-4-para-3-point-b.excerpt: (b) for the purposes of providing evidence in legal proceedings and of ensuring service continuity, record and securely retain for as long as necessary in accordance with Union or national laws, including after the activities of the non- qualified trust service provider have ceased, the following...

article-4-para-3-point-c.title: Article 4(3)(c)
article-4-para-3-point-c.excerpt: (c) ensure, where applicable, that authentication data assigned to the user of the trust service are unique.

article-4-para-4.title: Article 4(4)
article-4-para-4.excerpt: When identifying, selecting, approving and prioritising appropriate risk treatment measures, non- qualified trust service providers shall take into account the following elements: (a) the results of the risk evaluation referred to in Article 3;

article-4-para-4-point-b.title: Article 4(4)(b)
article-4-para-4-point-b.excerpt: (b) the effectiveness of the risk treatment measures;

article-4-para-4-point-e.title: Article 4(4)(e)
article-4-para-4-point-e.excerpt: (e) the cost of implementation in relation to the expected benefit;

article-4-para-4-point-g.title: Article 4(4)(g)
article-4-para-4-point-g.excerpt: (g) the analysis of any business impact of the risks identified in accordance with Article 3.

article-4-para-5.title: Article 4(5)
article-4-para-5.excerpt: The management bodies of non- qualified trust service providers shall approve the residual risks remaining after the implementation of the risk treatment measures as set out in the risk treatment plan.

article-4-para-6.title: Article 4(6)
article-4-para-6.excerpt: Non- qualified trust service providers shall review, document and, where appropriate, update the risk evaluation results and the risk treatment plan at planned intervals, and at least annually, and when significant changes to the infrastructure, operations or risks, or significant incidents, occur.

article-4-para-7.title: Article 4(7)
article-4-para-7.excerpt: Non- qualified trust service providers shall ensure the availability, integrity and confidentiality of the information referred to in paragraph 3, point (b).

article-3-para-1-point-g.title: Article 3(1)(g)

what-is-the-difference-between-non-quali.title: What Is The Difference Between Non Qualified And Qualified Trust Service Providers
what-is-the-difference-between-non-quali.excerpt: The eIDAS Regulation defines a qualified trust service provider ( QTSP ) as "[…] a natural or a legal person who provides one or more qualified trust services […]".

why-is-a-qualified-trust-service-provide.title: Why Is A Qualified Trust Service Provider Tagged With Non Qualified Trust Services
why-is-a-qualified-trust-service-provide.excerpt: A qualified trust service provider ( QTSP ) must provide at least one qualified trust service, but may also provide non- qualified trust services. That is the reason why some QTSP may be tagged with qualified and non- qualified trust services in the Trusted List Browser.
